src: Gādājiet, lai jūsu roka būtu cik vien iespējams atbrīvota, bet tai pašā laikā visas notis spēlētu pareizi; mēģiniet arī neveikt liekas kustības ar pirkstiem. Tādā veidā jūs nogurdināsiet sevi pēc iespējas mazāk. Atcerieties, ka papildu skaļumam, piemēram, uz klavierēm, nav nepieciešams spiest taustiņus ar lielu spēku. Spēlējot akordeonu, skaļuma palielināšanai plēšas tiek vilktas ar lielāku spiedienu vai ātrumu.
mt: 1. Keep your hands as free of tension as possible, but let all the movements play correctly; try not to move your fingers at all. This will help you relax as much as possible. Remember that you don't need to press the keys on the piano very hard to make them louder. To make the sound louder on the accordion, the bellows are pulled with more pressure or speed.
ref: Make sure your hand is as relaxed as possible while still hitting all the notes correctly - also try not to make much extraneous motion with your fingers. This way, you will tire yourself out as little as possible. Remember there's no need to hit the keys with a lot of force for extra volume like on the piano. On the accordion, to get extra volume, you use the bellows with more pressure or speed.

src: Viena no izplatītākajām problēmām, mēģinot filmu pārveidot DVD formātā, ir attēla izvērse. Vairākums televīzijas programmu ir veidotas tā, lai izpatiktu plašai sabiedrībai. Šī iemesla dēļ viss, ko jūs redzat TV ekrānā, ir iepriekš apgriezts no augšas, apakšas un sāniem. Tas tiek darīts, lai nodrošinātu, ka attēls aptver visu ekrānu. To sauc par attēla izvērsi. Diemžēl, kad veidojat DVD, visticamāk, tiks nogrieztas arī tā apmales, un, ja videoklipam subtitri ir pārāk tuvu apakšai, tie netiks pilnībā parādīti.
mt: One of the most common problems in trying to convert a video to DVD format is the aspect ratio. Most television programs are designed to be viewed by the general public. This is why everything you see on TV is flipped upside down, sideways, and backwards. This is done to ensure that the image covers the entire screen. It is called the aspect ratio. Unfortunately, when you convert a video to DVD, the aspect ratio will be flipped as well, and if the subtitles are too close to the bottom, they will not be fully displayed.
ref: One of the most common problems when trying to convert a movie to DVD format is the overscan. Most televisions are made in a way to please the general public. For that reason, everything you see on the TV had the borders cut, top, bottom and sides. This is made to ensure that the image covers the whole screen. That is called overscan. Unfortunately, when you make a DVD, it's borders will most likely be cut too, and if the video had subtitles too close to the bottom, they won't be fully shown.

src: "Amerikāņu plāns balstījās uz koordinētu uzbrukumu sākšanu no trim dažādām pusēm. Ģenerālis Džons Kadvalders uzsāktu novirzīšanas uzbrukumu pret britu garnizonu Bordentaunā, lai neļautu tiem saņemt papildspēkus. Ģenerālis Džeims Evings pie ""Trenton Ferry"" pārceltu pāri upei 700 karavīrus, ieņemtu tiltu pāri Asunpinkas pietekai un neļautu izbēgt ienaidnieku karaspēkiem. Galvenie uzbrukuma spēki, kas sastāv no 2400 vīriem, šķērsotu upi deviņas jūdzes uz ziemeļiem no Trentonas un pēc tam sadalītos divās grupās, viena būtu Grīna un otra Salivana pakļautībā, ar nolūku sākt uzbrukumu pirms rītausmas."
mt: "The American plan was based on a coordinated attack from three different directions. General John Cadwalader would launch a diversionary attack against the British garrison at Bordentown to prevent them from receiving reinforcements. General James Ewing would ferry 700 troops across the river at Trenton Ferry, seize the bridge over the Assunpink Creek, and prevent the enemy troops from escaping. The main attack force, consisting of 2400 men, would cross the river nine miles north of Trenton and then split into two groups, one under Greene and the other under Sullivan, with the objective of launching an attack before dawn."
ref: The American plan relied on launching coordinated attacks from three different directions. General John Cadwalder would launch a diversionary attack against the British garrison at Bordentown, in order to block off any reinforcements. General James Ewing would take 700 militia across the river at Trenton Ferry, seize the bridge over the Assunpink Creek and prevent any enemy troops from escaping. The main assault force of 2,400 men would cross the river nine miles north of Trenton, and then split into two groups, one under Greene and one under Sullivan, in order to launch a pre-dawn attack.

src: "Pēc tās pieņemšanas Kongresā 4. jūlijā, Kongresa prezidenta Džona Hankoka un sekretāra Čārlza Tomsona ar roku parakstītais dokumenta projekts tika nosūtīts Džona Dunlapa tipogrāfijai, kas atradās pāris kvartālus tālāk. Nakts laikā tika izgatavoti no 150 līdz 200 eksemplāriem, kas tagad ir zināmi kā ""Dunlap broadsides"" (Neatkarības deklarācija). Pirmo publisko dokumenta lasījumu veica Džons Niksons Neatkarības pils pagalmā 8. jūlijā. Viens eksemplārs 6. jūlijā tika nosūtīts Džordžam Vašingtonam, un 9. jūlijā viņš to nolasīja savam karapulkam Ņujorkā. Viens eksemplārs 10. augustā sasniedza Londonu. 25 ""Dunlap broadsides"", par kurām zināms, ka tās joprojām pastāv, ir visvecākās saglabājušās dokumenta kopijas. Oriģinālais, ar roku rakstītais eksemplārs nav saglabājies."
mt: 4 July, after its passage by Congress, the document was sent to the John Dunlap printing house, which was a few blocks away. At night, 150 to 200 copies were produced, which are now known as the "Dunlap broadsides" (Declaration of Independence). The first public reading of the document was by John Nixon in the Independence Hall courtyard on 8 July. One copy was sent to George Washington on 6 July, and he read it to his troops in New York on 9 July. One copy reached London on 10 August. 25 "Dunlap broadsides", of which it is known that they still exist, are the oldest surviving document copies. The original, handwritten copy has not survived.
ref: "After its adoption by Congress on July 4, a handwritten draft signed by the President of Congress John Hancock and the Secretary Charles Thomson was then sent a few blocks away to the printing shop of John Dunlap. Through the night between 150 and 200 copies were made, now known as ""Dunlap broadsides"". The first public reading of the document was by John Nixon in the yard of Independence Hall on July 8. One was sent to George Washington on July 6, who had it read to his troops in New York on July 9. A copy reached London on August 10. The 25 Dunlap broadsides still known to exist are the oldest surviving copies of the document. The original handwritten copy has not survived."

src: Kolonisti, redzot šo darbību, arī bija izsaukuši palīgspēkus. Karaspēki, kas pastiprināja priekšējās pozīcijas, ietvēra 1. un 3. Ņūhempšīras pulku ar 200 vīriem pulkvežu Džona Starka un Džeimsa Rīda vadībā (vēlāk abi kļuva par ģenerāļiem). Starka vīri ieņēma pozīcijas gar žogu ziemeļu galā no kolonistu pozīcijām. Kad bēgums pavēra plaisu gar Mistikas upi gar pussalas ziemeļaustrumu daļu, viņi ātri uz ziemeļiem izstiepa žogu ar īsu akmens sienu, kas beidzās pie ūdens daļas nelielā pludmalē. Gridlijs vai Stārks nolika pie sētas apmēram 100 pēdas (30 m) augstu mietu un pavēlēja, lai neviens nešauj, kamēr garām paiet armijas karavīri.
mt: The colonists, seeing this action, also called for reinforcements. Troops that strengthened the front lines included the 1st and 3rd New Hampshire Regiments of 200 men under the command of John Stark and James Reed (later both became generals). Stark's men took positions along the river north of the colonists' positions. When the retreat broke through the river at the northern part of the peninsula, they quickly extended the line to the north with a short stone wall ending at the water part of a small beach. Gridley or Stark placed a seat about 100 feet (30 m) high in a tree and ordered no one to fire while the army troops passed by.
ref: The Colonists, seeing this activity, had also called for reinforcements. Troops reinforcing the forward positions included the 1st and 3rd New Hampshire regiments of 200 men, under Colonels John Stark and James Reed (both later became generals). Stark's men took positions along the fence on the north end of the Colonist's position. When low tide opened a gap along the Mystic River along the northeast of the peninsula, they quickly extended the fence with a short stone wall to the north ending at the water's edge on a small beach. Gridley or Stark placed a stake about 100 feet (30 m) in front of the fence and ordered that no one fire until the regulars passed it.

src: Senajā Ķīnā bija unikāls veids, kā attēlot atšķirīgus laika periodus; ikviens Ķīnas attīstības posms vai ikviena ģimene, kas bija pie varas, bija atšķirīga dinastija. Turklāt starp katru dinastiju bija nestabils dalītu provinču periods. Pazīstamākais no šiem periodiem bija Trīs karaļvalstu ēra, kas ilga 60 gadus starp Han un Jiņ dinastijām. Šajos periodos daudzu dižciltīgo starpā notika nežēlīga cīņa par troni. Trīs valstu posms bija viens no asiņainākajiem laikmetiem Senās Ķīnas vēsturē, tūkstošiem cilvēku gāja bojā, cīnoties par svarīgāko vietu Siaņas lielajā pilī.
mt: In ancient China, there was a unique way to represent different periods of time; each stage of Chinese development or each family that was in power was a different dynasty. Furthermore, between each dynasty was an unstable period of divided provinces. The most famous of these periods was the Three Kingdoms era, which lasted 60 years between the Han and Jin dynasties. In these periods, the nobility fought a brutal battle for the throne. The Three Kingdoms period was one of the bloodiest times in the history of ancient China, thousands of people died fighting for the most important position in the palace of Sian.
ref: Ancient China had a unique way of showing different time periods; each stage of China or each family that was in power was a distinctive dynasty. Also between each dynasty was an unstable age of divided provinces. The best-known of these periods was the Three Kingdoms epoch taking place for 60 years between the Han and the Jin Dynasty. During these periods fierce warfare took place between many nobles fighting for the throne. The Three Kingdoms was one of the bloodiest eras in Ancient China’s history thousands of people died fighting to sit in the highest seat in the grand palace at Xi’an.

src: Arī armijas skudru kolonijas soļo un veido pūžņus dažādās fāzēs. Klejošanas laikā marabunta skudras pārvietojas naktī un veido apmetni dienā. Kolonija sāk klejotāju fāzi, kad pieejamā pārtika ir samazinājusies. Šajā fāzē kolonija veido pagaidu perēkļus, kas tiek mainīti katru dienu. Ikviena šāda klejošana vai pārgājieni ilgst aptuveni 17 dienas.
mt: Army ant colonies march and form mounds in different phases. During the marching phase, marabunta ants move at night and form a nest during the day. The colony begins the marching phase when the available food has decreased. In this phase, the colony forms temporary nests that are changed every day. Each such marching or migration lasts about 17 days.
ref: Army ant colonies march and nest in different phases as well. In the nomadic phase, army ants march at night and stop to camp during the day. The colony begins a nomadic phase when available food has decreased. During this phase, the colony makes temporary nests that are changed everyday. Each of these nomadic rampages or marches lasts for approximately 17 days.

src: Endogēno ciklu klātesamībai un to veidošanās procesam, ņemot vērā bioloģisko pulksteni, nereti ir izšķiroša ietekme uz daudziem novērotajiem ritmiem psiholoģijā un uzvedībā. Periodiskie ritmi, kas nav vienkārši atbilde uz ārējiem periodiskajiem signāliem, ir apstiprināti lielākajai daļai dzīvo radību, tostarp baktērijām, sēnēm, augiem un dzīvniekiem. Bioloģiskie pulksteņi ir pašuzturoši oscilatori, kuri turpina brīvi darboties arī bez ārējiem ierosinātājiem.
mt: Endogenous cycle entrainment and its generation process, taking into account the biological clock, often has a decisive effect on many observed rhythms in psychology and behavior. Periodic rhythms that are not simply a response to external periodic signals have been confirmed for most living organisms, including bacteria, fungi, plants, and animals. Biological clocks are self-sustaining oscillators that continue to operate freely even without external triggers.
ref: Many observed rhythms in physiology and behavior often crucially depend on the presence of endogenous cycles and their production through biological clocks. Periodic rhythms, which are not simply responses to external periodic cues, have been documented for most living beings, including bacteria, fungi, plants, and animals. Biological clocks are self sustaining oscillators which will continue a period of free-running cycling even in the absence of external cues.

src: Populācija ir konkrētas sugas organismu kopa noteiktā ģeogrāfiskā teritorijā. Ja visi populācijas indivīdi ir identiski attiecībā uz konkrētu fenotipa pazīmi, tie ir monomorfi. Ja indivīdiem ir vairāki konkrētās pazīmes varianti, tie ir polimorfi.
mt: A population is a group of organisms of the same species living in the same area. If all individuals of a population are identical with respect to a particular phenotypic trait, they are monomorphic. If individuals have multiple variants of a particular trait, they are polymorphic.
ref: A population is the collection of organisms of a particular species within a given geographic area. When all individuals in a population are identical with regard to a particular phenotypic trait they are known as monomorphic. When the individuals show several variants of a particular trait they are polymorphic.

src: Dabas tūrisms saista tādus cilvēkus, kuri interesējas par dabisku teritoriju apmeklēšanu, lai baudītu ainavas, tostarp augus un savvaļas dzīvniekus. Šajās vietās var nodarboties, piemēram, ar medībām, zvejošanu, fotografēšanu, putnu vērošanu, vai arī apmeklēt parkus un pētīt informāciju par ekosistēmu. Kā piemēru var minēt Borneo salas apmeklējumu, lai uzņemtu fotogrāfijas un iepazītu orangutānus.
mt: Nature tourism is the act of visiting natural areas, including forests, grasslands, deserts, tundra, island, coastal, or mountain ecosystems, in order to enjoy scenic attractions, as well as to educate the visitor and preserve the areas visited for future use. As an example, one can visit Borneo to take pictures and see orangutans.
ref: Nature-based tourism attracts people interested in visiting natural areas for the purpose of enjoying the scenery, including plant and animal wildlife. Examples of on-site activities include hunting, fishing, photography, bird watching, and visiting parks and studying information about the ecosystem. An example is visiting, photographing, and learning about organgatuangs in Borneo.

src: Ik rītu cilvēki no mazajām lauku pilsētām ar automašīnām dodas uz savām darbavietām, savukārt viņu vietā ierodas citi, kuru darbavieta atrodas tajā vietā, no kuras viņi ir tikko aizbraukuši. Šajā dinamiskajā transporta autobusā ikviens ir kaut kādā veidā saistīts un atbalsta transporta sistēmu, kas balstās uz privātām automašīnām. Tagad zinātnieki norāda uz to, ka ekonomika ar tik apjomīgu oglekļa emisiju ir izjaukusi vienu no biosfēras stabilajiem stāvokļiem, kas pēdējos divus miljonus gadu ir balstījis cilvēku evolūciju.
mt: Every morning people from small rural towns drive to their jobs in cars, while others take their place, whose workplace is in the place from which they have just left. In this dynamic transport bus everyone is somehow connected and supports the transport system based on private cars. Now scientists point out that the economy with such a large carbon emission has destroyed one of the biosphere's stable states that has been based on human evolution for the past two million years.
ref: Every morning, people leave small country towns in cars to go their workplace and are passed by others whose work destination is the place they have just left. In this dynamic transport shuttle everyone is somehow connected with, and supporting, a transport system based on private cars. Science now indicates that this massive carbon economy has dislodged the biosphere from one of its stable states that has supported human evolution for the past two million years.

src: Atomu var uzskatīt par vienu no visas matērijas pamatelementiem. Tas ir ļoti sarežģīts veidojums, kas saskaņā ar vienkāršoto Bora modeli sastāv no centrālā kodola, ap ko elektroni riņķo līdzīgi kā planētas ap Sauli — sk. 1.1. attēlu. Kodols sastāv no divām daļiņām - neitroniem un protoniem. Protoniem piemīt pozitīvs elektriskais lādiņš, bet neitroniem lādiņš nepiemīt. Elektroniem piemīt negatīvs elektriskais lādiņš.
mt: An atom can be considered one of the basic elements of all matter. It is a very complex structure, which according to the simple Bohr model consists of a central nucleus, around which electrons orbit like planets around the Sun - see Figure 1.1. The nucleus consists of two particles - neutrons and protons. Protons have a positive electric charge, but neutrons have no charge. Electrons have a negative electric charge.
ref: The atom can be considered to be one of the fundamental building blocks of all matter. Its a very complex entity which consists, according to a simplified Bohr model, of a central nucleus orbited by electrons, somewhat similar to planets orbiting the sun - see Figure 1.1. The nucleus consists of two particles - neutrons and protons. Protons have a positive electric charge while neutrons have no charge. The electrons have a negative electric charge.

src: Atomu var uzskatīt par vienu no visas matērijas pamatelementiem. Tas ir ļoti sarežģīts veidojums, kas saskaņā ar vienkāršoto Bora modeli sastāv no centrālā kodola, ap ko elektroni riņķo līdzīgi kā planētas ap Sauli — sk. 1.1. attēlu. Kodols sastāv no divām daļiņām - neitroniem un protoniem. Protoniem piemīt pozitīvs elektriskais lādiņš, bet neitroniem lādiņš nepiemīt. Elektroniem piemīt negatīvs elektriskais lādiņš.
mt: An atom can be considered one of the basic elements of all matter. It is a very complex structure, which according to the simple Bohr model consists of a central nucleus, around which electrons orbit like planets around the Sun - see Figure 1.1. The nucleus consists of two particles - neutrons and protons. Protons have a positive electric charge, but neutrons have no charge. Electrons have a negative electric charge.
ref: The atom can be considered to be one of the fundamental building blocks of all matter. Its a very complex entity which consists, according to a simplified Bohr model, of a central nucleus orbited by electrons, somewhat similar to planets orbiting the sun - see Figure 1.1. The nucleus consists of two particles - neutrons and protons. Protons have a positive electric charge while neutrons have no charge. The electrons have a negative electric charge.

src: Gandrīz visi mūsdienās izmantotie datori ir balstīti uz manipulācijām ar informāciju, kas tiek kodēta bināro skaitļu formā. Binārajam skaitlim var būt tikai divas vērības, proti, 0 vai 1, un šos skaitļus sauc par binārcipariem, jeb datorvalodā – par bitiem.
mt: Almost all modern computers are based on manipulations of information encoded in binary form. A binary digit can have only two values, 0 or 1, and these digits are called binary digits or bits in computer jargon.
ref: Virtually all computers in use today are based on the manipulation of information which is coded in the form of binary numbers. A binary number can have only one of two values, i.e. 0 or 1, and these numbers are referred to as binary digits - or bits, to use computer jargon.

src: "Emuāri var arī palīdzēt uzlabot skolēnu rakstīšanas prasmes. Lai arī bieži vien sākumā, kad skolēni uzsāk emuāru rakstīšanu, viņi nepievērš uzmanību gramatikai un pareizrakstībai, taču lasītāju klātbūtne parasti to maina. Tā kā studenti bieži vien ir viskritiskāk noskaņotā mērķauditorija, emuāra autors sāk pūlēties uzlabot savu rakstību, lai izvairītos no kritikas. Turklāt emuāru rakstīšana ""liek studentiem plašāk izzināt apkārtējo pasauli."" Nepieciešamība uzturēt lasītāju interesi motivē studentus būt atjautīgiem un interesantiem (Toto, 2004. g.). Emuāru rakstīšana ir paņēmiens, kas veicina sadarbību un stimulē skolēnus mācīties arī ārpus mācību stundām skolā. Emuāru atbilstoša izmantošana ""var stimulēt studentus kļūt analītiskākiem un domāt kritiski. Aktīvi izmantojot internetā pieejamos materiālus studenti var nodefinēt savu nostāju citu rakstītā satura kontekstā, kā arī izteikt savu skatījumu par konkrētiem jautājumiem (Oravec, 2002. g.)."
mt: "Emuāri var arī palīdzēt uzlabot skolēnu rakstīšanas prasmes. Lai arī bieži vien sākumā, kad skolēni uzsāk emuāru rakstīšanu, viņi nepievērš uzmanību gramatikai un pareizrakstībai, taču lasītāju klātbūtne parasti to maina. Tā kā studenti bieži vien ir viskritiskāk noskaņotā mērķauditorija, emuāra autors sāk pūlēties uzlabot savu rakstību, lai izvairītos no kritikas. Turklāt emuāru rakstīšana ""liek studentiem plašāk izzināt apkārtējo pasauli."" Nepieciešamība uzturēt lasītāju interesi motivē studentus būt atjautīgiem un interesantiem (Toto, 2004. g.). Emuāru rakstīšana ir paņēmiens, kas veicina sadarbību un stimulē skolēnus mācīties arī ārpus mācību stundām skolā. Emuāru atbilstoša izmantošana ""var stimulēt studentus kļūt analītiskākiem un domāt kritiski. Aktīvi izmantojot internetā pieejamos materiālus studenti var nodefinēt savu nostātu citu rakstītā satura kontekstā, kā arī izteikt savu skatījumu par konkrētiem jautājumiem (Oravec, 2002. g.)."
ref: "Blogs can also help improve student writing. While students often begin their blog experience with sloppy grammar and spelling, the presence of an audience generally changes that. Since students are often the most critical audience, the blog writer begins to strive to improve writing to avoid criticism. Also blogging ""forces students to become more savvy about the world around them."" The need to feed the interest of the audience inspires students to be clever and interesting (Toto, 2004). Blogging is a tool that inspires collaboration, and encourages students to extend learning well beyond the traditional school day. Appropriate use of blogs ""can empower students to become more analytical and critical; through actively responding to Internet materials, students can define their positions in the context of others' writings as well as outline their own perspectives on particular issues (Oravec, 2002)."

src: Asinhronā komunikācija dod laiku pārdomāt un reaģēt uz citu teikto. Tas dod studentiem iespēju strādāt savā tempā un kontrolēt, cik daudz mācību informācijas viņi saņem. Turklāt ir mazāk laika ierobežojumu un iespēja strādāt elastīgas darba stundas (Bremer, 1998. g.) Interneta un tīmekļa izmantošana ļauj izglītojamajiem jebkurā laikā piekļūt informācijai. Studenti var arī iesniegt jautājumus pasniedzējiem jebkurā diennakts laikā un sagaidīt samērā ātras atbildes, nevis gaidīt nākamo klātienes tikšanos.
mt: Asynchronous communication allows time to think and react to what is said. This gives students the opportunity to work at their own pace and control how much learning information they receive. There are fewer time constraints and the ability to work flexible hours (Bremer, 1998). The use of the Internet and the World Wide Web allows students to access information at any time. Students can also submit questions to instructors at any time of the day and wait for relatively quick responses, rather than waiting for the next class meeting.
ref: Asynchronous communication encourages time for reflection and reaction to others. It allows students the ability to work at their own pace and control the pace of instructional information. In addition, there are fewer time restrictions with the possibility of flexible working hours. (Bremer, 1998) The use of the Internet and the World Wide Web allows learners to have access to information at all times. Students can also submit questions to instructors at any time of day and expect reasonably quick responses, rather than waiting until the next face-to-face meeting.

src: Tradicionālā viduslaiku pils jau sen ir iedvesmojusi iztēli, uzburot bruņinieku divkauju, goda mielastu un Karaļa Artura laika bruņniecības attēlus. Pat stāvot tūkstošiem gadu senās drupās, ir viegli iedomāties sen notikušo cīņu skaņas un smakas, gandrīz sadzirdēt pakavu klaudzoņu uz bruģakmeņiem un sajust no cietuma kamerām plūstošās bailes. Taču, vai mūsu iztēle balstās uz realitāti? Kādēļ vispār cēla pilis? Kā tās tika projektētas un būvētas?
mt: The traditional medieval castle has long inspired the image of knights dueling, feasting and the chivalry of King Arthur's time. Even standing in the ruins of a thousand-year-old castle, it is easy to imagine the sounds and smells of the battle, almost hear the clanging of swords on the cobblestones and feel the fear of the prison cells. But why did castles exist in the first place? How were they designed and built?
ref: The traditional medieval castle has long inspired the imagination, conjuring up images of jousts, banquets and Arthurian chivalry. Even standing amidst thousand year-old ruins it is easy to bring to mind the sounds and smells of battles long gone, to almost hear the clatter of hooves on the cobbles and to smell the fear rising from the dungeon pits. But is our imagination based on reality? Why were castles built in the first place? How were they designed and built?

src: Laikmetam raksturīgā Kirbi Mukslo pils drīzāk ir nocietināta māja nekā īsta pils. Tā lielo stikla logu un plāno sienu dēļ tas nevarētu ilgi izturēt apņēmīgu uzbrukumu. 15. gs. astoņdesmitajos gados, kad lords Heistingss uzsāka tās būvniecību, valstī valdīja relatīvs miers un aizsardzība bija nepieciešama tikai pret nelielām klaiņojošu marodieru bandām.
mt: 15th century Kirby Muxloe castle is more of a fortified house than a true castle. Its large glass windows and flat walls would not have lasted long under a determined attack. In the 15th century, when Lord Hastings began its construction, the country was relatively peaceful and defense was only needed against small marauding bands.
ref: Typical for the period, Kirby Muxloe Castle is more of a fortified house than a true castle. Its large glazed windows and thin walls would not have been able to resist a determined attack for long. In the 1480s, when its construction was begun by Lord Hastings, the country was relatively peaceful and defense was only required against small bands of roving marauders.

src: Skrējiena distancei pieaugot no ceturtdaļjūdzes līdz pusjūdzei, ātruma nozīme krietni samazinās un par absolūtu nepieciešamību kļūst izturība. Protams, pirmklasīgam pusjūdzes skrējējam — cilvēkam, kas šo distanci var noskriet ātrāk nekā divās minūtēs, — ir jābūt gana ātram, taču izturība ir jāattīsta jebkurā gadījumā. Labākais veids, kā sagatavoties skriešanas sezonai, ir ziemā skriet krosu un sporta zālē trenēt ķermeņa augšdaļu.
mt: As the distance increases from a quarter to a half marathon, the speed meaning decreases and the need for endurance increases. Of course, a first-class half marathon runner — a person who can run this distance faster than two minutes — must be very fast, but endurance must be trained in any case. The best way to prepare for the running season is to run a cross in winter and train the upper body in a sports hall.
ref: With the change from the quarter to the half mile run, speed becomes of much less importance and endurance becomes an absolute necessity. Of course a first-class half-miler, a man who can beat two minutes, must be possessed of a fair amount of speed, but endurance must be cultivated at all hazards. Some cross country running during the winter, combined with gymnasium work for the upper part of the body, is the best preparation for the running season.

src: Tikai ar pareizu uzturvielu uzņemšanu vien nevar nodrošināt augstas meistarības sniegumu, tomēr tā var ievērojami ietekmēt jauno atlētu vispārējo sagatavotību. Uzturot veselīgu enerģijas līdzsvaru, praktizējot efektīvus ūdens uzņemšanas paradumus un izprotot dažādus sporta uztura bagātinātāju lietošanas aspektus, atlēti var uzlabot savu sniegumu un vairāk izbaudīt sportošanu.
mt: Only with proper nutrition can you ensure high performance, but it can significantly affect the overall preparation of a young athlete. To maintain a healthy energy balance, practicing effective water intake protocols and understanding the various aspects of sports nutrition, athletes can improve their performance and enjoy sports more.
ref: Proper nutritional practices alone cannot generate elite performances, but they can significantly affect young athletes' overall wellness. Maintaining a healthy energy balance, practicing effective hydration habits, and understanding the various aspects of supplementation practices can help athletes improve their performance and increase their enjoyment of the sport.

src: Vidējo distanču skriešana ir relatīvi lēts sporta veids, taču pastāv daudzi nepareizi priekšstati par dažām inventāra lietām, kas nepieciešamas, lai piedalītos. Ja nepieciešams, produktus var iegādāties, taču tie tikai nedaudz ietekmēs izpildījumu vai neietekmēs to nemaz. Sportisti, iespējams, dod priekšroku kādam izstrādājumam, taču tas nedod nekādus reālus ieguvumus.
mt: Long-distance running is a relatively cheap sport, but there are many misconceptions about some of the equipment needed to participate. If needed, the products can be purchased, but they only slightly affect performance or not affect it at all. Athletes may prefer one product over another, but it doesn't give any real benefits.
ref: Middle distance running is a relatively inexpensive sport; however, there are many misconceptions regarding the few pieces of equipment required to participate. Products can be purchased as needed, but most will have little or no real impact on performance. Athletes may feel that they prefer a product even when it provides no real benefits.

src: MRI darbības pamatā ir fizikāls fenomens, ko sauc par kodolmagnētisko rezonansi (KMR), kuru 1930. gados atklāja Fēlikss Blohs (strādāja Stenforda Universitātē) un Edvards Parsels (no Hārvarda Universitātes). Šajā rezonansē magnētiskais lauks un viļņi liek atomiem raidīt niecīgus radio signālus. 1970. gadā ārsts un pētnieks Reimonds Dameidians atklāja pamatu magnētiskās rezonanses attēlveides izmantošanai, lai uzstādītu diagnozi. Četrus gadus vēlāk tika piešķirts pasaulē pirmais MRI jomā izsniegtais patents. 1977. gadā dr. Dameidians pabeidza pirmā visa ķermeņa MR skenera, ko viņš sauca par „Nelokāmo”, izveidi.
mt: The MRI process is based on a physical phenomenon called nuclear magnetic resonance (NMR), which was discovered in 1930 by Felix Bloch (working at Stanford University) and Edward Purcell (from Harvard University). In this resonance, a magnetic field and waves cause atoms to emit faint radio signals. In 1970, physician and researcher Raymond Damadian discovered the basis for using magnetic resonance imaging to make a diagnosis. Four years later, the first MRI patent was issued in the world in the field of diagnosis. In 1977, Dr. Damadian completed the first whole-body MR scanner, which he called the "Unflipping", creation.
ref: MRI is based on a physics phenomenon called nuclear magnetic resonance (NMR), which was discovered in the 1930s by Felix Bloch (working at Stanford University) and Edward Purcell (from Harvard University). In this resonance, magnetic field and radio waves cause atoms to give off tiny radio signals. In the year 1970, Raymond Damadian, a medical doctor and research scientist, discovered the basis for using magnetic resonance imaging as a tool for medical diagnosis. Four years later a patent was granted, which was the world's first patent issued in the field of MRI. In 1977, Dr. Damadian completed the construction of the first “whole-body” MRI scanner, which he called the ”Indomitable”.

src: MRI darbības pamatā ir fizikāls fenomens, ko sauc par kodolmagnētisko rezonansi (KMR), kuru 1930. gados atklāja Fēlikss Blohs (strādāja Stenforda Universitātē) un Edvards Parsels (no Hārvarda Universitātes). Šajā rezonansē magnētiskais lauks un viļņi liek atomiem raidīt niecīgus radio signālus. 1970. gadā ārsts un pētnieks Reimonds Dameidians atklāja pamatu magnētiskās rezonanses attēlveides izmantošanai, lai uzstādītu diagnozi. Četrus gadus vēlāk tika piešķirts pasaulē pirmais MRI jomā izsniegtais patents. 1977. gadā dr. Dameidians pabeidza pirmā visa ķermeņa MR skenera, ko viņš sauca par „Nelokāmo”, izveidi.

In this resonance, a magnetic field and waves cause atoms to emit faint radio signals. In 1970, physician and researcher Raymond Damadian discovered the basis for using magnetic resonance imaging to make a diagnosis. Four years later, the first MRI patent was issued in the world in the field of diagnosis. In 1977, Dr. Damadian completed the first whole-body MR scanner, which he called the "Unflipping", creation.
ref: MRI is based on a physics phenomenon called nuclear magnetic resonance (NMR), which was discovered in the 1930s by Felix Bloch (working at Stanford University) and Edward Purcell (from Harvard University). In this resonance, magnetic field and radio waves cause atoms to give off tiny radio signals. In the year 1970, Raymond Damadian, a medical doctor and research scientist, discovered the basis for using magnetic resonance imaging as a tool for medical diagnosis. Four years later a patent was granted, which was the world's first patent issued in the field of MRI. src: Cilvēki ir vistalantīgākie no visām sugām citu cilvēku domu nolasīšanā. Tas nozīmē, ka mēs spējam veiksmīgi paredzēt to, ko citi cilvēki uztver, plāno, uzskata, zina vai vēlas. Viena no būtiskākajām ir spēja izprast citu nodomus. Tas ļauj mums pieņemt lēmumus par iespējami neskaidrām fiziskām darbībām. Piemēram, ja jūs redzētu kādu izsitam automašīnas stiklu, jūs, iespējams, domātu, ka tā persona mēģina nozagt svešu automašīnu. Viņu būtu jātiesā citādi, ja viņš būtu pazaudējis savas automašīnas atslēgas un mēģinātu ielauzties savā automašīnā.
mt: People are the most perceptive of all species in reading the minds of other people. This means that we can successfully predict what other people see, plan, think, know, or want. One of the most important is the ability to understand other people's minds. This allows us to make decisions about potentially ambiguous physical actions. For example, if you saw someone smashing a car window, you might think that this person was trying to steal a stranger's car. He would be punished differently if he had lost his car keys and was trying to get into his own car.
ref: Humans are by far the most talented species in reading the minds of others. That means we are able to successfully predict what other humans perceive, intend, believe, know or desire. Among these abilities, understanding the intention of others is crucial. It allows us to resolve possible ambiguities of physical actions. For example, if you were to see someone breaking a car window, you would probably assume he was trying to steal a stranger’s car. He would need to be judged differently if he had lost his car keys and it was his own car that he was trying to break into.

src: Lai arī mākslīgais intelekts tiek lielā mērā saistīts ar zinātnisko fantastiku, tas ir ārkārtīgi svarīgs datorzinātnes virziens, kas pēta tehnoloģiju izturēšanos, mācīšanos un inteliģentu pielāgošanos. AI pētījumos mašīnām liek automatizēt uzdevumus, kuru veikšanai nepieciešama programmējama rīcība. Kā piemēru var minēt kontroli, plānošanu un grafiku sastādīšanu, spēju atbildēt uz klientu jautājumiem un noteikt diagnozes, kā arī atpazīt rokrakstu, balsi un seju. Šādas lietas ir kļuvušas par atsevišķām nozarēm, kuru uzmanības centrā ir risinājumu sniegšana reālās dzīves problēmām. AI sistēmu tagad bieži izmanto ekonomikas, medicīnas, inženierzinātņu un militārajā jomā, kā arī tā ir iebūvēta vairākās mājas datoru un videospēļu programmatūras lietojumprogrammās.
mt: While artificial intelligence is often associated with science fiction, it is an extremely important direction in computer science that studies the resilience, learning, and adaptation of technologies. AI research gives machines the ability to automate tasks that require programmable behavior. For example, control, planning, and graph construction, the ability to answer customer questions, and diagnose, as well as recognizing handwriting, speech, and face. These things have become separate industries, whose focus is the delivery of solutions to real life problems. AI systems are now widely used in economics, medicine, engineering and military, and it is embedded in many home computer and video game software applications.
ref: Although AI has a strong connotation of science fiction, AI forms a very important branch of computer science, dealing with behavior, learning and intelligent adaptation in a machine. Research in AI involves making machines to automate tasks that require intelligent behavior. Examples include control, planning and scheduling, the ability to answer customer diagnoses and questions, as well as handwriting recognition, voice and face. Such things have become separate disciplines, which focus on providing solutions to real life problems. The AI ​​system is now often used in the fields of economics, medicine, engineering and the military, as has been built in several home computer and video game software applications.

src: Konverģentās domāšanas veidi ir problēmu risināšanas paņēmieni, kas apvieno dažādas idejas vai jomas, lai atrastu risinājumu. Šī domāšanas veida uzmanības centrā ir ātrums, loģika un precizitāte, arī faktu identificēšana, esošo metožu atkārtota pielietošana, informācijas vākšana. Vissvarīgākais šī domāšanas veida faktors: ir tikai viena pareiza atbilde. Jūs domājat tikai par divām atbildēm, proti, pareizi vai nepareizi. Šis domāšanas veids ir saistīts ar noteiktu zinātni vai standarta procedūrām. Cilvēkiem ar šāda veida domāšanu piemīt loģiskā domāšana, un viņi spēj iegaumēt modeļus, risināt problēmas un strādāt pie zinātniskiem izmēģinājumiem.
mt: Convergent thinking is a problem-solving approach that combines different ideas or fields to find a solution. Speed, logic, and precision, as well as fact identification, reusing existing methods, and information gathering are the focus of this type of thinking. The most important factor of this type of thinking: there is only one correct answer. You think only about two answers, namely correctly or incorrectly. This type of thinking is associated with a specific science or standard procedures. People with this type of thinking have logical thinking, and they can input models, solve problems, and work on scientific experiments.
ref: Convergent thinking patterns are problem solving techniques that unite different ideas or fields to find a solution. The focus of this mindset is speed, logic and accuracy, also identification of facts, reapplying existing techniques, gathering information. The most important factor of this mindset is: there is only one correct answer. You only think of two answers, namely right or wrong. This type of thinking is associated with certain science or standard procedures. People with this type of thinking have logical thinking, are able to memorize patterns, solve problems and work on scientific tests.

src: Videoierakstu izmantošana ir novedusi pie svarīgiem atklājumiem mikro izteiksmju - sejas kustību, kas ilgst dažas milisekundes - interpretācijā. Jo īpaši tiek apgalvots, ka cilvēks var noteikt, vai kāds melo, pareizi izprotot sejas mikroizteiksmes. Olivers Sakss savā esejā „Prezidenta runa” parādīja, kā cilvēki, kas smadzeņu bojājumu dēļ nespēj saprast runu, tomēr ir spējīgi precīzi noteikt, cik tā ir patiesa. Viņš pat izsaka pieņēmumu, ka šādas spējas interpretēt cilvēku uzvedību var būt arī dzīvniekiem, piemēram, mājas suņiem.
mt: The use of video recordings has led to important discoveries in the interpretation of micro expressions - facial movements that last a few milliseconds.  In particular, it is believed that people can tell if someone is lying by correctly interpreting facial micro expressions.  Oliver Sacks, in his essay "The President's Speech", showed how people who are unable to understand speech due to brain damage are nevertheless able to precisely determine how truthful it is.  He even suggests that such abilities to interpret human behavior may be present in animals, such as house dogs.
ref: The use of video recording has led to important discoveries in the interpretation of micro-expressions, facial movements which last a few milliseconds. In particular, it is claimed that one can detect whether a person is lying by interpreting micro-expressions correctly. Oliver Sacks, in his paper The President's Speech, indicated how people who are unable to understand speech because of brain damage are nevertheless able to assess sincerity accurately. He even suggests that such abilities in interpreting human behavior may be shared by animals such as domestic dogs.

src: Tā kā spēja iegūt zināšanas un mācīties izmainījās tā, kā minēts iepriekš, izmainījās arī vidējais zināšanu apguves ātrums. Pieeja informācijas iegūšanai bija atšķirīga. Spiediens vairs nebija vērsts uz individuālo atmiņu, bet uzmanības centrā vairāk bija spēja atcerēties tekstu. Pēc būtības Renesanse nesa lielas pārmaiņas attiecībā uz pieeju apmācībai un zināšanu izplatīšanai.
mt: Because the ability to acquire knowledge and learn changed as described above, the average rate of knowledge acquisition also changed. The approach to acquiring information was different. Pressure was no longer focused on individual memory, but attention was more focused on remembering text. In essence, the Renaissance brought great changes in the approach to education and the dissemination of knowledge.
ref: As the ability to obtain knowledge and to learn changed in such a way as mentioned above the base rate at which knowledge was obtained changed. The approach to obtaining information was different. No longer did pressure reside within individual recall, but the ability to recall text became more of a focus. In essence, the Renaissance made a significant change in the approach to learning and the dissemination of knowledge.

src: Internets apvieno gan masu, gan starppersoniskās komunikācijas elementus. Interneta atšķirīgās iezīmes rada papildu dimensijas attiecībā uz lietojuma un apmierinājuma pieeju. Piemēram, “mācīšanās” un “socializācija” tiek norādītas kā svarīgi motivējošie faktori interneta izmantošanai (James et al., 1995.). Pētot mērķauditorijas reakciju uz vietnēm, Īmijs un Makkords (1998) kā jaunus motivējošus aspektus identificēja arī „personisko iesaisti” un „pastāvīgas attiecības”.
mt: The Internet combines mass and interpersonal communication elements. The different features of the Internet create additional dimensions in terms of use and satisfaction approach. For example, "learning" and "socialization" are identified as important motivating factors in the use of the Internet (James et al., 1995.). Examining the target audience's reaction to websites, Imai and MacKerrow (1998) also identified "personal involvement" and "lasting relationships" as new motivating aspects.
ref: The Internet combines elements of both mass and interpersonal communication. The distinct characteristics of the Internet lead to additional dimensions in terms of the uses and gratifications approach. For example, “learning” and “socialization” are suggested as important motivations for Internet use (James et al., 1995). “Personal involvement” and “continuing relationships” were also identified as new motivation aspects by Eighmey and McCord (1998) when they investigated audience reactions to websites.

src: Gotu stils ieguva popularitāti 10.–11. gs. un vēlāk 14. gs. Sākumā apģērbu lielā mērā ietekmēja austrumos dzīvojošo bizantiešu kultūra. Tomēr lēnu saziņas kanālu dēļ mode rietumos var atpalikt par 25 līdz 30 gadiem. Viduslaiku beigās Rietumeiropa sāka attīstīt savu stilu. Viens no tā laika lielākajiem attīstības sasniegumiem bija, ka krusta karu rezultātā cilvēki sāka izmantot pogas apģērba sastiprināšanai.
mt: 10th and 11th centuries, and later in the 14th century, the Gothic style gained popularity. Initially, its fashion was influenced by the Byzantine culture of the East. However, due to slow communication channels, the fashion in the West could lag behind by 25 to 30 years. In the late Middle Ages, Western Europe began to develop its own style. One of the greatest achievements of that time was that people began to use buttons for fastening clothing as a result of the Crusades.
ref: Gothic style peaked in the period between the 10th - 11th centuries and the 14th century. At the beginning dress was heavily influenced by the Byzantine culture in the east. However, due to the slow communication channels, styles in the west could lag behind by 25 to 30 year. towards the end of the Middle Ages western Europe began to develop their own style. one of the biggest developments of the time as a result of the crusades people began to use buttons to fasten clothing.

src: Mēs varam sākt dzīvot videi draudzīgāk, varam pievienoties vides kustībai un pat būt aktīvisti, lai zināmā mērā mazinātu ciešanas nākotnē. Daudzos gadījumos tas ir tāpat kā simptomātiska ārstēšana. Tomēr, ja mēs nevēlamies tikai pagaidu risinājumu, mums vajadzētu atrast problēmu saknes un tās deaktivizēt. Ir skaidrs, ka pasaule ir ievērojami mainījusies cilvēces zinātnisko un tehnoloģisko sasniegumu dēļ, un problēmas ir kļuvušas nopietnākas pārapdzīvotības un cilvēces ekstravagantā dzīvesveida dēļ.
mt: We can start living more sustainably, we can join the environmental movement and even be active in order to reduce our impact on the future. In many cases it is like symptomatic treatment. However, if we do not want to just a temporary solution, we need to find the roots of the problem and deactivate them. It is clear that the world has changed significantly due to the scientific and technological achievements of mankind, and the problems have become more serious due to overpopulation and the extravagant lifestyle of humans.
ref: We can start living more friendly to the environment, we can join to the environmental movement, and we can even be activists in order to reduce the future suffering in some degree. This is just like symptomatic treatment in many cases. However, if we do not only want a temporary solution, then we should find the root of the problems, and we should deactivate them. It is obvious enough that the world has changed much because of humankind's scientific and technological advancements, and problems have become greater because of overpopulation and mankind's extravagant lifestyle.

src: Mēs varam sākt dzīvot videi draudzīgāk, varam pievienoties vides kustībai un pat būt aktīvisti, lai zināmā mērā mazinātu ciešanas nākotnē. Daudzos gadījumos tas ir tāpat kā simptomātiska ārstēšana. Tomēr, ja mēs nevēlamies tikai pagaidu risinājumu, mums vajadzētu atrast problēmu saknes un tās deaktivizēt. Ir skaidrs, ka pasaule ir ievērojami mainījusies cilvēces zinātnisko un tehnoloģisko sasniegumu dēļ, un problēmas ir kļuvušas nopietnākas pārapdzīvotības un cilvēces ekstravagantā dzīvesveida dēļ.
mt: We can start living more sustainably, we can join the environmental movement and even be active in order to reduce our impact on the future. In many cases it is like symptomatic treatment. However, if we do not want to just a temporary solution, we need to find the roots of the problem and deactivate them. It is clear that the world has changed significantly due to the scientific and technological achievements of mankind, and the problems have become more serious due to overpopulation and the extravagant lifestyle of humans.
ref: We can start living more friendly to the environment, we can join to the environmental movement, and we can even be activists in order to reduce the future suffering in some degree. This is just like symptomatic treatment in many cases. However, if we do not only want a temporary solution, then we should find the root of the problems, and we should deactivate them. It is obvious enough that the world has changed much because of humankind's scientific and technological advancements, and problems have become greater because of overpopulation and mankind's extravagant lifestyle.

src: Spēku līdzsvars bija sistēma, kurā Eiropas valstis centās saglabāt visu Eiropas valstu nacionālo suverenitāti. Koncepcija bija tāda, ka visām Eiropas valstīm bija jācenšas novērst vienas nācijas kļūšanu par varenu, un tāpēc valstu valdības bieži mainīja savas alianses, lai saglabātu līdzsvaru. Spānijas mantojuma karš iezīmēja pirmo karu, kura centrālais jautājums bija spēku samērs. Tas iezīmēja būtiskas izmaiņas, jo Eiropas lielvalstīm vairs nebūtu reliģisko karu esamības iegansts. Tādējādi Trīsdesmitgadu karš būtu pēdējais karš, kas tiktu apzīmēts kā reliģiskais karš.
mt: The balance of power was a system in which European states sought to preserve the national sovereignty of all European states. The concept was that all European states should strive to prevent one nation from becoming dominant, and so governments often changed their alliances to maintain the balance. The Spanish Succession War marked the first war whose central issue was the balance of power. It marked significant changes, as European great powers would no longer be the starting point for religious wars. Thus the Thirty Years' War would be the last war to be marked as a religious war.
ref: The balance of power was a system in which European nations sought to maintain the national sovereignty of all European states. The concept was that all European nations had to seek to prevent one nation from becoming powerful, and thus national governments often changed their alliances in order to maintain the balance. The War of Spanish Succession marked the first war whose central issue was the balance of power. This marked an important change, as European powers would no longer have the pretext of being religious wars. Thus, the Thirty Years' War would be the last war to be labeled a religious war.

src: Šajā Eiropas vēstures periodā katoļu baznīca, kura bija kļuvusi bagāta un ietekmīga, nonāca zem lupas. Vairāk nekā tūkstoti gadu kristiešu reliģija ir vienojusi Eiropas valstis, neskatoties uz atšķirīgajām valodām un tradīcijām. Tā visaptverošā vara ietekmēja pilnīgi visus, sākot no karaļa un beidzot ar parastajiem iedzīvotājiem. Viena no galvenajām kristiešu doktrīnām ir tāda, ka bagātība ir jāizmanto ciešanu un nabadzības mazināšanai, un baznīcas naudas līdzekļi ir paredzēti tieši šim mērķim. Baznīcas centrālā vara Romā ir pastāvējusi vairāk nekā tūkstoš gadus, un šī varas un naudas koncentrācija daudziem lika apšaubīt, vai šis princips tiek ievērots.
mt: In this period of European history, the Catholic Church, which had become rich and powerful, fell from grace. For more than a thousand years, Christianity had united European nations, despite their different languages and traditions. Its influence extended to everyone, from kings to ordinary citizens. One of the main Christian doctrines is that wealth is to be used to alleviate suffering and reduce poverty, and the Church's financial resources are intended for this purpose. The Church's central power in Rome has existed for more than a thousand years, and this concentration of power and money has led many to question whether this principle is being followed.
ref: During this period of European history, the Catholic Church, which had become rich and powerful, came under scrutiny. For over a thousand years the Christian religion had bound European states together despite differences in language and customs. I Its all-pervading power affected everyone from king to commoner. One of the main Christian tenets is that wealth should be used to alleviate suffering and poverty and that the monetary funds of the church are there specifically for that reason. The central authority of the church had been in Rome for over a thousand years and this concentration of power and money led many to question whether this tenet was being met.

src: Pārbijies karalis Luijs XVI, karaliene Marija Antuanete, viņu abi mazie bērni (11 gadus vecā Marija Terēze un četrus gadus vecais Luijs-Šarls) un karaļa māsa Elizabetes kundze 1789. gada 6. oktobrī tirgus sievu pūļa dēļ no Versaļas bija spiesti atgriezties Parīzē. Karietē pūļa ielenkumā viņi devās atpakaļ uz Parīzi, cilvēkiem izkliedzot draudus karalim un karalienei. Cilvēku pūlis piespieda karali un karalieni plaši atvērt karietes logus. Vienā brīdī bandas loceklis vicināja pārbiedētās karalienes priekšā Versaļā nogalinātā karaliskā sarga galvu.
mt: 1789 October 6, Louis XVI, Marie Antoinette, their two children (11-year-old Marie-Thérèse and 4-year-old Louis-Charles) and the king's sister, Elisabeth, were forced to return to Paris from Versailles by a mob of market women. The king and queen were forced to open the carriage windows. A member of the mob threatened to decapitate the queen in Versailles. The mob forced the king and queen to open the carriage windows. A member of the mob threatened to decapitate the queen in Versailles.
ref: The terrified King Louis XVI, Queen Marie Antoinette their two young children (11 year old Marie Therese and four year old Louis-Charles) and the King's sister, Madam Elizabeth, on the 6th October 1789 were forced back to Paris from Versailles by a mob of market women. In a carriage, they traveled back to Paris surrounded by a mob of people screaming and shouting threats against the King and Queen. The mob of people forced the King And Queen to have their carriage windows wide open. At one point a member of the mob waved the head of a royal guard killed at Versailles in front of the terrified Queen.

src: Drīz pēc karadarbības uzliesmojuma Lielbritānija uzsāka Vācijas flotes blokādi. Stratēģija izrādījās efektīva, pārtraucot vitāli svarīgas militārās un civilās piegādes, kaut arī šī blokāde pārkāpa vispārpieņemtos starptautiskos tiesību aktus, kas kodificēti vairākos pēdējo divu gadsimtu starptautiskajos līgumos. Lielbritānija izlika mīnas starptautiskajos ūdeņos, lai kuģi nevarētu ienākt visā okeāna daļā, kas apdraudēja pat neitrālus kuģus. Tā kā reakcija uz šo taktiku bija ierobežota, Vācija gaidīja līdzīgu reakciju uz savu neierobežoto zemūdeņu karadarbību.
mt: Immediately after the outbreak of hostilities, Britain began a blockade of the German navy. The strategy proved effective, interrupting vital military and civilian supplies, although this blockade violated the accepted international rights codified in several treaties of the last two centuries. Britain laid mines in international waters so that ships could not enter the entire ocean area that threatened neutral ships. As the response to this tactic was limited, Germany expected a similar response to its unlimited submarine warfare.
ref: Soon after the outbreak of hostilities, Britain initiated a naval blockade of Germany. The strategy proved effective, cutting off vital military and civilian supplies, although this blockade violated generally accepted international law codified by several international agreements of the past two centuries. Britain mined international waters to prevent any ships from entering entire sections of ocean, causing danger to even neutral ships. Since there was limited response to this tactic, Germany expected a similar response to its unrestricted submarine warfare.

src: Amerikas Savienotajās Valstīs ir reģistrēti aptuveni 400 000 multiplās sklerozes saslimšanas gadījumi, tādējādi tā ir uzskatāma par visizplatītāko neiroloģisko slimību gados jauniem pieaugušajiem un pusmūža cilvēkiem. MS ir slimība, kas ietekmē centrālo nervu sistēmu, kura sastāv no smadzenēm, muguras smadzenēm un redzes nerva. Pētījumos tika atklāts, ka sievietēm ir divreiz lielāka iespēja saslimt ar MS nekā vīriešiem.
mt: 400,000 multiple sclerosis cases have been registered in the United States, making it the most common neurological disease in young adults and middle-aged people. MS is a disease that affects the central nervous system, which consists of the brain, spinal cord, and optic nerve. Studies have shown that women are twice as likely to contract MS as men.
ref: Across the United States of America, there are approximately 400,000 known cases of Multiple Sclerosis (MS), leaving it as the leading neurological disease in younger and middle aged adults. MS is a disease that affects the central nervous system, which is made up of the brain, the spinal cord and the optic nerve. Research has found that females are two times more likely to have MS then males.

src: Pētījumā tika atklāts, ka depresija, bailes un katastrofēšana izraisīja saistību starp sāpēm un nespēju muguras lejas daļas sāpju cietējiem. Strukturētas fizisko aktivitāšu nodarbības, kas notika regulāri katru nedēļu, izraisīja tikai dramatizēšanu, nevis depresiju un bailes. Tiem, kas piedalās regulāros treniņos, bija nepieciešams lielāks atbalsts, negatīvi uztverot sāpes, atšķirot hronisku sāpju un diskomforta sajūtu atšķirības no normālas fiziskās kustības.
mt: A study found that depression, anxiety and catastrophizing were associated with the link between pain and disability in back pain patients. Structured physical activity interventions, which were conducted weekly, only led to dramatization, not depression and anxiety. Those who participated in regular training needed more support, not to interpret pain negatively, distinguishing chronic pain and discomfort sensations from normal physical activity.
ref: The study found that depression, fear and catastrophising mediated the relationship between pain and disability in lower back pain sufferers. Only the effects of catastrophizing, not depression and fear was conditional of regular weekly structured PA sessions. Those participating in regular activity required more support in terms of negative perception of pain distinguishing the differences of chronic pain and discomfort feel from normal physical movement.

src: Mūsdienu sporta paukošanu spēlē vairākos līmeņos, sākot no studentiem, kuri mācās universitātē, līdz profesionālajām un olimpiskajām sacensībām. Šo sporta veidu galvenokārt spēlē dueļa formātā, viens paukotājs duelējas ar otru.
mt: Modern fencing is played in several levels, starting from students who study at university, to professional and Olympic competitions. This sport is mainly played in the format of a duel, one fencer duels with another.
ref: The modern sport of fencing is played at many levels, from students learning at a university to professional and Olympic competition. The sport is primarily played in a duel format, one fencer dueling another.

src: Iekšēju saindēšanos var uzreiz nepamanīt. Tādi simptomi kā vemšana ir pietiekami vispārēji, lai uzreiz neuzstādītu diagnozi. Noteiktākā iekšējās saindēšanās pazīme var būt atvērtu zāļu vai toksisku sadzīves ķīmijas tvertņu klātbūtne. Izlasiet uz etiķetes pirmās palīdzības norādījumus konkrētajai indei.
mt: Internal bleeding can be hard to detect. Symptoms such as vomiting are general enough not to immediately diagnose. A specific sign of internal bleeding may be the presence of opened prescription or toxic household chemicals containers. Read the first aid instructions on the label for the specific product.
ref: Internal poisoning may not be immediately apparent. Symptoms, such as vomiting are sufficiently general that an immediate diagnosis cannot be made. The best indication of internal poisoning may be the presence of an open container of medication or toxic household chemicals. Check the label for specific first aid instructions for that specific poison.

src: Lai varētu pārbaudīt upuri, jums vispirms ir jāapskata notikuma vieta, lai nodrošinātu savu drošību. Tuvojoties cietušajam, jums ir jāievēro, kādā stāvoklī tas atrodas un vai nepastāv jebkādi intuitīvi signāli par apdraudējumu. Ja savainosieties, kamēr mēģināt sniegt palīdzību, tas tikai pasliktinās situāciju.
mt: 1. To assess the victim, you must first approach the scene to ensure your safety. As you approach the victim, you must observe his condition and whether there are any intuitive signs of danger. If you are injured, while trying to help, it will only worsen the situation.
ref: To Check the victim, you must first survey the scene to ensure your safety. You need to notice the victim's position as you approach him or her and any automatic red flags. If you get hurt trying to help, you may only serve to make matters worse.

src: Ir daudz sociālo un politisko efektu, kā piemēram, metriskās sistēmas izmantošana, pāreja no absolūtisma uz republikānismu, nacionālisms un pārliecība, ka valsts pieder tautai, nevis vienam valdniekam. Turklāt pēc Revolūcijas amatiem varēja pieteikties visi vīriešu dzimte pretendenti, kas ļāva ambiciozākajiem un veiksmīgākajiem gūt panākumus. Tas pats attiecas arī uz militāro jomu, jo tagad armijas dienesta pakāpes tika piešķirtas, pamatojoties uz cilvēka īpašībām, nevis uz piederību noteiktai kārtai. Franču revolūcija arī iedvesmoja daudzus citus represētos citu valstu strādnieku kārtas cilvēkus sākt savas revolūcijas.
mt: There are many social and political effects, such as the adoption of the metric system, the transition from absolutism to republicanism, nationalism and the belief that the state belongs to the people, not one ruler.  After the Revolution, offices could be applied for by all male descendants, allowing the ambitious and successful to gain success.  The same applies to the military, as now army ranks were awarded based on human qualities, not membership in a certain class.  The French Revolution also inspired many other oppressed classes of workers in other countries to start their own revolutions.
ref: There are a lot of social and political effects such as the use of metric system, a shift from absolutism to republicanism, nationalism and the belief the country belongs to the people not to one sole ruler. Also after the Revolution occupations were open to all male applicants allowing the most ambitious and successful to succeed. Same goes for the military because instead of army rankings being based on class they were now based on cailaber. The French Revolution also inspired many other repressed working class people of other country's to began their own revolutions.

src: Ikviens ir sabiedrības daļa un piedalās transporta sistēmās. Gandrīz ikviens sūdzas par transporta sistēmām. Attīstītajās valstīs jūs reti dzirdat par līdzīgām sūdzībām par ūdens kvalitāti vai brūkošiem tiltiem. Kāpēc šādas sūdzības rodas par transporta sistēmām, kāpēc tajās katru dienu rodas problēmas? Vai transporta inženieri ir nekompetenti? Vai arī problēmas sakne ir dziļāka?
mt: Everyone is part of the public and participates in the transport system. Almost everyone complains about the transport system. In developed countries you rarely hear similar complaints about water quality or crumbling bridges. Why do such complaints arise about the transport system, why are problems arising every day? Are transport engineers incompetent? Or the root of the problem is deeper?
ref: Everyone participates in society and uses transportation systems. Almost everyone complains about transportation systems. In developed countries you seldom hear similar levels of complaints about water quality or bridges falling down. Why do transportation systems engender such complaints, why do they fail on a daily basis? Are transportation engineers just incompetent? Or is something more fundamental going on?

src: Satiksmes plūsma ir pētījums par atsevišķu autovadītāju un transportlīdzekļu pārvietošanos starp diviem punktiem un to iespējamo mijiedarbību. Diemžēl izpētīt satiksmes plūsmu ir grūti, jo ar simtprocentīgu pārliecību nav iespējams paredzēt autovadītāja uzvedību. Par laimi autovadītāju uzvedībai visbiežāk ir diezgan konsekvents diapazons, līdz ar to satiksmes plūsmām var noteikt zināmu konsekvenci un tās var aptuveni aprēķināt matemātiski. Lai labāk atspoguļotu satiksmes plūsmu, ir izveidotas attiecības starp trim galvenajiem raksturlielumiem: (1) plūsmu, (2) blīvumu un (3) ātrumu. Šīs attiecības palīdz brauktuves infrastruktūras plānošanā, projektēšanā un procesos.
mt: Traffic flow is a study of the movement of individual drivers and vehicles between two points and their possible interactions. Unfortunately, it is difficult to study traffic flow because with 100% certainty it is impossible to predict a driver's behavior. Fortunately, a driver's behavior is usually within a fairly consistent range, so traffic flows can be estimated and calculated mathematically. To better reflect traffic flow, there are relationships between three main parameters: (1) flow, (2) density, and (3) speed. These relationships help in the planning, design, and processes of traffic infrastructure.
ref: Traffic Flow is the study of the movement of individual drivers and vehicles between two points and the interactions they make with one another. Unfortunately, studying traffic flow is difficult because driver behavior cannot be predicted with one-hundred percent certainty. Fortunately, drivers tend to behave within a reasonably consistent range; thus, traffic streams tend to have some reasonable consistency and can be roughly represented mathematically. To better represent traffic flow, relationships have been established between the three main characteristics: (1) flow, (2) density, and (3) velocity. These relationships help in planning, design, and operations of roadway facilities.

src: Satiksmes plūsma ir pētījums par atsevišķu autovadītāju un transportlīdzekļu pārvietošanos starp diviem punktiem un to iespējamo mijiedarbību. Diemžēl izpētīt satiksmes plūsmu ir grūti, jo ar simtprocentīgu pārliecību nav iespējams paredzēt autovadītāja uzvedību. Par laimi autovadītāju uzvedībai visbiežāk ir diezgan konsekvents diapazons, līdz ar to satiksmes plūsmām var noteikt zināmu konsekvenci un tās var aptuveni aprēķināt matemātiski. Lai labāk atspoguļotu satiksmes plūsmu, ir izveidotas attiecības starp trim galvenajiem raksturlielumiem: (1) plūsmu, (2) blīvumu un (3) ātrumu. Šīs attiecības palīdz brauktuves infrastruktūras plānošanā, projektēšanā un procesos.

Fortunately, a driver's behavior is usually within a fairly consistent range, so traffic flows can be estimated and calculated mathematically. To better reflect traffic flow, there are relationships between three main parameters: (1) flow, (2) density, and (3) speed. These relationships help in the planning, design, and processes of traffic infrastructure.

Unfortunately, studying traffic flow is difficult because driver behavior cannot be predicted with one-hundred percent certainty. Fortunately, drivers tend to behave within a reasonably consistent range; thus, traffic streams tend to have some reasonable consistency and can be roughly represented mathematically. src: Heršija un Čeisa eksperiments bija viens no vadošajiem ierosinājumiem, ka DNS ir ģenētisks materiāls. Heršijs un Čeiss izmantoja bakteriofāgus, jeb vīrusus, lai implantētu baktērijā to DNS. Viņi veica divus eksperimentus, atzīmējot vai nu fāga DNS ar radioaktīvo fosforu, vai fāga olbaltumvielu ar radioaktīvo sēru.
mt: Herch and Chesis experiment was one of the leading suggestions that DNA is genetic material. Herch and Chesis used bacteriophages, or viruses, to implant the DNA of a bacterium. They performed two experiments, marking either the DNA of the phage with radioactive phosphorus, or the phage protein with radioactive sulfur.
ref: The Hershey and Chase experiment was one of the leading suggestions that DNA was a genetic material. Hershey and Chase used phages, or viruses, to implant their own DNA into a bacterium. They did two experiments marking either the DNA in the phage with a radioactive phosphorus or the protein of the phage with radioactive sulfur.

src: Mutācijām var būt daudz dažādu efektu atkarībā no mutācijas veida, ietekmētā ģenētiskā materiāla vienības nozīmīguma un tā, vai ietekmētās šūnas ir cilmes šūnu līnijas šūnas. Bērniem var tikt nodotas tikai mutācijas cilmes šūnu līnijas šūnās, bet mutācijas citās šūnās var izraisīt šūnas bojāeju vai vēzi.
mt: Mutations can have many different effects depending on the type of mutation, the importance of the affected genetic material, and whether the affected cells are stem cells of the germ line. Children can only be given mutations in germ line stem cells, but mutations in other cells can cause cell death or cancer.
ref: Mutations can have a variety of different effects depending on the type of mutation, the significance of the piece of genetic material affected and whether the cells affected are germ-line cells. Only mutations in germ-line cells can be passed on to children, while mutations elsewhere can cause cell-death or cancer.

src: Kazas visticamāk pirmo reizi tika pieradinātas apmēram pirms 10 000 gadu Zagrosas kalnos Irānā. Senās tautas un ciltis sāka tās audzēt, jo tādējādi varēja viegli iegūt pienu, vilnu, gaļu un ādas. Mājas kazas parasti turēja ganāmpulkos, kuri klīda pa piekalnēm un citām ganību vietām un kurus pieskatīja kazu gani, kas bieži vien bija bērni vai pieaugušie, līdzīgi kā plašāk pazīstamie aitu gani. Šīs ganīšanas metodes izmanto līdz pat šim brīdim.
mt: Goats were first domesticated in the Zagros Mountains of Iran about 10,000 years ago. Ancient peoples and cultures began to breed them because they could easily obtain milk, wool, meat and skin. House goats were usually kept in herds, which grazed on hills and other grazing areas and were corralled by goat herders, who were often children or adults, similar to the more widely known sheep herders. These herding methods are still used today.
ref: Goats seem to have been first domesticated roughly 10,000 years ago in the Zagros Mountains of Iran. Ancient cultures and tribes began to keep them for easy access to milk, hair, meat, and skins. Domestic goats were generally kept in herds that wandered on hills or other grazing areas, often tended by goatherds who were frequently children or adolescents, similar to the more widely known shepherd. These methods of herding are still used today.

src: Golfs ir spēle, kurā spēlētāji izmanto nūjas, lai iesistu bumbiņas bedrītēs. Parastajā spēles kārtā izspēlē 18 bedrītes, un spēlētāji parasti sāk ar pirmo golfa laukuma bedrīti un pabeidz pie astoņpadsmitās. Uzvar tas spēlētājs no kluba, kurš, lai pabeigtu raundu, veic vismazāk sitienus vai atvēzienus. Spēle notiek zālē, un zāle ap bedrīti tiek nopļauta īsāka un tiek saukta par zaļo.
mt: Golf is a game in which players use clubs to hit balls into holes. In standard play, 18 holes are played, and players typically start with the first hole of the golf course and finish at the eighteenth. The winner is the player from the club who, to complete the round, makes the fewest strokes or putts. The game takes place on grass, and the grass around the holes is cut shorter and is called green.
ref: Golf is a game in which players use clubs to hit balls into holes. Eighteen holes are played during a regular round, with players usually starting on the first hole on the course and finishing on the eighteenth. The player who takes the fewest strokes, or swings of the club, to complete the course wins. The game is played on grass, and the grass around the hole is mown shorter and called the green.

src: Zinātnes galvenais mērķis ir, izmantojot zinātnisko metodi, izprast to, kā darbojas pasaule. Patiesībā šī metode ir vairākuma zinātnisko pētījumu virzītājspēks. Pastāv arī  eksperimentēšana, un eksperiments ir tests, kas tiek izmantots, lai izslēgtu vienu vai vairākas iespējamās hipotēzes. Jautājumu uzdošana un novērojumi arī var virzīt zinātnisko pētniecību.
mt: The main purpose of science is to understand how the world works. In fact, this method is the power of directing multiple scientific studies. There is also experimentation, and an experiment is a test that is used to rule out one or more possible hypotheses. Questioning and observation can also direct scientific research.
ref: Science’s main goal is to figure out the way the world works through the scientific method. This method in fact guides most scientific research. It isn’t alone though, experimentation, and an experiment is a test that is used to eliminate one or more of the possible hypotheses, asking questions, and making observations also guide scientific research.

src: Virpuļviesuļi salīdzinājumā ar citām spēcīgām vētrām šķērso tikai nelielu teritoriju, bet tie savā ceļā var iznīcināt visu. Virpuļviesuļi nogāž kokus, plēš dēļus no ēkām un metā pa gaisu automašīnas. Divi procenti no visspēcīgākajiem virpuļviesuļiem ilgst vairāk nekā trīs stundas. Šo lielo vētru vēja stiprums ir līdz 480 km/h (133 m/s; 300 jūdzes stundā).
mt: Tornadoes, compared to other strong winds, cover only a small area, but they can destroy everything in their path. Tornadoes knock down trees, rip roofs off houses and throw cars through the air. Two percent of the strongest tornadoes last more than three hours. The wind speed of these large tornadoes is up to 480 km/h (133 m/s; 300 mph).
ref: Tornadoes strike a small area compared to other violent storms, but they can destroy everything in their path. Tornadoes uproot trees, rip boards from buildings, and fling cars up into the sky. The most violent two percent of tornadoes last more than three hours. These monster storms have winds up to 480 km/h (133 m/s; 300 mph).

src: Cilvēki jau tūkstošiem gadu izgatavo un izmanto palielināmos stiklus. Tomēr pirmais īstais teleskops tika izgatavots Eiropā 16. gadsimta beigās. Šie teleskopi izmantoja divu lēcu kombināciju, lai tāli objekti parādītos gan tuvāk, gan lielāki.
mt: People have been making and using magnifying glasses for thousands of years. However, the first true telescope was made in Europe in the late 16th century. These telescopes used a combination of two lenses to make distant objects appear both closer and larger.
ref: Humans have been making and using lenses for magnification for thousands and thousands of years. However, the first true telescopes were made in Europe in the late 16th century. These telescopes used a combination of two lenses to make distant objects appear both nearer and larger.

src: Muhamedu ļoti interesēja pārpasaulīgi jautājumi. Viņš bieži devās uz alu, kas kļuva pazīstama kā Hira ala Nora (gaismas) kalnā, lai nodotos apcerei. Pati ala, kas ir pārdzīvojusi laikmetu griežus, spilgti parāda Muhameda tieksmi pēc garīguma. Ala atrodas vienā no kalnu virsotnēm ziemeļos no Mekas un ir pilnībā izolēta no pārējās pasaules. Faktiski to nemaz nav viegli atrast, pat ja kāds zinātu, ka tāda pastāv. Nonākot alā, iestājas pilnīga izolācija. Nekas vairāk par skaidrām, skaistām debesīm virs galvas un daudziem kalniem visapkārt nav redzams. No alas iekšpuses neko daudz no ārpasaules nevar ne redzēt, ne dzirdēt.
mt: Muhammad was very interested in universal questions. He often went to the cave, which became known as Hira al-Nor (light) mountain, to meditate. The cave, which has lived through the ages, clearly shows Muhammad's quest for spirituality. The cave is located on one of the mountain peaks north of Mecca and is completely isolated from the rest of the world. In fact, it is not easy to find it, even if someone knew it existed. Upon arriving at the cave, complete isolation sets in. Nothing more than clear, beautiful skies above the head and many mountains all around can be seen. From the inside of the cave, nothing much from the outside world can be seen or heard.
ref: Muhammad was deeply interested in matters beyond this mundane life. He used to frequent a cave that became known as “Hira‘” on the Mountain of “Noor” (light) for contemplation. he cave itself, which survived the times, gives a very vivid image of Muhammad’s spiritual inclinations. Resting on the top of one of the mountains north of Mecca, the cave is completely isolated from the rest of the world. In fact, it is not easy to find at all even if one knew it existed. Once inside the cave, it is a total isolation. Nothing can be seen other than the clear, beautiful sky above and the many surrounding mountains. Very little of this world can be seen or heard from inside the cave.

src: Vagoni tika būvēti Anglijā jau 16. gadsimtā. Lai arī zirgu dzelzceļš sastāvēja tikai no paralēli novietotiem koka dēļiem, tie ļāva vilcējzirgiem sasniegt lielāku ātrumu un vilkt lielākas kravas nekā pa tā laika grumbuļainajiem ceļiem. Gulšņus sāka izmantot jau pašos pirmsākumos, lai sliedes nekustētos. Taču pakāpeniski saprata, ka sliedes būtu vēl efektīvākas, ja tām augšpusē būtu metāla sloksne. Tā kļuva par ierastu praksi, bet dzelzs izraisīja lielāku vagonu koka riteņu nodilumu. Galu galā koka riteņi tika nomainīti ar dzelzs riteņiem. 1767. gadā tika ieviestas pirmās pilnībā no dzelzs izgatavotās sliedes.
mt: Wagons were built in England as early as the 16th century. Although the horse-drawn railway consisted only of parallel wooden sleepers, it allowed horses to achieve a higher speed and carry larger loads than on the roads of the time. Gullies were used from the beginning to prevent the sleepers from moving. However, it gradually became clear that the sleepers would be even more effective if a metal plate was attached to the top of them. It became a common practice, but the iron caused a greater wooden sleeper wear. Eventually, wooden sleepers were replaced by iron sleepers. In 1767, the first fully iron-made sleepers were introduced.
ref: Wagonways were built in England as early as the 16th Century. Although wagonways merely consisted of parallel planks of wood, they allowed horses pulling them to achieve greater speeds and pull larger loads than on the slightly more rough roads of the day. Crossties were introduced fairly early to hold the tracks in place. Gradually, however, it was realised that tracks would be more efficient if they had a stip of iron on the top. This became common practice, but the iron caused more wear on the wooden wheels of the wagons. Eventually, wooden wheels were replaced by iron wheels. In 1767, the first full-iron rails were introduced.
