src: Romantismam lielā mērā piemita kultūras determinisms, kas izrietēja no tādiem rakstniekiem kā Gēte, Fihte un Šlēgels. Romantisma kontekstā ģeogrāfija ietekmēja cilvēkus, un laika gaitā radās ar attiecīgo ģeogrāfisko reģionu saistīta kultūra un ieražas, kas bija labākas nekā patvaļīgi uzspiestie likumi, jo atradās harmonijā ar sabiedrības vietu.
mt: Romanticism was largely influenced by cultural determinism, as exemplified by authors such as Goethe, Fichte and Schlegel. In the context of geography, people were affected, and over time, a culture and images associated with the relevant geographical region emerged, which were better than arbitrarily imposed laws, as they were in harmony with the place of society.
ref: Romanticism had a large element of cultural determinism, drawn from writers such as Goethe, Fichte, and Schlegel. In the context of Romanticism, the geography molded individuals, and over time customs and culture related to that geography arose, and these, being in harmony with the place of the society, were better than arbitrarily imposed laws.

src: "Tehnoloģiskais determinisms ir termins, kas praksē aptver plašu ideju loku, sākot ar tehnoloģiju virzību vai tehnoloģisko imperatīvu līdz stingrai izpratnei, ka cilvēka likteni virza pamatā esošā loģika, kas saistīta ar zinātniskajiem likumiem un to izpausmi tehnoloģijās. Vairākumā interpretāciju par tehnoloģisko determinismu tiek izdalītas divas galvenās idejas: pati tehnoloģiju attīstība norit lielā mērā ārpus kultūras vai politiskās ietekmes un tehnoloģijas pašas rada ""ietekmi"" uz sabiedrībām, un šī ietekme ir izrietoša, nevis sociāli nosacīta. Piemēram, varētu teikt, ka automašīna noteikti veicina ceļu attīstību. Tomēr valsts ceļu tīkls nav ekonomiski dzīvotspējīgs vien nelielam skaitam automašīnu, tāpēc ir izstrādātas jaunas ražošanas metodes, lai samazinātu ar automašīnas lietošanu saistītās izmaksas. Liels daudzums privāto automašīnu nozīmē arī lielāku nelaimes gadījumu skaitu, kā rezultātā veselības aprūpē tiek izgudrotas jaunas metodes, kā salabot ķermeņu bojājumus."
mt: "Technological determinism is a term that in practice covers a broad idea spectrum, starting with the technological imperative or technological progress to a strict understanding that human destinies are driven by the logic underlying scientific laws and their expression in technology. Most interpretations of technological determinism are divided into two main ideas: technological development occurs largely outside of culture or political influence and technologies themselves exert a "force" on societies, and this force is irresistible, not socially contingent. For example, it could be said that the automobile certainly encourages road development. However, a national road network is not economically viable for a small number of automobiles, so new production methods are developed to reduce the costs associated with automobile use. A large number of private automobiles also means a greater number of accidents, so new methods are developed to reduce bodily injuries."
ref: "Technological determinism is a term that encompasses a wide range of ideas in practice, from technology-push or the technological imperative to a strict sense that human destiny is driven by an underlying logic associated with scientific laws and their manifestation in technology. Most interpretations of technological determinism share two general ideas: that the development of technology itself follows a path largely beyond cultural or political influence, and that technology in turn has ""effects"" on societies that are inherent, rather than socially conditioned. For example, one might say that the motor car necessarily leads to the development of roads. However, a nationwide road network is not economically viable for just a handful of cars, so new methods of production are developed to reduce the cost of car ownership. Mass car ownership also leads to a higher incidence of accidents on the roads, which leads to the invention of new techniques in healthcare for repairing damaged bodies."

src: "loks uz augšu zīme izskatās kā V un ""loks uz leju"" izskatās kā skava vai kvadrāts, kuram trūkst apakšējās malas. Uz augšu nozīmē, ka jums jāsāk no smailes un loks jāpaspiež, uz leju nozīmē, ka jums vajadzētu sākt pie roktura (vieta, kur jūsu roka tur loku) un loks jāpavelk. Augšupejoša lociņa kustība parasti rada maigāku skaņu, savukārt lejupejoša kustība ir spēcīgāka un pārliecinošāka. Jūs varat iezīmēt savas atzīmes, taču atcerieties, ka iedrukātās atzīmes ir norādītas mūzikas labskanības nolūkos, tādēļ parasti tās ir jāievēro."
mt: "Upward-pointing arrows look like a V and downward-pointing arrows look like a slash or a square with the bottom line missing. Upward arrows mean you should start at the head of the arrow and push the arrow, downward arrows mean you should start at the tail of the arrow (where your finger is on the arrow) and pull the arrow. Upward motion usually produces a softer sound, while downward motion is stronger and more authoritative. You can add your own annotations, but remember that the printed annotations are intended for musical note reading, so they should be followed."
ref: "The ""up bow"" mark looks like a V and the ""down bow mark"" like a staple or a square missing its bottom side. Up means you should start at the tip and push the bow, and down means you should start at the frog (which is where your hand is holding the bow) and pull the bow. An up-bow usually generates a softer sound, while a down-bow is stronger and more assertive. Feel free to pencil in your own marks, but remember the printed bowing marks are there for a musical reason, so they should usually be respected."

src: "loks uz augšu zīme izskatās kā V un ""loks uz leju"" izskatās kā skava vai kvadrāts, kuram trūkst apakšējās malas. Uz augšu nozīmē, ka jums jāsāk no smailes un loks jāpaspiež, uz leju nozīmē, ka jums vajadzētu sākt pie roktura (vieta, kur jūsu roka tur loku) un loks jāpavelk. Augšupejoša lociņa kustība parasti rada maigāku skaņu, savukārt lejupejoša kustība ir spēcīgāka un pārliecinošāka. Jūs varat iezīmēt savas atzīmes, taču atcerieties, ka iedrukātās atzīmes ir norādītas mūzikas labskanības nolūkos, tādēļ parasti tās ir jāievēro."
mt: "Upward-pointing arrows look like a V and downward-pointing arrows look like a slash or a square with the bottom line missing. Upward arrows mean you should start at the head of the arrow and push the arrow, downward arrows mean you should start at the tail of the arrow (where your finger is on the arrow) and pull the arrow. Upward motion usually produces a softer sound, while downward motion is stronger and more authoritative. You can add your own annotations, but remember that the printed annotations are intended for musical note reading, so they should be followed."
ref: "The ""up bow"" mark looks like a V and the ""down bow mark"" like a staple or a square missing its bottom side. Up means you should start at the tip and push the bow, and down means you should start at the frog (which is where your hand is holding the bow) and pull the bow. An up-bow usually generates a softer sound, while a down-bow is stronger and more assertive. Feel free to pencil in your own marks, but remember the printed bowing marks are there for a musical reason, so they should usually be respected."

src: Atšķirībā no citiem primātiem, hominīdi vairs neizmanto savas rokas pārvietojoties, nesot svaru vai šūpojoties kokos. Šimpanzes roka un pēda pēc izmēra un garuma ir līdzīgas, un tas atspoguļo rokas izmantošanu svara pārnēsāšanā, staigājot četrrāpus. Cilvēka roka ir īsāka par pēdu, ar taisnākām falangām. Divus līdz trīs miljonus gadu vecas roku kaulu fosilijas atklāj šīs izmaņas rokas funkcionalitātē, sākotnēji kalpojot pārvietošanās mērķiem, bet vēlāk manipulatīvu kustību izdarīšanai.
mt: Unlike other primates, hominids no longer use their hands for locomotion, carrying weight, or climbing trees. Chimpanzee hands and feet are similar in size and length, reflecting the use of the hands for carrying weight, walking on four legs. The human hand is shorter than the foot, with straighter phalanges. Two to three million year old hand bone fossils show this hand functionality, initially for locomotion, but later for manipulative movement.
ref: Unlike other primates, hominids no longer use their hands in locomotion or bearing weight or swinging through the trees. The chimpanzee's hand and foot are similar in size and length, reflecting the hand's use for bearing weight in knuckle walking. The human hand is shorter than the foot, with straighter phalanges. Fossil hand bones two million to three million years old reveal this shift in specialization of the hand from locomotion to manipulation.

src: Divdesmitā gadsimta pētījumi ir parādījuši, ka ir divi ģenētisko variāciju kopumi: slēptie un izteiktie. Mutācija pievieno jaunu ģenētisko variāciju, bet atlase to noņem no izteiktās variācijas kopuma. Segregācija un rekombinācija katrā paaudzē pārbīda variācijas turp un atpakaļ starp šiem diviem kopumiem.
mt: 20th century studies have shown that there are two genetic variation pools: hidden and expressed. A mutation adds a new genetic variation, but selection removes it from the expressed variation pool. Segregation and recombination in each generation reshuffles the variations back and forth between these two pools.
ref: Twentieth century research has shown that there are two pools of genetic variation: hidden and expressed. Mutation adds new genetic variation, and selection removes it from the pool of expressed variation. Segregation and recombination shuffle variation back and forth between the two pools with each generation.

src: "Primātiem ar tādu gremošanas sistēmu kā cilvēkiem ir grūti nodrošināt nepieciešamās aminoskābes ar savannā pieejamajiem augu resursiem. Turklāt, tam var būt nopietnas sekas: kavēta augšana, nepietiekams uzturs un pat nāve. Visvieglāk pieejamie augu resursi būtu bijuši olbaltumvielas, kas pieejamas lapās un pākšaugos, taču tādiem primātiem kā mums tos ir grūti sagremot, ja vien tie nav pagatavoti. Savukārt dzīvnieku izcelsmes pārtika (skudras, termīti, oliņas) ir ne tikai viegli sagremojama, ber arī nodrošina daudz proteīna, kas satur neaizvietojamās aminoskābes. Ņemot vērā visu to, nebūtu brīnums, ka mūsu priekšteči arī atrisināja savu ""proteīna problēmu"" līdzīgi, kā to šobrīd dara savannā dzīvojošās šimpanzes."
mt: "For primates with a digestive system like ours, it is difficult to obtain the necessary amino acids with the plant resources available in the savanna. Moreover, this can have serious consequences: delayed growth, insufficient nutrition and even death. The most easily available plant resources would have been the pigments available in the leaves and flowers, but these primates are difficult to digest, unless they are prepared. On the other hand, animal-derived food (grasshoppers, termites, ants) is not only easily digestible, but also provides a lot of protein, which contains non-replaceable amino acids. Taking all this into account, it would not be surprising if our ancestors also solved their "protein problem" in a similar way as the chimpanzees living in the savanna do."
ref: "Out on the savanna, it is hard for a primate with a digestive system like that of humans to satisfy its amino-acid requirements from available plant resources. Moreover, failure to do so has serious consequences: growth depression, malnutrition, and ultimately death. The most readily accessible plant resources would have been the proteins accessible in leaves and legumes, but these are hard for primates like us to digest unless they are cooked. In contrast, animal foods (ants, termites, eggs) not only are easily digestible, but they provide high-quantity proteins that contain all the essential amino acids. All things considered, we should not be surprised if our own ancestors solved their ""protein problem"" in somewhat the same way that chimps on the savanna do today."

src: Subkultūras apvieno līdzīgi domājošus indivīdus, kuri sabiedrības standartu ziņā jūtas pamesti novārtā, un ļauj viņiem attīstīt identitātes izjūtu. Subkultūras var būt atšķirīgas dalībnieku vecuma, etniskās piederības, klases, atrašanās vietas un/vai dzimuma ziņā. Īpašības, kas nosaka subkultūru kā atšķirīgu, var būt lingvistiskas, estētiskas, reliģiskas, politiskas, seksuālas, ģeogrāfiskas vai faktoru kombinācija. Subkultūras pārstāvji bieži vien uzsver savu piederību, izmantojot atšķirīgu un simbolisku stilu, tostarp modi, manieres un žargonu.
mt: Subcultures are groups of people who feel marginalized by mainstream society, and allow them to develop a sense of identity. Subcultures can be of different age, ethnic, class, location, and/or gender. Characteristics that define a subculture can be linguistic, aesthetic, religious, political, sexual, geographic, or a combination of factors. Subculture members often emphasize their membership by using a distinctive and symbolic style, including fashion, mannerisms, and jargon.
ref: Subcultures bring together like-minded individuals who feel neglected by societal standards and allow them to develop a sense of identity. Subcultures can be distinctive because of the age, ethnicity, class, location, and/or gender of the members. The qualities that determine a subculture as distinct may be linguistic, aesthetic, religious, political, sexual, geographical, or a combination of factors. Members of a subculture often signal their membership through a distinctive and symbolic use of style, which includes fashions, mannerisms, and argot.

src: Bērni diezgan agrā vecumā sāk apzināties rasu atšķirības un izveido rasu stereotipus, kuri ietekmē uzvedību. Piemēram, bērni, kuri pieder rasu minoritātei, par kuru ir izveidojies stereotips, ka viņiem mācībās neveicas, mēdz skolā labi nemācīties, tiklīdz uzzina par savas rases saistību ar šo stereotipu.
mt: Children begin to notice racial differences and form racial stereotypes at a young age, which affect their behavior. For example, children who belong to a racial minority for which there is a stereotype that they do not do well in school, tend to do poorly in school once they learn of the association between their race and this stereotype.
ref: Children develop an awareness of race and racial stereotypes quite young and these racial stereotypes affect behavior. For instance, children who identify with a racial minority that is stereotyped as not doing well in school tend to not do well in school once they learn about the stereotype associated with their race.

src: "Viens no visparastākajiem paņēmieniem, kas tiek izmantots, lai ilustrētu socializācijas nozīmīgumu, ir neveiksmīgu gadījumu piemēri par bērniem, kuriem vecāki to pieaugšanas laikā nenodrošināja socializāciju nevērības, grūtību vai tīšas ļaunprātības dēļ. Šādus bērnus sauc par ""savvaļas"" vai mežonīgiem. Dažus savvaļas bērnus ir ierobežojuši cilvēki (parasti viņu vecāki); dažos gadījumos šī bērna pamešana notika tāpēc, ka vecāki noraidīja bērna smagos intelektuālos vai fiziskos traucējumus. Savvaļas bērni var būt piedzīvojuši nopietnu vardarbību vai traumas, pirms tie tika pamesti vai aizbēga. Tiek uzskatīts, ka citus ir uzaudzinājuši dzīvnieki; daži stāsta, ka ir dzīvojuši savvaļā vieni paši. Pilnībā uzaugot ar dzīvniekiem, savvaļas bērnam raksturīga gandrīz tāda pati uzvedība (ar fiziskajiem ierobežojumiem) kā attiecīgajam dzīvniekam, kurš par viņu rūpējas, piemēram, bailes vai vienaldzība pret cilvēkiem."
mt: "One of the most common illustrations of the importance of socialization is the unsuccessful cases of children who were not provided socialization during their formative years due to neglect, difficulty, or sheer cruelty. Such children are called "feral" or "wild." Some feral children have been restricted by humans (usually their parents); in some cases, the child's abandonment occurred because the parents rejected the child's severe intellectual or physical impairments. Feral children may have experienced serious abuse or trauma before they were abandoned or ran away. It is believed that others were raised by animals; some claim to have lived in the wild alone. Fully raised by animals, a feral child's behavior (with physical limitations) is almost identical to that of the animal that cares for them, for example, fear or timidity towards humans."
ref: "One of the most common methods used to illustrate the importance of socialization is to draw upon the few unfortunate cases of children who were, through neglect, misfortune, or wilful abuse, not socialized by adults while they were growing up. Such children are called ""feral"" or wild. Some feral children have been confined by people (usually their own parents); in some cases this child abandonment was due to the parents' rejection of a child's severe intellectual or physical impairment. Feral children may have experienced severe child abuse or trauma before being abandoned or running away. Others are alleged to have been brought up by animals; some are said to have lived in the wild on their own. When completely brought up by non-human animals, the feral child exhibits behaviors (within physical limits) almost entirely like those of the particular care-animal, such as its fear of or indifference to humans."

src: Pašnodrošinājuma lauksaimniecība ir tāda lauksaimniecība, kas tiek veikta, lai izaudzētu pietiekoši daudz pārtikas, un apmierinātu tikai lauksaimnieka/-ces un viņa/-as ģimenes vajadzības. Pašnodrošinājuma lauksaimniecība ir vienkārša, bieži organiska sistēma, kurā tiek izmantotas ekoreģionā ievāktas sēklas kopā ar augseku vai citām salīdzinoši vienkāršām metodēm, lai maksimāli palielinātu ražu. Vēsturiski vairums zemnieku nodarbojās ar pašpatēriņa lauksaimniecību, kā joprojām notiek daudzās attīstības valstīs.
mt: Self-sufficiency in agriculture is a type of agriculture that is done to grow enough food, and to satisfy only the farmer's and his family's needs. Self-sufficiency agriculture is a simple, often organic system, in which seed is planted with a crop or other relatively simple methods to maximize yield. Historically, most farmers practiced self-sufficiency agriculture, as still happens in many developing countries.
ref: Subsistence agriculture is agriculture carried out for the production of enough food to meet just the needs of the agriculturalist and his/her family. Subsistence agriculture is a simple, often organic, system using saved seed native to the ecoregion combined with crop rotation or other relatively simple techniques to maximize yield. Historically most farmers were engaged in subsistence agriculture and this is still the case in many developing nations.

src: Iespējams, vispopulārākais tūrisma veids ir tas, ar ko cilvēki visbiežāk saista ceļošanu, — izklaides tūrisms. Tas ir tad, kad cilvēki dodas uz vietu, kas ir ļoti atšķirīga no viņu ikdienas dzīves, lai atpūstos un izklaidētos. Pludmales, atrakciju parki un kempingi ir atpūtnieku biežāk apmeklētās vietas. Ja kādas vietas apmeklējuma mērķis ir iepazīt tās vēsturi un kultūru, šāda veida tūrisms tiek saukts par kultūras tūrismu. Tūristi var apmeklēt dažādus konkrētās valsts vēstures pieminekļus vai vienkārši izvēlēties fokusēties tikai uz vienu teritoriju.
mt: The most popular form of tourism is that which people most often associate with travel, — recreational tourism. This is when people go to a place that is very different from their daily lives to relax and have fun. Beaches, amusement parks and camping are the most visited places by tourists. If the purpose of visiting a place is to learn about its history and culture, this type of tourism is called cultural tourism. Tourists can visit various historical monuments of a particular country or simply choose to focus only on one territory.
ref: Perhaps the most common type of tourism is what most people associate with traveling: Recreation tourism. This is when people go to a place that is very different from their regular day-to-day life to relax and have fun. Beaches, theme parks and camp grounds are often the most common places frequented by recreational tourists. If the objective of one’s visit to a particular place is to get to know its history and culture then this type of tourism is known as cultural tourism. Tourists may visit different landmarks of a particular country or they may simply opt to focus on just one area.

Tas ir tad, kad cilvēki dodas uz vietu, kas ir ļoti atšķirīga no viņu ikdienas dzīves, lai atpūstos un izklaidētos. Pludmales, atrakciju parki un kempingi ir atpūtnieku biežāk apmeklētās vietas. Ja kādas vietas apmeklējuma mērķis ir iepazīt tās vēsturi un kultūru, šāda veida tūrisms tiek saukts par kultūras tūrismu. Tūristi var apmeklēt dažādus konkrētās valsts vēstures pieminekļus vai vienkārši izvēlēties fokusēties tikai uz vienu teritoriju.
mt: The most popular form of tourism is that which people most often associate with travel, — recreational tourism. This is when people go to a place that is very different from their daily lives to relax and have fun. Beaches, amusement parks and camping are the most visited places by tourists. If the purpose of visiting a place is to learn about its history and culture, this type of tourism is called cultural tourism. Tourists can visit various historical monuments of a particular country or simply choose to focus only on one territory.
ref: Perhaps the most common type of tourism is what most people associate with traveling: Recreation tourism. This is when people go to a place that is very different from their regular day-to-day life to relax and have fun. Beaches, theme parks and camp grounds are often the most common places frequented by recreational tourists. If the objective of one’s visit to a particular place is to get to know its history and culture then this type of tourism is known as cultural tourism. Tourists may visit different landmarks of a particular country or they may simply opt to focus on just one area.

src: Vairākas desmitgades iesaistītās personas palīdzēja mums novērtēt savas stiprās puses un kaislību, vienlaikus godīgi izvērtējot grūtības un pat neveiksmes. Klausoties kā cilvēki dalās savos individuālajos, ģimenes un organizācijas stāstos, mēs guvām vērtīgu ieskatu pagātnē un dažās personībās, kas labā vai sliktā veidā ietekmēja organizācijas kultūru. Kaut arī vēstures izpratne nenozīmē kultūras izpratni, tā vismaz palīdz cilvēkiem apzināties viņu vietu šīs organizācijas vēsturē. Novērtējot panākumus un apzinoties neveiksmes, indivīdi un visas iesaistītās personas dziļāk atklāj organizācijas vērtības, misiju un virzītājspēkus. Šajā gadījumā, atsaucot atmiņā iepriekšējās reizes, kad viņi rīkojās uzņēmīgi un guva panākumus, cilvēkiem bija vieglāk būt atvērtiem jaunām pārmaiņām un vietējai baznīcai — jaunam virzienam. Šādi veiksmes stāsti mazināja bailes no pārmaiņām, vienlaikus radot pozitīvas tieksmes uz pārmaiņām nākotnē.
mt: For several decades, we have been involved in helping people evaluate their strengths and passions, while also honestly evaluating difficulties and even failures. Listening to how people divide their individual, family, and organizational stories, we gained valuable insight into the past and several individuals who positively or negatively influenced the culture of the organization. While history does not mean cultural understanding, it at least helps people understand their place in the history of the organization. Evaluating successes and recognizing failures, individuals and all involved people more deeply reveal the values, mission, and strengths of the organization. In this case, recalling previous times when they acted responsibly and achieved success, people were easier to be open to new changes and the local church — a new direction. Such success stories reduced fears of change, while also creating positive inclinations toward change in the future.
ref: Individuals who had been involved for several decades helped us appreciate our strengths and passions while candidly assessing difficulties and even failures. While listening to individuals share their individual, family, and organizational stories, we gained valuable insight into the past and some of the personalities who influenced for good or ill the culture of the organization. While understanding one’s history does not assume understanding of culture, it does at least help people gain a sense of where they fall within the history of the organization. While assessing the successes and becoming aware of failures, individuals and the whole of the participating persons discover more deeply the values, mission, and driving forces of the organization. In this instance, recalling previous instances of entrepreneurial behavior and resulting successes helped people to be open to new changes and new direction for the local church. Such success stories lessened the fears of change, while creating positive inclinations toward change in the future.

src: Postmodernā pieeja mācībām piedāvā brīvību no absolūtā. Nav viena laba veida, kā mācīties. Faktiski nav vienas labas lietas, ko iemācīties. Mācīšanās notiek pieredzē starp apmācāmo un sniegtajām zināšanām. Minēto skaidri parāda mūsu pašreizējā pieredze ar visiem pašrocīga darba un informatīvajiem, uz mācīšanos balstītajiem televīzijas raidījumiem. Tādējādi daudzi no mums pieķer sevi skatāmies televīzijas pārraidi, kurā stāsta par noteiktu pieredzi vai procesu, kādā mēs nekad nepiedalīsimies vai neizmantosim attiecīgās zināšanas. Mēs nekad kapitāli neremontēsim automašīnu, nebūvēsim strūklaku savā pagalmā, nebrauksim uz Peru, lai apskatītu senās drupas, vai nepārveidosim kaimiņu māju.
mt: A postmodern approach to learning offers freedom from absolutes. There is no one right way to learn. In fact, there is no one right thing to learn. Learning happens in the experience between the learner and the knowledge being taught. This is clearly demonstrated in our current experience with all the homemade work and informational, education-based television programs. Thus, many of us identify ourselves in the television broadcast that tells of a particular experience or process in which we will never participate or use the knowledge. We will never change a car engine, build a dam in our backyard, go to Peru to see ancient ruins, or remodel our neighbor's house.
ref: The postmodern approach to learning offers the freedom from absolutes. There is no one good way to learn. In fact, there is not one good thing to learn.Learning takes place in the experience between the learner and the knowledge presented. Our current experience with all the do-it-yourself and information presenting, learning-based television shows illustrates this point. So many of us find ourselves watching a television show that informs us of a process or experience in which we will never participate or apply that knowledge. We will never overhaul a car, build a fountain in our backyard, travel to Peru to examine ancient ruins, or remodel our neighbour's house.

src: Miega pārtraukšana ir process, kad normāla miega laikā tiek veikta mērķtiecīga pamošanās, pēc īsa brīža atkal aizmiegot (10–60 minūtes). To var viegli izdarīt, izmantojot samērā klusu modinātāju, lai jūs būtu pie apziņas, taču pilnībā nepamodināts. Ja miegā pārslēdzat pulksteni, to var novietot istabas otrā pusē, liekot jums izkāpt no gultas, lai to izslēgtu. Cita uz bioritmu pamatota iespēja ir pirms gulētiešanas dzert daudz šķidruma (īpaši ūdeni vai tēju, kas ir zināma ar savu diurētisko iedarbību), lai liktu celties un iet urinēt.
mt: Sleep interruption is a process that occurs during normal sleep, where a deliberate awakening is performed, followed by a short period of sleep again (10–60 minutes). This can be easily done by using a relatively quiet alarm clock, so that you are aware, but not fully woken up. If you wake up in the middle of the night, you can place the alarm clock on the other side of the room, so that you have to get out of bed to turn it off. Another biorhythm-based option is to drink a lot of liquid (especially water or tea, which is known for its diuretic effect) before going to bed, so that you have to get up and go to the bathroom.
ref: Sleep interruption is the process of purposefully awakening during your normal sleep period and falling asleep a short time later (10–60 minutes). This can be easily done by using a relatively quiet alarm clock to bring you to consciousness without fully waking you. If you find yourself resetting the clock in your sleep, it can be placed on the other side of the room, forcing you to get out of bed to turn it off. Other biorhythm-based options involve drinking lots of fluid (particularly water or tea, a known diuretic) prior to sleep, forcing one to get up to urinate.

src: Daži cilvēki uzskata, ka gana bieža daudzu mākslīgi izraisītu apzināto sapņu pieredzēšana var būt ļoti nogurdinoša. Galvenais šīs parādības iemesls ir skaidru sapņu rezultāts, kas paplašina laika ilgumu starp REM stāvokļiem. Jo mazāks REM miega fāžu skaits naktī, jo retāk jūs nonākat faktiskā miega stāvoklī un jūsu ķermenis atjaunojas, un tas ir pietiekams problēmu rašanās cēlonis. Tas ir tikpat nogurdinoši, it kā ik pēc divdesmit vai trīsdesmit minūtēm pamostos un skatītos televizoru. Efekts ir atkarīgs no tā, cik bieži jūsu smadzenes mēģina saprotami sapņot katru nakti.
mt: Some people believe that frequent artificial induced lucid dreaming can be very harmful. The main reason for this phenomenon is the result of clear dreams, which extends the time between REM sleep episodes. The fewer REM sleep episodes per night, the less you get into a real sleep state and your body recovers, and this is enough of a problem causing factor. It is as if you were to sit and watch TV every twenty or thirty minutes. The effect depends on how often your brain tries to dream meaningfully each night.
ref: Some people believe that experiencing many artificially induced lucid dreams often enough can be very exhausting. The main reason for this phenomenon is the result of the lucid dreams expanding the length of time between REM states. With fewer REMs per night, this state in which you experience actual sleep and your body recovers becomes infrequent enough to become a problem. This is just as exhausting as if you were to wake up every twenty or thirty minutes and watch TV. The effect is dependent on how often your brain attempts to lucidly dream per night.

src: Virtuālajām komandām tiek piemēroti tādi paši izcilības standarti kā parastajām komandām, taču pastāv nelielas atšķirības. Virtuālās komandas biedri bieži darbojas kā saziņas punkts savai tiešajai fiziskajai grupai. Viņiem bieži vien ir lielāka autonomija nekā parastajiem komandas locekļiem, jo ​​viņu komandas var satikties atbilstoši dažādajām laika joslām, kuras viņu vietējā vadība varētu nesaprast. Patiesas “neredzamās komandas” klātbūtne (109. lappuse, Larsona un LaFasto grāmata, izdota 1989.g.) ir arī unikāla virtuālās komandas sastāvdaļa. “Neredzamā komanda” ir vadības komanda, kurai ziņo katrs no dalībniekiem. Neredzamā komanda katram dalībniekam nosaka standartus.
mt: Virtual teams are held to the same high standards as traditional teams, but there are some differences. Virtual team members often serve as a communication hub for their physical team. They often have more autonomy than traditional team members, as their teams can meet at times that their local leadership may not understand. The presence of an "invisible team" (109, Larson and LaFasto book, published in 1989) is also a unique part of a virtual team. An "invisible team" is a management team that reports to each member. The invisible team sets standards for each member.
ref: Virtual teams are held to the same standards of excellence as conventional teams, but there are subtle differences. Virtual team members often function as the point of contact for their immediate physical group. They often have more autonomy than conventional team members as their teams may meet according to varying time zones which may not be understood by their local management. The presence of a true “invisible team” (Larson and LaFasto, 1989, p109) is also a unique component of a virtual team. The “invisible team” is the management team to which each of the members report. The invisible team sets the standards for each member.

src: Satura teorijas pamatā cenšas noskaidrot, kas cilvēkiem rada iedvesmu vai kas viņus piesaista. Šīs teorijas ierosina, ka cilvēkiem ir noteiktas vajadzības un/vai vēlmes, kas, sasniedzot pilngadību, ir internalizētas. Šīs teorijas aplūko to, kas noteiktiem cilvēkiem liek vēlēties darīt lietas, ko viņi dara, un kādas lietas viņu vidē liks viņiem darīt vai nedarīt noteiktas lietas. Divas populāras satura teorijas ir Maslova vajadzību hierarhijas teorija un Hercberga divu faktoru teorija.
mt: Content theories attempt to explain what motivates people or what attracts them. These theories assume that people have certain needs and/or desires that, upon reaching adulthood, are internalized. These theories examine what motivates people to do things they do and what things they should or should not do certain things. Two popular content theories are Maslow's hierarchy of needs theory and Herzberg's two-factor theory.
ref: Content theories are centered on finding what makes people tick or appeals to them. These theories suggest that people have certain needs and/or desires which have been internalized as they mature to adulthood. These theories look at what it is about certain people that make them want the things that they do and what things in their environment will make them do or not do certain things. Two popular content theories are Maslow's Hierarchy of Needs Theory and Hertzberg's Two Factor Theory.

src: Daudz izkropļotais un bieži izsmietais trešo daļu likums ir vienkārša vadlīnija, kas rada dinamiku, vienlaikus saglabājot attēla kārtību. Tur norādīts, ka visefektīvākā vieta galvenajam subjektam ir to līniju krustpunktā, kas sadala attēlu trīs daļās gan vertikāli, gan horizontāli (skatiet piemēru).
mt: The third part of the law, which is often ignored and frequently violated, is a simple guideline that creates dynamics while maintaining the integrity of the image. It states that the most effective position for the main subject is at the intersection of the lines that divide the image into three parts both vertically and horizontally (see example).
ref: The much-abused and often-ridiculed rule of thirds is a simple guideline creating dynamism while keeping a measure of order in an image. It states that the most effective place for the main subject is at the intersection of lines dividing the image into thirds vertically and horizontally (see example).

src: Piemēram, izplatītākais nekustīga attēla fotogrāfijas formāts pasaulē ir 35 mm, kas bija izplatītākais fotofilmas izmērs analogo fotofilmu laikmetā. Tas  joprojām tiek ražots, bet svarīgāk, ka tā attēla proporcijas tagad izmanto digitālo kameru attēlu sensoru formātos. 35 mm formāts patiesībā, nedaudz mulsinoši, ir 36 mm platumā un 24 mm augstumā. Tāpēc šī formāta malu attiecība (dalot ar divpadsmit, lai iegūtu vienkāršāko veselo skaitļu attiecību) ir 3:2. Daudzi vispārpieņemti formāti (piemēram, APS formātu kopa) atbilst šīm attēla malu attiecībām vai ir tām ļoti līdzīgi.
mt: For example, the most widely used still image photo format in the world is 35 mm, which was the most widely used film size in the analog film era. It is still produced, but more importantly, its image aspect ratio is used in the form factors of digital camera image sensors. The 35 mm format, slightly misleadingly, is 36 mm wide and 24 mm high. So its aspect ratio (dividing by twelve to get the simplest whole number ratio) is 3:2. Many common formats (such as the APS format group) conform to these image aspect ratios or are very close to them.
ref: For example, the most common still image photography format in the world is 35mm, which was the dominant film size at the close of the analog film era. It is still produced today, but more importantly its aspect ratio has been inherited by digital camera image sensor formats. The 35mm format is actually, somewhat confusingly, 36mm in width by 24mm in height. The aspect ratio of this format (dividing by twelve to obtain the simplest whole-number ratio) is therefore said to be 3:2. Many common formats (APS family of formats, for example) are equal to or closely approximate this aspect ratio.

src: Tālummaiņas objektīvu trūkums ir tāds, ka fokusa sarežģītība un objektīvu elementu skaits, kas nepieciešami fokusa attāluma diapazona sasniegšanai, ir daudz lielāks nekā pamata objektīviem. Tas kļūst mazāk aktuāls jautājums, jo objektīvu ražotāji sasniedz augstākus standartus objektīvu ražošanā. Tas ļāva tālummaiņas objektīviem radīt tādas kvalitātes attēlus, kas ir līdzvērtīgi tiem, ko nodrošina objektīvi ar noteiktu fokusa attālumu. Vēl viens tālummaiņas objektīvu trūkums ir tas, ka objektīva maksimālā apertūra (ātrums) parasti ir mazāka. Tas padara lētus tālummaiņas objektīvus grūti lietojamus vājā apgaismojumā bez zibspuldzes.
mt: The main disadvantage of telephoto lenses is that the complexity of the focus and the number of elements required to achieve the focus range is much greater than in standard lenses. This becomes less of an issue as lens manufacturers achieve higher standards in lens production. This allowed telephoto lenses to produce images of quality equal to those produced by lenses with a fixed focus. Another disadvantage of telephoto lenses is that the maximum aperture (speed) is usually smaller. This makes cheap telephoto lenses difficult to use in dim lighting without a flash.
ref: The disadvantage of zoom lenses is that the focal complexity and number of lens elements required to achieve a range of focal lengths is much greater than for prime lenses. This is becoming less of an issue as lens manufacturers achieve higher standards in lens production. This has allowed zoom lenses to produce pictures of a quality comparable to that achieved by lenses with fixed focal length. Another disadvantage of zoom lenses is that the maximum aperture (the speed) of the lens is usually lower. This makes inexpensive zoom lenses hard to use in low-light conditions without a flash.

src: Misticisms tiecas pēc sazināšanās vai identificēšanās ar augstāko realitāti, dievišķīgumu, garīgo patiesību vai Dievu, vai visa iepriekš minētā apzināšanos. Ticīgais meklē tiešu pieredzi, intuīciju vai ieskatu dievišķīgajā realitātē/dievībā vai dievībās. Sekotāji nododas noteiktiem dzīvesveidiem vai darbībām, kuru mērķis ir stiprināt šīs pieredzes. Misticisms no citām reliģiskās pārliecības un kulta formām atšķiras ar to, ka uzsvars tiek likts uz unikāla apziņas stāvokļa tiešu, personīgu pieredzi, īpaši tāda stāvokļa, kam ir mierīgs, izprotošs, svētlaimīgs vai pat ekstātisks raksturs.
mt: Mysticism is the practice of entering a non-ordinary state of consciousness in order to get in touch with an ultimate reality, a transcendent otherworld or divinity. Mystics seek direct experience or intuition of a supreme reality beyond the details of their human cultural consciousness. The aim of mysticism is variously understood as union with an objective transcendent reality (God, ultimate or absolute principle), attainment of the "real" truth, or simply spiritual insight or ecstasy. Mysticism is often taken to refer to the achievement of an experiential knowledge of God, the divine or ultimately real. Mysticism is a particular means to that end, and often involves direct experience, as opposed to the more formal, institutionalized means of religion. Mysticism is sometimes taken to refer to a variety of religious practices, which are not necessarily oriented toward an ultimate reality, but which may be oriented toward achieving spiritual insight or ecstasy.
ref: Mysticism is the pursuit of communion with, identity with, or conscious awareness of an ultimate reality, divinity, spiritual truth, or God. The believer seeks a direct experience, intuition, or insight into divine reality/the deity or dieties. Followers pursue certain ways of living, or practices that are intended to nurture those experiences. Mysticism can be distinguished from other forms of religious belief and worship by its emphasis on the direct personal experience of a unique state of consciousness, particularly those of a peaceful, insightful, blissful, or even ecstatic character.

src: "19. un 20. gs. ilgu laiku tika uzskatīts, ka pirmie Jaunzēlandes iedzīvotāji bija maori, kuri medīja milzīgus putnus, ko sauca ""moa"". Tad teorija iedibināja ideju, ka maoru tauta migrēja no Polinēzijas lielā flotē un moriori tautai atņēma Jaunzēlandi, izveidojot lauksaimniecības sabiedrību. Tomēr jauni pierādījumi liecina, ka moriori bija cietzemes maori, kuri migrējuši no Jaunzēlandes uz Četemas salām, attīstot savu īpašo, miermīlīgo kultūru. Četema salās bija arī cita cilts - maori - kas aizceļoja prom no Jaunzēlandes. Viņi sauca sevi par moriori, bija dažas sadursmes, un beigās moriori tika iznīcināti"
mt: 19th and 20th century, it was long believed that the first New Zealanders were the Maori, who hunted giant birds called "moa". Then the theory established the idea that the Maori people migrated from Polynesia in a large fleet and took away New Zealand from the Moriori people, creating a farming society. However, new evidence suggests that the Moriori were land-based Maori who migrated from New Zealand to the Chatham Islands, developing their own peaceful culture. There was also another tribe - Maori - who sailed away from New Zealand. They called themselves Moriori, there were some clashes, and in the end the Moriori were exterminated.
ref: For a long time during the nineteenth and twentieth centuries, it was believed the first inhabitants of New Zealand were the Maori people, who hunted giant birds called moas. The theory then established the idea that the Maori people migrated from Polynesia in a Great Fleet and took New Zealand from the Moriori, establishing an agricultural society. However, new evidence suggests that the Moriori were a group of mainland Maori who migrated from New Zealand to the Chatham Islands, developing their own distinctive, peaceful culture. There was also another tribe on the Chatham islands these were Maori who migrated away from New Zealand. They called themselves the Moriori there were a few skirmishes and in the end, the Moriori were wiped out

src: „Pureland” origami ir origami, kā locīšanai ir šāds ierobežojums: vienlaikus var veikt tikai vienu locījumu; sarežģītāki locīšanas paņēmieni, piemēram, locīšana uz pretējo pusi, nav atļauti, un visiem locījumiem ir vienkāršs izvietojums. To 1970. gados izstrādāja Džons Smits, lai palīdzētu nepieredzējušiem locītājiem vai cilvēkiem, kam ir ierobežotas motorās prasmes.
mt: “Pureland” origami is origami, as folding goes, has this restriction: only one fold can be made at a time; more complex folds, such as folding to the other side, are not allowed, and all folds have a simple layout. It was developed in the 1970s by John Smith to help novice folders or people with limited motor skills.
ref: Pureland origami is origami with the restriction that only one fold may be done at a time, more complex folds like reverse folds are not allowed, and all folds have straightforward locations. It was developed by John Smith in the 1970s to help inexperienced folders or those with limited motor skills.

src: Indas ielejas civilizācija bija bronzas laikmeta civilizācija Indijas ziemeļrietumu subkontinentā, aptverot lielāko daļu mūsdienu Pakistānas un dažus reģionus Indijas ziemeļrietumos un Afganistānas ziemeļaustrumos. Civilizācija uzplauka Indas upes baseinos, tā iemesla dēļ iegūstot savu nosaukumu. Lai arī daži zinātnieki lēš, ka, tā kā civilizācija pastāvēja arī šobrīd izžuvušās Sarasvati upes baseina teritorijā, to varētu nosaukt par indusu-sarasvati civilizāciju, savukārt citi to sauc par harapiešu civilizāciju, kas nosaukta Harapas pilsētas vārdā un kuras pirmie izrakumi tika veikti 20. gs. divdesmitajos gados.
mt: The Indus Valley Civilisation was a Bronze Age civilisation in South Asia, mostly in the modern territories of India and Pakistan. The civilisation stretched from modern-day northeast Afghanistan, through northwestern India to Pakistan and eastward as far as the Ganges plain in India. The civilisation flourished in the period from 2600 to 1900 BCE. The Indus Valley Civilisation was one of the largest early civilisations and one of the most linguistically and culturally diverse civilisations in world history. It is notable for its early urbanisation, sophisticated city planning, arts, and writing system. By 2600 BCE, all the components of urban life were well developed in the Indus Valley. The Indus Valley Civilisation was one of the earliest urban civilisations in the world, along with its contemporary, the civilisation of Mesopotamia, and the later civilisation of Ancient Egypt. The Indus Valley Civilisation was followed by the Vedic period, which was characterised by the composition of the Vedas, the oldest scriptures in the world. The Indus Valley Civilisation was one of the largest early civilisations and one of the most linguistically and culturally diverse civilisations in world history. It is notable for its early urbanisation, sophisticated city planning, arts, and writing system. By 2600 BCE, all the components of urban life were well developed in the Indus Valley. The Indus Valley Civilisation was one of the earliest urban civilisations in the world, along with its contemporary, the civilisation of Mesopotamia, and the later civilisation of Ancient Egypt. The Indus Valley Civilisation was followed by the Vedic period, which was characterised by the composition of the Vedas, the oldest scriptures in the world.
ref: The Indus Valley Civilization was a Bronze Age civilisation in the northwest Indian subcontinent encompassing most of modern-day Pakistan and some regions in northwest India and northeast Afghanistan. The civilisation flourished in the basins of the Indus River wherefore it derives its name. Although some scholars speculate that since the civilisation also existed in the basins of the now dried up Sarasvati River, it should be aptly called the Indus-Sarasvati Civilization, while some call it the Harappan Civilization after Harappa, the first of its sites to be excavated in the 1920s.

src: Alkatība un savtīgums mūsos paliks vienmēr, un sadarbība pēc būtības ir tāda, ka situācijās, kurās vairākums gūst labumu, īstermiņā būs lielāks ieguvums, rīkojoties savtīgi. Cerams, ka vairums cilvēku sapratīs, ka ilgtermiņā viņu labākā iespēja ir sadarboties ar citiem.
mt: We will always remain united and cohesive, and cooperation in its essence is such that in situations where the majority benefits, in the long term there will be greater gain in acting cohesively. We hope that most people will understand that in the long term their best option is to cooperate with others.
ref: Greed and selfishness will always be with us and it is the nature of cooperation that when the majority benefit there will always be more to gain in the short term by acting selfishly Hopefully, most people will realise that their long term best option is to work together with others.

src: ASV imperiālisma kara izdevumus Filipīnu iekarošanā apmaksāja paši filipīnieši. Viņi bija spiesti maksāt nodokļus ASV koloniālajam režīmam, lai segtu lielāko daļu izdevumu, un procenti par obligācijām Filipīnu valdības vārdā plūda caur Volstrītas banku namiem. Protams, no filipīniešu tautas ilgās ekspluatācijas gūtā virspeļņa veidoja ASV imperiālisma pamatienākumus.
mt: The costs of the US imperial war of conquest in the Philippines were paid for by the Filipinos themselves. They were forced to pay taxes to the US colonial regime to cover most of the costs, and the interest on the bonds issued in the name of the Philippine government flowed through the Wall Street banks. Of course, the profits from the long exploitation of the Filipino people formed the basis of the US imperialist profits.
ref: The war expenditures of U.S. imperialism in the conquest of the Philippines were paid for by the Filipino people themselves. They were compelled to pay taxes to the U.S. colonial regime to defray a major part of the expenditures and the interest on bonds floated in the name of the Philippine government through the Wall Street banking houses. Of course, the superprofits derived from the protracted exploitation of the Filipino people would constitute the basic gains of U.S. imperialism.

src: Lai saprastu templiešus, ir jāsaprot vide, kas pamudināja izveidot ordeni. Laikmetu, kad notika notikumi, parasti sauc par vidējiem viduslaikiem - Eiropas vēstures periodu 11., 12. un 13. gadsimtā (1000. –1300.g. m.ē.). Pirms vidējiem viduslaikiem bija agrīnie viduslaiki, un pēc vidējiem viduslaikiem sekoja vēlīnie viduslaiki, kuri beidzas ap 1500. gadu.
mt: To understand the Templars, one must understand the environment that led to their creation. The period in which the events took place is usually referred to as the Middle Ages - the European history period of the 11th, 12th and 13th centuries (1000-1300 AD). Before the Middle Ages were the Early Middle Ages, and after the Middle Ages came the Late Middle Ages, which ended around 1500.
ref: To understand the Templars one must understand the context that prompted the creation of the order. The age where the events took place is commonly referred as the High Middle Ages the period of European history in the 11th, 12th, and 13th centuries (AD 1000–1300). The High Middle Ages were preceded by the Early Middle Ages and followed by the Late Middle Ages, which by convention ends around 1500.

src: Romas impērijas militārais raksturs palīdzēja medicīnas progresa attīstībā. Ārstus sāka algot imperators Augusts, kurš izveidoja pat pirmo romiešu medicīnas korpusu, kuru izmantoja karotāju ārstēšanai pēc cīņām. Ķirurgiem bija zināšanas par dažādiem nomierinošiem līdzekļiem, ieskaitot morfiju no magoņu sēklu ekstraktiem un skopolamīnu no driģeņu sēklām. Viņi kļuva prasmīgi amputācijā, lai glābtu pacientus no gangrēnas, kā arī par žņaugiem un artēriju skavām, lai apturētu asins plūsmu. Vairāku gadsimtu gaitā Romas impērijā tika gūti izcili sasniegumi medicīnas jomā un aptverta liela daļa zināšanu, kādas mums ir šodien.
mt: The military character of the Roman Empire helped the progress of medicine. Emperor Augustus began paying doctors, who formed the first Roman medical corps to treat soldiers after battles. Surgeons had knowledge of various anesthetics, including morphine from poppy seed extracts and scopolamine from henbane seeds. They became skilled at amputations to save patients from gangrene, as well as for abscesses and arterial hemorrhages to stop bleeding. Over the centuries, the Roman Empire made great strides in medicine and covered a large part of knowledge that we have today.
ref: The militaristic nature of the Roman empire aided in the development of medical advances. Doctors began to be recruited by Emperor Augustus and even formed the first Roman Medical Corps for use in the aftermath of battles. Surgeons had knowledge of various sedatives including morphine from extracts of poppy seeds and scopolamine from herbane seeds. They became proficient at amputation to save patients from gangrene as well as tourniquets and arterial clamps to stem blood flow. Over multiple centuries, the Roman empire led to great gains in the field of medicine and formed much of the knowledge we know today.

Ārstus sāka algot imperators Augusts, kurš izveidoja pat pirmo romiešu medicīnas korpusu, kuru izmantoja karotāju ārstēšanai pēc cīņām. Ķirurgiem bija zināšanas par dažādiem nomierinošiem līdzekļiem, ieskaitot morfiju no magoņu sēklu ekstraktiem un skopolamīnu no driģeņu sēklām. Viņi kļuva prasmīgi amputācijā, lai glābtu pacientus no gangrēnas, kā arī par žņaugiem un artēriju skavām, lai apturētu asins plūsmu. Vairāku gadsimtu gaitā Romas impērijā tika gūti izcili sasniegumi medicīnas jomā un aptverta liela daļa zināšanu, kādas mums ir šodien.
mt: The military character of the Roman Empire helped the progress of medicine. Emperor Augustus began paying doctors, who formed the first Roman medical corps to treat soldiers after battles. Surgeons had knowledge of various anesthetics, including morphine from poppy seed extracts and scopolamine from henbane seeds. They became skilled at amputations to save patients from gangrene, as well as for abscesses and arterial hemorrhages to stop bleeding. Over the centuries, the Roman Empire made great strides in medicine and covered a large part of knowledge that we have today.
ref: The militaristic nature of the Roman empire aided in the development of medical advances. Doctors began to be recruited by Emperor Augustus and even formed the first Roman Medical Corps for use in the aftermath of battles. Surgeons had knowledge of various sedatives including morphine from extracts of poppy seeds and scopolamine from herbane seeds. They became proficient at amputation to save patients from gangrene as well as tourniquets and arterial clamps to stem blood flow. Over multiple centuries, the Roman empire led to great gains in the field of medicine and formed much of the knowledge we know today.

src: Redze vai spēja redzēt ir atkarīga no redzes sistēmas maņu orgāniem vai acīm. Ir daudz dažādu acu konstrukciju, to sarežģītības diapazons ir atkarīgs no organisma prasībām. Dažādām konstrukcijām ir dažādas iespējas, tās ir jutīgas pret dažādiem viļņu garumiem un ar atšķirīgu asuma pakāpi, kā tām arī nepieciešama atšķirīga apstrāde, lai izprastu ievades jēgu, un dažādi skaitļi, lai darbotos optimāli.
mt: The ability to see is dependent on the visual system's sensory organs or eyes. There are many different eye constructions, the complexity range is dependent on the organism's needs. Different constructions have different abilities, they are sensitive to different wave lengths and with different degrees of sharpness, as well as different processing is needed to understand the input's meaning, and different numbers to operate optimally.
ref: Vision, or the ability to see depends on visual system sensory organs or eyes. There are many different constructions of eyes, ranging in complexity depending on the requirements of the organism. The different constructions have different capabilities, are sensitive to different wave-lengths and have differing degrees of acuity, also they require different processing to make sense of the input and different numbers to work optimally.

src: "Sikhisms ir reliģija, kuras sākumi meklējami Indijas subkontinentā. Tā radusies Pendžābas reģionā 15. gadsimtā, sektantiem atdaloties no hindu tradīcijas. Sikhi uzskata, ka viņu ticība un hinduisms ir atsevišķas reliģijas, taču viņi atzīst savas hindu saknes un tradīcijas. Sikhi savu reliģiju dēvē par gurmatu, kas pendžābu valodā nozīmē ""guru ceļš"". Guru ir fundamentāls aspekts visās indiešu reliģijās, bet sikhismā tas ir svarīgākais, kas veido sikhu ticības būtību. Reliģiju 15. gadsimtā nodibināja Guru Nanaks (1469–1539). Pēc kārtas tad sekoja vēl deviņi guru."
mt: Sikhism is a religion that originated in the Punjab region of the Indian subcontinent around the end of the 15th century. It is one of the youngest of the world's major religions. Sikhism is based on the teachings of Guru Nanak and, according to Sikh tradition, nine other Gurus. Sikhism is the fifth-largest organized religion in the world, with approximately 30 million Sikhs worldwide. Sikhism is the dominant religion in the Indian states of Punjab and Haryana; in the Indian union territory of Chandigarh; in the Indian regions of Haryana and Delhi; and in the Pakistani province of Punjab. Estimates of the Sikh population vary from a conservative estimate of 26 million to 28 million. The majority of Sikhs live in Punjab, India, and the Indian states of Haryana and Delhi. There are significant Sikh communities in the United Kingdom, the United States, Canada, and East Africa. The term Sikh has its origin in the Sanskrit word शिष्य (shishya), meaning "disciple", "student", or "learner". Sikhism is a monotheistic religion. Sikhism is based on the teachings of Guru Nanak and the nine Sikh Gurus that succeeded him. Sikhism is multi-faith, meaning that it is open to all faiths. Sikhism is a monotheistic religion. ref: "Sikhism is a religion from the Indian sub-continent. It originated in the Punjab region during the 15th century from a sectarian split within the Hindu tradition. Sikhs consider their faith to be a separate religion from Hinduism though they acknowledge its Hindu roots and traditions. Sikhs call their religion Gurmat, which is Punjabi for ""way of the guru"". The guru is a fundamental aspect of all Indian religions but in Sikhism has taken on an importance that forms the core of Sikh beliefs. The religion was founded in the 15th century by Guru Nanak (1469–1539). There followed in succession a further nine gurus."

src: "Uzmanības deficīta traucējumi ""ir neiroloģisks sindroms, kuru parasti raksturo trīs simptomi, tostarp impulsivitāte, koncentrēšanās spējas trūkums un hiperaktivitāte, jeb pārlieku liela enerģija"". Tā nav nespēja mācīties, bet mācīšanās traucējumi, kas skar no 3 līdz 5 procentiem  bērnu. Kopumā tie varētu būt līdz 2 miljoniem bērnu Amerikā"". Bērni ar uzmanības deficīta sindromu nespēj koncentrēties, piemēram, uz mācībām, taču spēj ilgstoši nodarboties ar to, kas viņiem patīk, piemēram, spēlēt spēles vai skatīties savas iemīļotās multfilmas vai rakstīt teikumus bez pieturzīmēm. Šie bērni mēdz nonākt daudzās nepatikšanās, jo viņi ""nododas riskantai uzvedībai, iesaistās kautiņos un izaicina autoritāti"", lai stimulētu savas smadzenes, jo viņu smadzenes nevar stimulēt ar parastām metodēm. Uzmanības deficīta sindroms ietekmē attiecības ar līdzcilvēkiem, jo pārējie bērni nesaprot, kāpēc viņi tā rīkojas vai kāpēc viņi tā raksta, vai arī kāpēc viņu attīstības līmenis ir citāds."
mt: "Attention deficit disorder is a neurologic syndrome that is typically characterized by three symptoms, including impulsivity, difficulty concentrating, and hyperactivity, or excessive energy." It is not a learning disability, but a learning disorder that affects 3 to 5 percent of children. Overall, it could affect up to 2 million children in America." Children with attention deficit disorder have difficulty concentrating, for example, on schoolwork, but can stay focused on what they like, for example, playing games or watching their favorite cartoons or writing sentences without pauses. These children often get into trouble, as they ""engage in risky behavior, get into fights and challenge authority"" to stimulate their brains, as their brains cannot be stimulated by normal methods. Attention deficit disorder affects relationships with peers, as other children do not understand why they act that way or why they write that way, or why their development level is different."
ref: "Attention Deficit Disorder ""is a neurological syndrome whose classic defining triad of symptoms including impulsivity, distractibility, and hyperactivity or excess energy"". It is not a learning disability, it is a learning disorder; it ""affects 3 to 5 percent of all children, perhaps as many as 2 million American children"". Children with ADD have a hard time focusing on things like school work, but they can concentrate on things they enjoy doing like playing games or watching their favorite cartoons or writing sentences without punctuation. These children tend to get into a lot of trouble, because they ""engage in risky behaviors, get into fights, and challenge authority"" in order to stimulate their brain, since their brain can not be stimulated by normal methods. ADD affects relationships with other peers because other children can not understand why they act the way that they do or why they spell they way they do or that their maturity level is different."

src: Uz projektiem balstītām mācībām apmācību procesu vajadzētu padarīt vieglāku un interesantāku, bet balstīšana ir solis uz priekšu. Balstīšanas pieeja nav mācīšanās metode, bet gan drīzāk kā atbalsta līdzeklis cilvēkiem, kuri mācās ko jaunu, piemēram, izmantot jaunu datorprogrammu vai sākt jaunu projektu. Balstīšana var notikt gan virtuāli, gan realitātē, citiem vārdiem sakot, kā balsts var būt skolotājs, bet tikpat labi arī mazais saspraudes cilvēciņš programmā Microsoft Office. Virtuālās sastatnes ir internalizētas programmatūrā, un tās ir domātas, lai jautātu, teiktu priekšā un izskaidrotu procedūras, kuras studentam varētu būt grūti atrisināt vienam pašam.
mt: Project-based learning should make the learning process easier and more interesting, but basing is a step forward. Basing is not a learning method, but rather a support tool for people who are learning something new, such as using a new computer program or starting a new project. Basing can be done both virtually and in reality, to put it another way, the support can be a teacher, but just as well a small, low-cost human in the Microsoft Office program. Virtual scaffolds are internalized in the software, and they are designed to ask, say, and explain procedures that a student may find difficult to solve on their own.
ref: While project based learning should make learning easier and more interesting, scaffolding goes a step beyond. Scaffolding is not a method of learning but rather an aid that provides support to individuals whom are undergoing a new learning experience such as using a new computer program or beginning a new project. Scaffolds can be both virtual and real, in other words, a teacher is a form of scaffold but so is the little paperclip man in Microsoft Office. Virtual Scaffolds are internalized in the software and are meant to question, prompt, and explain procedures that may have been to challenging for the student to handle alone.

src: MySpace ir trešā populārākā ASV izmantotā vietne, un pašlaik tajā ir izveidoti jau 54 miljoni profilu. Šīm tīmekļa vietnēm ir pievērsta liela uzmanība, īpaši izglītības vidē. Šīm tīmekļa vietnēm ir pozitīvi aspekti, tostarp iespēja viegli iestatīt klases lapu, kurā var būt emuāri, videoklipi, fotoattēli un citi līdzekļi. Šai lapai var viegli piekļūt, norādot tikai vienu tīmekļa adresi, kas ļauj to viegli atcerēties un studentiem, kuriem varētu būt problēmas ar tastatūras lietošanu vai pareizrakstību, to ir ērti ierakstīt. To var pielāgot, lai būtu viegli lasīt, kā arī iestatīt tik daudz vai maz krāsu, cik vēlaties.
mt: MySpace is the third most popular website in the United States, and currently has 54 million profiles. These websites have a lot of attention, especially in high school. These websites have positive aspects, such as the ability to easily set up a class page, which can have emuaries, video clips, photo images and other tools. This page can easily access, by specifying only one web address, which allows it to be easily remembered and students who may have problems with typing or spelling, it is easy to record. It can be adjusted to be easy to read, and set up as many or as little color as you want.
ref: MySpace is the third most popular website used in the United States and has 54 million profiles currently. These websites have gotten a lot of attention, especially in the education setting. There are positive aspects to these websites, which include, being able to easily setup a class page which can include blogs, videos, photos, and other features. This page can easily be accessed by providing just one web address, which makes it easy to remember and easy to type in for students who may have trouble using the keyboard or with spelling. It can be customized to make it easy to read and also with as much or little color as desired.

src: Tomēr 1956. gada jūnijā Hruščova solījumu patiesums tika pārbaudīts, kad Polijā sākās nemieri, kuros strādnieki protestēja pret pārtikas trūkumu un algu samazinājumu un kuri kļuva par vispārēju protestu pret komunismu. Lai arī beigās Hruščovs iesūtīja tankus, lai atjaunotu kārtību, viņš piekrita izpildīt dažas ekonomiska rakstura prasības un iecelt slaveno Vladislavu Gomulku par jauno premjerministru.
mt: 1956 June, however, the truthfulness of Hruschev's promise was tested when riots broke out in Poland, where workers protested against food shortages and wage cuts and which became a general protest against communism. Although in the end Hruschev sent in tanks to restore order, he agreed to implement some of the economic demands and appointed the famous Vladislav Gomulka as the new prime minister.
ref: However, in June 1956, Krushchev's promises were put to the test when riots in Poland, where workers were protesting against food shortages and wage cuts, turned into a general protest against Communism. Although in the end, Krushchev sent in tanks to restore order, he did give way to some economic demands and agreed to appoint the popular Wladyslaw Gomulka as the new prime minister.

src: Vācija bija kopīgs ienaidnieks 2. pasaules karā, līdz ar to starp PSRS un ASV izveidojās sadarbība. Karam beidzoties, atšķirīgo sistēmu, procesu un kultūras dēļ šīs valstis atkal kļuva naidīgas. Divus gadus pēc kara beigām bijušie sabiedrotie kļuva par ienaidniekiem, un sākās Aukstais karš. Tam bija lemts ilgt nākamos 40 gadus un, izmantojot pastarpinātas armijas, tika veikta reāla karadarbība kaujaslaukos no Āfrikas līdz Āzijai, Afganistānā, Kubā un daudzās citās vietās.
mt: Germany was a common enemy in the Second World War, so the USSR and the US formed an alliance. After the war, the two countries became enemies again, and the Cold War began. It lasted for the next 40 years, and real combat was carried out in battlefields from Africa to Asia, Afghanistan, Cuba, and many other places using proxy armies.
ref: Germany was a common enemy in World War 2, leading to cooperation between the USSR and USA. With the end of the war the clashes of system, process and culture led to the countries falling out. With two years of the end of the war, the former allies were now enemies and the Cold War began. It was to last for the next 40 years and would be fought for real, by proxy armies, on battlefields from Africa to Asia, in Afghanistan, Cuba and many other places.

src: Nervu sistēma uztur homeostāzi, sūtot nervu impulsus viscaur ķermenim, lai noturētu asins plūsmu darbībā un tā būtu netraucēta. Šos nervu impulsus var tik ātri nosūtīt viscaur ķermenim, kas palīdz aizsargāt ķermeni no jebkādiem iespējamiem draudiem.
mt: The nervous system maintains homeostasis by sending nerve impulses throughout the body to keep blood flow active and unimpeded. These nerve impulses can be sent quickly throughout the body, which helps protect the body from any possible threats.
ref: The Nervous System maintains homeostasis by sending nerve impulses through out the body to keep the flow of blood going as well as undisturbed. These nerve impulses can be sent so quickly throughout the body which helps keep the body safe from any potential threat.

src: "Lielā piramīda Gīzā ir vienīgā no septiņiem brīnumiem, kas šodien joprojām pastāv. Lielā piramīda, ko uzbūvēja ēģiptieši 3. gs. p.m.ē., ir viena no daudzajām milzīgo piramīdu konstrukcijām, kas tika uzcelta par godu mirušajam Faraonam. Ēģiptes Mirušo ielejā esošais Gīzas plato jeb ""Gīzas nekropole"" sastāv no vairākām piramīdām (no kurām lielākā ir Lielā piramīda), vairākām nelielām kapenēm, vairākiem tempļiem un Lielās Sfinksas. Lielā piramīda tika izveidota, lai godinātu faraonu Heopsu, un daudzas mazākās piramīdas, kapenes un tempļi tika uzcelti, lai godinātu Heopsa sievas un ģimenes locekļus."
mt: "The Great Pyramid of Giza is one of seven wonders that still exist today. The Great Pyramid, built by the Egyptians in the 3rd century BC, is one of many large pyramid structures built to honor the deceased Pharaoh. The Giza plateau, or the Giza Necropolis, consists of several pyramids (the largest being the Great Pyramid), several smaller tombs, several temples and the Great Sphinx. The Great Pyramid was built to honor Pharaoh Khufu, and several smaller pyramids, tombs and temples were built to honor Khufu's wives and family members."
ref: "The Great Pyramid at Giza is the only one of the seven wonders that is still standing today. Built by the Egyptians in the third century BCE, the Great Pyramid is one of many large pyramid structures built to honor dead Pharaoh. The Giza Plateau, or ""Giza Necropolis"" in the Egyptian Valley of the Dead contains several pyramids (of which the great pyramid is the largest), several small tombs, several temples, and the great Sphinx. The great pyramid was created to honor the Pharaoh Khufu, and many of the smaller pyramids, tombs, and temples were built to honor Khufu's wives and family members."

src: Artemīdas templis Efesā tika iznīcināts 356. gada 21. jūlijā p.m.ē., kad Hērostrats to nodedzināja. Spriežot pēc stāsta, viņa motivācija bija gūt slavu par katru cenu. Saniknotie efezieši paziņoja, ka Herostratusa vārds nekad netiks ierakstīts vēsturē. Grieķu vēsturnieks Strabo vēlāk pieminēja šo vārdu, tādējādi mūsdienās mums tas ir zināms. Templis tika sagrauts tajā pašā naktī, kad piedzima Aleksandrs Lielais. Būdams karalis, Aleksandrs piedāvāja samaksāt, lai atjaunotu templi, taču viņa piedāvājums tika noraidīts. Vēlāk pēc Aleksandra nāves templi atkal atjaunoja 323. gadā p.m.ē.
mt: The Temple of Artemis at Ephesus was destroyed in 356 BC on July 21, when Herostratus burned it down. According to the story, his motivation was to gain fame at any cost. The Ephesians vowed never to speak the name of Herostratus. Greek historian Strabo later mentioned this name, so now we know it. The temple was destroyed on the same night that Alexander the Great was born. As king, Alexander offered to pay to rebuild the temple, but his offer was rejected. Later, after Alexander's death, the temple was rebuilt in 323 BC.
ref: The temple of Artemis at Ephesus was destroyed on July 21, 356 BCE in an act of arson committed by Herostratus. According to the story, his motivation was fame at any cost. The Ephesians, outraged, announced that Herostratus' name never be recorded. The Greek historian Strabo later noted the name, which is how we know today. The temple was destroyed on the same night that Alexander the Great was born. Alexander, as king, offered to pay to rebuild the temple, but his offer was denied. Later, after Alexander died, the temple was rebuilt in 323 BCE.

src: Pirmais zināmais pārvietošanās veids bija staigāšana, cilvēki sāka staigāt stāvus pirms diviem miljoniem gadu, parādoties Homo Erectus (tas nozīmē stāvošu cilvēku). Viņu priekšteči australopiteki negāja stāvus kā ierasts. Divkājaini īpatņi jau tika atrasti australopitēku virsģints fosilijās, kas dzīvojuši pirms 4,2–3,9 miljoniem gadu, lai gan sāhelantropu ģints pārstāvji, iespējams, staigāja uz divām kājām jau pirms 7 miljoniem gadu.
mt: The first known mode of bipedal movement was walking, humans began walking upright before two million years ago, showing Homo Erectus (meaning upright humans). Their predecessors Australopithecus did not walk upright as a habit. Bipedal australopithecus fossils have been found dating back 4.2–3.9 million years, although the Sahelanthropus genus may have walked upright as early as 7 million years ago.
ref: The first known transportation was walking, humans began walking upright two million years ago with the emergence of Homo Erectus (meaning upright man). Their predecessors, the Australopithecus did not walk upright as habitually. Bipedal specializations are found in Australopithecus fossils from 4.2-3.9 million years ago, although Sahelanthropus may have walked on two legs as early as seven million years ago.

src: Kuģu izmantošana preču pārvadāšanai joprojām ir visefektīvākais veids, kā pārvietot lielu daudzumu cilvēku un preču pāri okeāniem. Jūras kara flotes uzdevums tradicionāli ir bijis nodrošināt, lai jūsu valsts saglabā spēju pārvietot savus cilvēkus un preces, vienlaikus traucējot ienaidnieka spēju pārvietot savu tautu un preces. Viens no ievērības cienīgākajiem nesenajiem piemēriem tam bija 2. Pasaules kara Ziemeļatlantijas kampaņa. Amerikāņi mēģināja pārvest vīrus un materiālus pāri Atlantijas okeānam, lai palīdzētu Lielbritānijai. Tajā pašā laikā vāciešu flote, izmantojot galvenokārt zemūdenes, centās apturēt šo satiksmi. Ja sabiedrotajiem tas nebūtu izdevies, Vācija, visticamāk, būtu iekarojusi Lielbritāniju tāpat kā visas pārējās Eiropas valstis.
mt: The use of ships to transport goods is still the most effective way to move large amounts of people and goods across oceans. The Navy's traditional role has been to ensure that your country retains the ability to move your people and goods, while disrupting your enemy's ability to move their people and goods. One of the most notable recent examples of this was the North Atlantic campaign of World War II. The Americans were trying to move viruses and materials across the Atlantic to help Britain. At the same time, the German navy, using mostly submarines, was trying to stop this traffic. If the allies had not succeeded, Germany would have likely conquered Britain just as it did with all the other European countries.
ref: Using ships to transport goods is by far the most efficient way to move large amounts of people and goods across oceans. The job of navies has traditionally been to ensure that your country maintains the ability to move your people and goods, while at the same time, interfering with your enemy's ability to move his people and goods. One of the most noteworthy recent examples of this was the North Atlantic campaign of WWII. The Americans were trying to move men and materials across the Atlantic Ocean to help Britain. At the same time, the German navy, using mainly U-boats, was trying to stop this traffic. Had the Allies failed, Germany probably would have been able to conquer Britain as it had the rest of Europe.

src: Riteņu ar spieķiem izgudrošana padarīja asīriešu kaujas ratus vieglākus, ātrākus un labāk sagatavotus karavīru un citu kaujas ratu apsteigšanai. No viņu nāvējošajiem stopiem raidītās bultas varēja izšauties cauri pretinieku karavīru bruņutērpiem. Ap 1000. gadu p.m.ē. asīrieši izveidoja pirmo kavalēriju. Kavalērija ir karaspēks, kas cīnās, jājot uz zirgiem. Segli vēl nebija izgudroti, tādēļ asīriešu kavalērija cīnījās, sēžot uz neapseglotiem zirgiem.
mt: The invention of the stirrup made the Assyrian chariot a lighter, faster, and better prepared force than its rivals. The chariots' javelin-like spears could pierce through the enemy's armor. Around 1000 B.C., the Assyrians created the first cavalry. Cavalry is a force that fights while riding horses. Saddles had not yet been invented, so the Assyrian cavalry fought while sitting on unbridled horses.
ref: The invention of spoke wheels made Assyrian chariots lighter, faster, and better prepared to outrun soldiers and other chariots. Arrows from their deadly crossbows could penetrate the armor of rival soldiers. About 1000 B.C., the Assyrians introduced the first cavalry. A cavalry is an army that fights on horseback. The saddle had not yet been invented, so the Assyrian cavalry fought on the bare backs of their horses.

src: Babilonieši katram savam dievam uzcēla galveno templi, kas tika uzskatīts par dieva mājvietu. Cilvēki nesa dieviem ziedojumus, bet priesteri mēģināja izdabāt dievu vajadzībām, rīkojot ceremonijas un festivālus. Ikvienā templī bija atvērtais tempļa iekšpagalms un tālāk iekšējā svētnīca, kurā drīkstēja ieiet tikai priesteri. Dažreiz kā daļa no tempļa tika būvēti speciāli piramīdveida torņi, ko sauca par zikurātiem. Torņa augšdaļa bija īpaša svētnīca dievam.
mt: The Babylonians built a main temple for each of their gods, which was considered the god's home. People brought gifts to the gods, but the priests tried to create the gods' needs by holding ceremonies and festivals. Each temple had an open inner courtyard and a further inner sanctuary, where only priests could enter. Sometimes part of the temple was built as a special pyramid-shaped tower, which was called a ziggurat. The top of the tower was a special sanctuary for the god.
ref: The Babylonians built each of their gods a primary temple that was considered the home of the god. People would bring sacrifices to the gods and the priests would try to attend to the needs of the gods through ceremonies and festivals. Each temple had an open temple courtyard and then an inner sanctuary that only the priests could enter. Sometimes special pyramid shaped towers, called ziggurats, were built to be a part of the temples. The top of the tower was special sanctuary for the god.

src: "Jā! Faraons Tutanhamons (angliski dažkārt dēvēts kā ""Faraons Tuts"" vai ""Puisēns – faraons"") mūsdienās ir viens no viszināmākajiem senās Ēģiptes faraoniem. Interesanti, ka senatnē viņš netika uzskatīts par nozīmīgu un netika iekļauts vairumā seno karaļu sarakstu. Tomēr viņa kapeņu atklāšana 1922. gadā padarīja viņu par slavenību. Lai gan daudzas senās kapenes ir tikušas izlaupītas, šīs kapenes bija gandrīz neskartas. Lielākā daļa priekšmetu, kas tika apglabāta kopā ar Tutanhamonu, ir labi saglabājušies; to starpā ir tūkstošiem no dārgmetāla un retiem akmeņiem izgatavotu artefaktu."
mt: "Yes! Pharaoh Tutankhamun (sometimes called "Pharaoh Tut" or "Boy-Pharaoh") is one of the most famous ancient Egyptian pharaohs. It is interesting that in ancient times he was not considered important and was not included in the majority of ancient kings lists. However, his tomb discovery in 1922 made him a celebrity. Although many ancient tombs have been looted, this tomb was almost untouched. Most of the items buried with Tutankhamun have survived well; among them are thousands of artifacts made of precious metal and rare stones."
ref: "Yes! King Tutankhamun, sometimes referred to as ""King Tut"" or ""The Boy King"", is one of the most well known ancient Egyptian kings in modern times. Interestingly, he was not considered to be very important in ancient times and was not recorded on most ancient king lists. However, the discovery of his tomb in 1922 made him a celebrity. While many tombs of the past were robbed, this tomb was left virtually undisturbed. Most of the items buried with Tutankhamun have been well preserved, including thousands of artefacts made from precious metals and rare stones."
