src: Viena no Šarlotas (Ziemeļkarolīna) lielākajām vērtībām ir tā, ka pilsētā ir pieejamas neskaitāmas augstas kvalitātes iespējas ģimenēm. Citu apgabalu iedzīvotāji bieži vien kā galveno pārcelšanās iemeslu uz šo pilsētu min ģimenei draudzīgu vidi, savukārt pilsētas viesi nereti atzīst, ka ir viegli gūt prieku pilsētā, kur visapkārt ir bērni. Pēdējo 20 gadu laikā bērniem draudzīgu iespēju skaits Šarlotas centrā ir eksponenciāli palielinājies. Ģimenes Šarlotā taksometrus parasti neizmanto, lai gan noteiktos apstākļos tie var būt noderīgi. Par vairāk nekā 2 pasažieru pārvadāšanu tiek piemērota papildmaksa, tāpēc šī iespēja var būt dārgāka nekā nepieciešams.
mt: One of Charlotte's (North Carolina) greatest assets is that the city offers families many high-quality opportunities. Residents of other counties often cite family-friendly environment as the main reason for moving to this city, while visitors often say that it is easy to enjoy the city, where there are children everywhere. In the last 20 years, the number of family-friendly opportunities in the center of Charlotte has increased exponentially. Families in Charlotte usually do not use taxis, but in certain conditions they can be useful. A surcharge is applied for more than 2 passengers, so this option can be expensive than necessary.
ref: One of strong points of Charlotte, North Carolina, is that it has an abundance of high-quality options for families. Residents from other areas often cite family-friendliness as a primary reason for moving there, and visitors often find the city easy to enjoy with children around. In the past 20 years, the amount of child-friendly options in Uptown Charlotte has grown exponentially. Taxis are not generally used by families in Charlotte, though they can be of some use in certain circumstances. There is a surcharge for having more than 2 passengers, so this option might be more expensive than necessary.

src: Pirms spāņu ierašanās 16. gs. Čīles ziemeļu daļā valdīja inki, savukārt tās centrālo un dienviddaļu apdzīvoja iezemiešu tauta araukānieši (mapučes). Mapuči bija arī viena no pēdējām neatkarīgajām amerikāņu pamatiedzīvotāju grupām, kas līdz Čīles neatkarības atgūšanai pilnībā netika iekļauta spāniski runājošajā valdīšanā. Lai arī Čīle pasludināja neatkarību 1810. gadā (Napoleona karu starplaikā, kad Spānijai pāris gadus nebija funkcionējošas centrālās valdības), izšķiroša uzvara pār spāņu iekarotājiem netika panākta vēl līdz 1818. gadam.
mt: 16th century Spain ruled the northern part of Chile, while the central and southern part was inhabited by the Araucanian people (Mapuche). The Mapuche were one of the last independent American indigenous groups to be fully incorporated into Spanish rule before Chile's independence. Although Chile declared independence in 1810 (during the Napoleonic Wars, when Spain had no functioning central government), the decisive victory over Spanish forces was not achieved until 1818.
ref: Before the Spanish arrived in the 16th century, northern Chile was under Inca rule while the indigenous Araucanians (Mapuche) inhabited central and southern Chile. The Mapuche were also one of the last independent American indigenous groups, that were not fully absorbed into Spanish-speaking rule until after Chile's independence. Although Chile declared independence in 1810 (amid the Napoleonic wars that left Spain without a functioning central government for a couple of years), decisive victory over the Spanish was not achieved until 1818.

src: "Cinque Terre, kas nozīmē ""piecas zemes"", ietver piecus piekrastes ciematus, konkrēti, Riomaggiore, Manarola, Corniglia, Vernazza un Monterosso, kas atrodas Itālijā, Ligūrijas reģionā. Tie ir iekļauti UNESCO pasaules mantojuma sarakstā. Gadsimtu gaitā cilvēki ir rūpīgi izbūvējuši terases izrobotajā, stāvajā ainavā cieši pie klintīm, kas paceļas virs jūras. Daļa no tās šarma ir tā, ka tajā nav manāma nekāda uzņēmējdarbības attīstība. Ciematus savieno ceļi, vilcieni un laivas, taču automašīnas no ārpuses tiem nevar piekļūt."
mt: "Cinque Terre, which means "five lands", includes five coastal villages, specifically, Riomaggiore, Manarola, Corniglia, Vernazza and Monterosso, located in Italy, in the Ligurian region. They are included in the UNESCO World Heritage List. Centuries people have carefully built terraces in the flat, steep landscape close to the cliffs overlooking the sea. Part of its charm is that there is no visible development of business. The villages are connected by roads, trains and boats, but cars cannot access them from outside."
ref: Cinque Terre, which means Five Lands, comprises the five small coastal villages of Riomaggiore, Manarola, Corniglia, Vernazza and Monterosso located in the Italian region of Liguria. They are listed on the UNESCO World Heritage List. Over the centuries, people have carefully built terraces on the rugged, steep landscape right up to the cliffs that overlook the sea. Part of its charm is the lack of visible corporate development. Paths, trains and boats connect the villages, and cars cannot reach them from the outside.

src: Visbiežākais nelaimes gadījumu cēlonis ziemā ir slideni ceļi, trotuāri (ietves) un it īpaši pakāpieni. Kā minimums ir nepieciešami apavi ar piemērotām zolēm. Vasaras apavi uz ledus un sniegā parasti ļoti slīd, un pat daži ziemas zābaki nav pietiekami labi. Struktūrai jābūt pietiekami dziļai, 5 mm (1/5 collas) vai vairāk, un materiālam aukstā temperatūrā jābūt pietiekami mīkstam. Dažiem zābakiem ir naglas, un slideniem apstākļiem ir pieejams arī uzliekams naglots aprīkojums, kas der lielākajai daļai kurpju un zābaku, kā arī papēžiem vai papēžiem un zolei. Papēžiem jābūt zemiem un platiem. Bieži vien uz ceļiem tiek izkaisītas smiltis, grants vai sāls (kalcija hlorīds), lai uzlabotu saķeri.
mt: The most common cause of winter accidents is slippery roads, sidewalks and especially stairs. As a minimum, you need boots with appropriate soles. Summer boots on ice and snow are usually very slippery, and even some winter boots are not good enough. The tread should be deep enough, 5 mm (1/5 inch) or more, and the material should be soft enough at cold temperatures. Some boots have cleats, and there is also a removable cleat system available for most shoes and boots, as well as for snowshoes or snowshoes and soles. Snowshoes should be flat and wide. Often, sand, gravel or salt (calcium chloride) is spread on roads to improve traction.
ref: The most common cause for accidents in winter is slippery roads, pavements (sidewalks) and especially steps. At a minimum, you need footwear with suitable soles. Summer shoes are usually very slippery on ice and snow, even some winter boots are deficient. The pattern should be deep enough, 5 mm (1/5 inch) or more, and the material soft enough in cold temperatures. Some boots have studs and there is studded add-on equipment for slippery conditions, suitable for most shoes and boots, for the heels or heels and sole. Heels should be low and wide. Sand, gravel or salt (calcium chloride) is often scattered on roads or paths to improve traction.

src: "Kuka salas ir salu valsts, kas ir brīvā asociācijā ar Jaunzēlandi, atrodas Polinēzijā, Klusā okeāna dienvidu vidū. Tas ir no 15 salām sastāvošs arhipelāgs, kurš aizņem vairāk nekā 2,2 miljonus km2 okeāna teritorijas. Tā kā šīs salas atrodas vienā laika joslā ar Havaju salām, tās reizēm tiek dēvētas par ""Austrālijas Havaju salām"". Lai arī mazāka, tā dažiem vecāka gadagājuma tūristiem atgādina par Havaju salām pirms štata statusa iegūšanas, bez visām lielajām tūristu viesnīcām un citas attīstības. Kuka salās nav nevienas pilsētas, bet tās sastāv no 15 dažādām salām. Galvenās no tām ir Rarotonga un Aitutaki."
mt: "Cook Islands is a state in free association with New Zealand, in the southern Pacific Ocean. It is a collection of 15 islands scattered over a vast area of ocean, with a total land area of 2.2 million km2. Because of its location in the same time zone as Hawaii, it is sometimes referred to as the "Hawaii of the South Pacific". Although smaller and older, it is sometimes mistaken for Hawaii by older tourists before statehood. It lacks the large tourist resorts and other development of Hawaii. The Cook Islands have no cities, but are made up of 15 islands. The main ones are Rarotonga and Aitutaki."
ref: "The Cook Islands are an island country in free association with New Zealand, located in Polynesia, in the middle of the South Pacific Ocean. It is an archipelago with 15 islands spread out over 2.2 million km2 of ocean. With the same time zone as Hawaii, the islands are sometimes thought of as ""Hawaii down under"". Though smaller, it reminds some elderly visitors of Hawaii before statehood without all the large tourist hotels and other development. The Cook Islands do not have any cities but are composed of 15 different islands. The main ones are Rarotonga and Aitutaki."

src: Atļaujas ir jārezervē iepriekš. Lai pārnakšņotu Sirenā, jums ir jābūt atļaujai. Sirena ir vienīgā mežziņu stacija, kurā papildus kempingam tiek piedāvāta kopmītņu tipa naktsmītne un silts ēdiens. Laleonā, Sanpedriljo un Lospatosā tiek piedāvāts tikai kempings, bet ēdināšanas pakalpojumu tur nav. Parka atļaujas ir iespējams saņemt reindžeru stacijā Puertohimenesā, bet tur netiek pieņemtas kredītkartes. Parka dienests (MINAE) neizsniedz parka atļaujas vairāk kā mēnesi iepriekš pirms paredzamās ierašanās. CafeNet El Sol piedāvā rezervācijas pakalpojumu par 30 ASV dolāriem, jeb 10 dolāri par vienas dienas ieejas biļeti. Plašāka informācija atrodama Korkovado mājaslapā.
mt: 1. Reservations are required. You must have a permit to camp in Sirena. Sirena is the only ranger station in the park that offers a communal kitchen and hot meals. In Laleona, Sanpedrillo and Los Patos, only camping is offered, and there is no food service. Park permits can be obtained at the Puerto Humeño ranger station, but they do not accept credit cards. The park office (MINAE) does not issue park permits more than a month in advance of your arrival. CafeNet El Sol offers a reservation service for $30 USD, or $10 USD per day entrance fee. More information is available on the Corcovado website.
ref: Permits must be reserved in advance. You must have a permit to stay overnight at Sirena. Sirena is the only ranger station that offers dormitory lodging and hot meals in addition to camping. La Leona, San Pedrillo, and Los Patos offer only camping with no food service. It is possible to secure park permits directly from the Ranger Station in Puerto Jiménez, but they do not accept credit cards The Park Service (MINAE) does not issue park permits more than one month in advance of anticipated arrival. CafeNet El Sol offers a reservation service for a fee of US$30, or $10 for one-day passes; details on their Corcovado page.

La Leona, San Pedrillo, and Los Patos offer only camping with no food service. It is possible to secure park permits directly from the Ranger Station in Puerto Jiménez, but they do not accept credit cards The Park Service (MINAE) does not issue park permits more than one month in advance of anticipated arrival. CafeNet El Sol offers a reservation service for a fee of US$30, or $10 for one-day passes; details on their Corcovado page.

src: Ceļošana ar mugursomām uz slēpēm: šo nodarbi sauc arī par distanču slēpošanu, slēpošanas tūrismu vai slēpošanas pārgājieniem. Tas ir saistīts, bet ne vienmēr ietver kalnā kāpšanu ar slēpēm vai alpīnismu; pēdējā gadījumā šīs aktivitātes notiek uz stāvākām nogāzēm, un ir nepieciešamas stingrākas slēpes un zābaki. Domājiet par slēpošanas maršrutu kā par līdzīgu pārgājiena maršrutu. Labos apstākļos varēsiet pārvarēt lielākus attālumus nekā staigājot — tomēr jums ļoti reti izdosies sasniegt distanču slēpošanas ātrumu bez smagas mugursomas un gatavas trases.
mt: Backcountry skiing is also known as ski touring, ski tourism, or ski traverses. It is related to, but not always synonymous with, mountaineering with skis or alpinism; the latter is done on steeper slopes, and requires stiffer skis and skins. Think of a ski touring route as a similar to a hiking route. In good conditions you can cover greater distances than walking — but you will rarely be able to match the speed of ski touring without a serious fall and a prepared track.
ref: Backpacking by ski: This activity is also called backcountry ski, ski touring or ski hiking. It is related to but usually not involving alpine style ski touring or mountaineering, the latter ones done in steep terrain and requiring much stiffer skis and boots. Think of the skiing route as of a similar hiking route. In good conditions you will be able to cover somewhat greater distances than walking – but only very seldom you will get the speeds of cross country skiing without a heavy backpack in groomed tracks.

src: Atgriešanās šoks iestājas ātrāk nekā kultūršoks (ir īsāka medusmēneša fāze), turpinās ilgāk un var būt smagāks. Ceļotājiem, kuriem bija viegli pielāgoties jaunajai kultūrai, dažreiz ir īpaši grūti pielāgoties savai dzimtajai kultūrai. Atgriežoties mājās pēc dzīves ārzemēs, jūs esat pielāgojies jaunajai kultūrai un zaudējis dažus savas dzimtenes kultūras ieradumus. Kad jūs sākotnēji devāties uz ārzemēm, cilvēki, visticamāk, bija pacietīgi un saprotoši, zinot, ka ceļotājiem jaunā valstī ir jāpielāgojas. Cilvēki var nenojaust, ka arī ceļotājiem, kuri atgriežas mājās, ir nepieciešama pacietība un sapratne.
mt: The shock of returning home is faster than the culture shock (is a shorter honey moon phase), continues longer and can be more severe. Travelers who easily adapted to the new culture often have the hardest time readapting to their home culture. Returning home after living abroad, you have adapted to the new culture and lost some of your home culture customs. When you first left for abroad, people were probably patient and understanding, knowing that travelers have to adapt. People may not realize that even travelers returning home need patience and understanding.
ref: Re-entry shock comes on sooner than culture shock (there's less of a honeymoon phase), lasts longer, and can be more severe. Travellers who had an easy time adjusting to the new culture sometimes have a particularly hard time readjusting to their native culture. When returning home after living abroad, you've adapted to the new culture and lost some of your habits from your home culture. When you went abroad at first, people were probably patient and understanding, knowing that travellers in a new country need to adapt. People may not anticipate that patience and understanding are also necessary for travellers returning home.

src: Ziemeļamerikas aļņiem (dēvētiem arī par aļņiem) nav raksturīga agresivitāte, bet, sajūtot briesmas, viņi sevi aizsargās. Kad cilvēki aļņus neuzskata par potenciāli bīstamiem, viņi var pieiet tiem pārāk tuvu un pakļaut sevi riskam.
mt: North American black bears are not known for their aggressiveness, but when they feel threatened, they will defend themselves. When people don't perceive black bears as potentially dangerous, they can get too close and put themselves at risk.
ref: Moose (also known as elk) aren't inherently aggressive, but will defend themselves if they perceive a threat. When people don't see moose as potentially dangerous, they may approach too closely and put themselves at risk.

src: Ziemeļamerikas aļņiem (dēvētiem arī par aļņiem) nav raksturīga agresivitāte, bet, sajūtot briesmas, viņi sevi aizsargās. Kad cilvēki aļņus neuzskata par potenciāli bīstamiem, viņi var pieiet tiem pārāk tuvu un pakļaut sevi riskam.

src: Dienas karstajā laikā ceļotāji var redzēt mirāžu, kas rada ūdens (vai citu lietu) ilūziju. Tie var būt bīstami, ja ceļotājs dzenas pakaļ mirāžai, tērējot vērtīgo enerģiju un atlikušo ūdeni. Pat viskarstākajos tuksnešos naktī var būt ārkārtīgi auksti. Hipotermija ir reāls apdraudējums, ja līdzi nav siltas drēbes.
mt: In hot weather, mirages can be seen, which create an illusion of water (or other things). They can be dangerous if a traveler chases a mirage, expending valuable energy and leaving behind the water. Even in the hottest deserts at night it can be very cold. Hypothermia is a real threat if no warm clothes are carried.
ref: In the heat of the day, travelers can experience mirages that give the illusion of water (or other things). These can be dangerous if the traveler pursue the mirage, wasting precious energy and remaining water. Even the hottest of deserts can become extremely cold at night. Hypothermia is a real risk without warm clothing.

src: "Dominikānas Republika (spāņu valodā: República Dominicana) ir Karību jūras reģiona valsts, kas aizņem Hispaniola salas austrumu pusi, kuru tā dala ar Haiti. Vēl bez balto smilšu pludmalēm un kalnu ainavām, šajā valstī atrodas eiropiešu vecākā pilsēta Amerikas kontinentos, kas šobrīd ir daļa no Santodomingo. Pirmie salu apdzīvoja tainosi un karibesi. Karibesi bija aravaku valodā runājoša tauta, kas bija ieradusies aptuveni 10 000 gadu pirms mūsu ēras. Pavisam nedaudzus gadus pēc tam, kad no Eiropas bija ieradušies pētnieki, spāņu konkistadori būtiski samazināja vietējo iedzīvotāju taino skaitu. Spriežot pēc Freja Bartolomeja de las Kasas rakstiem (""Tratado de las Indias""), laika periodā no 1492. līdz 1498. gadam spāņu iekarotāji nogalināja apmēram 100 000 tainosu."
mt: "The Dominican Republic (Spanish: República Dominicana) is a Caribbean country that occupies the eastern two-thirds of the island of Hispaniola, which it shares with Haiti. Besides white sand beaches and mountain scenery, this country also has the oldest European city in the Americas, now part of Santo Domingo. The first inhabitants of the island were the Taíno and the Caribs. The Caribs were an Arawakan-speaking people who arrived about 10,000 years before the current era. A few years after the arrival of European explorers, Spanish conquistadors significantly reduced the number of local inhabitants. According to the writings of Bartolomé de las Casas (""Tratado de las Indias""), between 1492 and 1498 the Spanish conquerors killed about 100,000 Taíno."
ref: The Dominican Republic (Spanish: República Dominicana) is a Caribbean country that occupies the eastern half of the island of Hispaniola, which it shares with Haiti Besides white sand beaches and mountain landscapes, the country is home to the oldest European city in the Americas, now part of Santo Domingo. The island was first inhabited by the Taínos and Caribes. The Caribes were an Arawakan-speaking people who had arrived around 10,000 BCE. Within a few short years following the arrival of European explorers, the population of Tainos had significantly been reduced by the Spanish conquerors Based on Fray Bartolomé de las Casas (Tratado de las Indias) between 1492 and 1498 the Spanish conquerors killed around 100,000 Taínos.

src: "Kalnu nobraucienu sporti, kas ietver slēpošanu un snovbordu, ir populāri sporta veidi, kuri nozīmē slīdēšanu uz leju pa sniega pārklātu teritoriju ar slēpēm vai sniega dēli, kas piestiprināts pie pēdām. Daudziem entuziastiem (angliski palaikam tiek saukti par ""ski bums"") slēpošana ir ceļošanas pamatnodarbe, un viņi visus savus atvaļinājumus plāno saistībā ar slēpošanu kādā noteiktā vietā. Slēpošanas ideja ir ļoti sena - alu gleznas, kas attēlo slēpotājus, ir datētas jau ar 5000. gadu pirms mūsu ēras! Kalnu slēpošana kā sports aizsākās vismaz 17. gadsimtā, un 1861. gadā Austrālijā norvēģi atvēra pirmo atpūtnieku slēpošanas klubu."
mt: "Alpine skiing, which includes downhill skiing and snowboarding, is a popular sport which means sliding down a snow-covered slope on skis or a snowboard attached to the feet. Many enthusiasts (often called "ski bums") make skiing their primary vacation activity, and plan all their vacations around skiing in a particular place. The idea of skiing is very old - paintings depicting skiers are dated as far back as 5000 years before our era! Alpine skiing as a sport began at least in the 17th century, and in 1861 Norway opened the first ski club for tourists."
ref: "Downhill snowsports, which include skiing and snowboarding, are popular sports involving sliding down snow-covered terrain with skis or a snowboard attached to your feet. Skiing is a major travelling activity with many enthusiasts, occasionally known as ""ski bums,"" planning entire vacations around skiing at a particular location. The idea of skiing is very old — cave paintings depicting skiers date back as far as 5000 BC! Downhill skiing as a sport goes back to at least the 17th century, and in 1861 the first recreational ski club was opened by Norwegians in Australia."

src: Austrumāfrikas salas atrodas Indijas okeānā pie Āfrikas austrumu krasta. Madagaskara neapšaubāmi ir vislielākā, un, runājot par uz savvaļas dzīvniekiem, tā ir kā atsevišķs kontinents. Vairākums mazāko salu ir neatkarīgas valstis vai ir saistītas ar Franciju, kā arī pazīstamas kā luksusa klases pludmales kūrorti. Arābi zemēs arī ieviesa islāmu - Komoru salās un Majotā tas notika plašā mērogā. Eiropiešu ietekme un kolonizācija sakās 15. gadsimtā, kad portugāļu pētnieks Vasko de Gama atklāja maršrutu no Eiropas uz Indiju gar Labās Cerības ragu.
mt: The islands of East Africa are in the Indian Ocean off the east coast of Africa. Madagascar is indisputably the largest, and, speaking of wild animals, it is like a separate continent. Most of the smaller islands are independent states or are associated with France, and are also known as luxury class beach resorts. Islam was also introduced in the Arab countries - in the Comoros and Mayotte it happened on a large scale. European influence and colonization occurred in the 15th century, when Portuguese explorer Vasco da Gama discovered a route from Europe to India via the Cape of Good Hope.
ref: The East African Islands are in the Indian Ocean off the eastern coast of Africa. Madagascar is by far the biggest, and a continent on its own when it comes to wildlife. Most of the smaller islands are independent nations, or associated with France, and known as luxury beach resorts. The Arabs also brought Islam to the lands, and it took in a big way in the Comoros and Mayotte. European influence and colonialism began in the 15th century, as Portuguese explorer Vasco da Gama found the Cape Route from Europe to India.

src: Ir tradīcija aizvadīt Lieldienu nakti nomodā kādā atklātā vietā, lai redzētu saullēktu. Šai tradīcijai, protams, ir kristīgi teoloģiski izskaidrojumi, taču tas var būt arī pirmskristietības pavasara un auglības rituāls. Tradicionālākas baznīcas bieži vien notur Lieldienu vigīliju Lieldienu brīvdienu svētdienas naktī, kad sapulcēšanās, nozvanot pusnaktij, nereti pārvēršas svinībās, lai godinātu Kristus augšāmcelšanos.
mt: It is a tradition to spend Easter night in some open place to see the sunset. This tradition, of course, has Christian theological explanations, but it can be a pre-Christian spring and fertility ritual. Traditional churches often hold Easter vigils on Easter Sunday night, when gatherings, turning off the half-night, often turn into celebrations to honor the resurrection of Christ.
ref: There's a tradition to pass the Easter night awake at some exposed point to see the sunrise. There are of course Christian theological explanations for this tradition, but it may well be a pre-Christian Spring and Fertility ritual. More traditional churches often hold an Easter Vigil on Saturday night during the Easter weekend, with the congregations often breaking into celebration at the stroke of midnight to celebrate Christ's resurrection.

src: Ekvadora prasa, lai pirms iebraukšanas Ekvadorā, izmantojot starptautiskās lidostas vai robežšķērsošanas punktus, Kubas pilsoņi būtu saņēmuši uzaicinājuma vēstuli. Šī vēstule ir jāatzīst par likumīgu Ekvadoras Ārlietu ministrijai, un tai jāatbilst noteiktām prasībām. Šīs prasības ir paredzētas, lai nodrošinātu organizētu migrācijas plūsmu starp abām valstīm. Kubas pilsoņiem, kuriem ir izsniegta ASV zaļā karte, būtu jāierodas Ekvadoras konsulātā, lai saņemtu atbrīvojumu no šīs prasības. Jūsu pasei ir jābūt derīgai vismaz sešus mēnešus pēc ceļojuma beigām. Lai pierādītu jūsu uzturēšanās ilgumu, ir nepieciešama biļete atpakaļceļam vai turpmākajam braucienam.
mt: Equador requests that before entering Equador, using international airports or border crossing points, Cuban citizens must have received an invitation letter. This letter must be approved by the Equador Foreign Affairs Ministry, and must comply with certain requirements. These requirements are intended to ensure organized migration between the two countries. Cuban citizens who have a green card from the US must go to the Equador consulate to receive exemption from this requirement. Your passport must be valid for at least six months after the trip. To prove your stay, a ticket back or a future trip is required.
ref: Ecuador requires that Cuban citizens receive an invitation letter prior to entering Ecuador through international airports or frontier admission points. This letter must be legalized by the Ecuadorian Ministry of Foreign Affairs, and comply with certain requirements. These requirements are designed to provide an organized migratory flow between both countries. Cuban citizens who are US green card holders should visit an Ecuadorian Consulate to obtain an exemption to this requirement. Your passport must be valid for at least 6 months beyond your travel dates. A round/onward trip ticket is needed to prove the length of your stay.

src: Ekvadora prasa, lai pirms iebraukšanas Ekvadorā, izmantojot starptautiskās lidostas vai robežšķērsošanas punktus, Kubas pilsoņi būtu saņēmuši uzaicinājuma vēstuli. Šī vēstule ir jāatzīst par likumīgu Ekvadoras Ārlietu ministrijai, un tai jāatbilst noteiktām prasībām. Šīs prasības ir paredzētas, lai nodrošinātu organizētu migrācijas plūsmu starp abām valstīm. Kubas pilsoņiem, kuriem ir izsniegta ASV zaļā karte, būtu jāierodas Ekvadoras konsulātā, lai saņemtu atbrīvojumu no šīs prasības. Jūsu pasei ir jābūt derīgai vismaz sešus mēnešus pēc ceļojuma beigām. Lai pierādītu jūsu uzturēšanās ilgumu, ir nepieciešama biļete atpakaļceļam vai turpmākajam braucienam.
mt: Equador requests that before entering Equador, using international airports or border crossing points, Cuban citizens must have received an invitation letter. This letter must be approved by the Equador Foreign Affairs Ministry, and must comply with certain requirements. These requirements are intended to ensure organized migration between the two countries. Cuban citizens who have a green card from the US must go to the Equador consulate to receive exemption from this requirement. Your passport must be valid for at least six months after the trip. To prove your stay, a ticket back or a future trip is required.
ref: Ecuador requires that Cuban citizens receive an invitation letter prior to entering Ecuador through international airports or frontier admission points. This letter must be legalized by the Ecuadorian Ministry of Foreign Affairs, and comply with certain requirements. These requirements are designed to provide an organized migratory flow between both countries. Cuban citizens who are US green card holders should visit an Ecuadorian Consulate to obtain an exemption to this requirement. Your passport must be valid for at least 6 months beyond your travel dates. A round/onward trip ticket is needed to prove the length of your stay.

src: Ārvalstīs brilles var izmaksāt lētāk, jo īpaši valstīs ar zemu ienākumu, kur ir zemākas darbaspēka izmaksas. Apsveriet iespēju pārbaudīt redzi savā dzīvesvietas valstī, jo īpaši, ja to sedz apdrošināšanas polise, un pēc tam iesniegt recepti jebkurā citā vietā. Ekskluzīvi zīmolu rāmji, kas pieejami šādos rajonos, var būt saistīti ar divām problēmām: daži var būt viltojums, un īstie ievestie rāmji var būt dārgāki nekā mājās.
mt: Glasses can be cheaper abroad, especially in countries with low income, where labor costs are lower. Consider having your eyes checked in your home country, especially if it is covered by insurance, and then submitting the prescription anywhere. Exclusive brand frames available in these regions may be counterfeit, and genuine imported frames may be more expensive than at home.
ref: Eyeglasses can be cheaper in a foreign country, especially in low-income countries where labour costs are lower. Consider getting an eye exam at home, especially if insurance covers it, and bringing the prescription along to be filed elsewhere. High-end brand-name frames available in such areas may have two problems; some may be knock-offs, and the real imported ones may be more expensive than at home.

src: Oficiālā Folklendas valūta ir Folklendas mārciņa (FKP), kuras vērtība ir noteikta līdzvērtīgi vienas Lielbritānijas mārciņas (GBP) vērtībai. Naudu var apmainīt vienīgajā salās esošajā bankā, kas atrodas Stenlejā pretī veikalam „FIC West Store”. Parasti salās jebkurā vietā pieņem Lielbritānijas mārciņu, savukārt Stenlijā bieži vien pieņem arī kredītkartes un ASV dolārus. Tālākajās salās kredītkartes, iespējams, netiks pieņemtas, lai gan var tikt pieņemta Lielbritānijas un ASV valūta; pajautājiet īpašniekiem jau iepriekš, lai noskaidrotu pieņemamo maksāšanas veidu. Ir gandrīz neiespējami samanīt Folklendu salu valūtu ārpus salu teritorijas, tāpēc samainiet naudu pirms došanās projām.
mt: The official currency of the Falkland Islands is the Falkland pound (FKP), whose value is fixed to be equivalent to one British pound (GBP). Money can be exchanged on the only island bank, which is located in Stanley opposite the FIC West Store. In the Falklands, British pounds are usually accepted anywhere, and in Stanley credit cards and US dollars are often accepted. In the outlying islands, credit cards may not be accepted, but British and US currency may be; ask the owners beforehand to determine the accepted form of payment. It is almost impossible to find Falkland Islands currency outside the islands, so exchange your money before going on your trip.
ref: The official Falklands currency is the Falkland pound (FKP) whose value is set equivalent to that of one British pound (GBP). Money can be exchanged at the only bank in the islands which is located in Stanley across from the FIC West store. British pounds will generally be accepted anywhere in the islands and within Stanley credit cards and United States dollars are also often accepted. On the outlying islands credit cards will probably not be accepted, although British and United States currency may be taken; check with the owners in advance to determine what is an acceptable payment method. It is nearly impossible to exchange Falklands currency outside of the islands, so exchange money prior to leaving the islands.

src: Vairākumā tempļu notiek ikgadējais festivāls: laikposmā no novembra beigām līdz maija vidum, atkarībā no katra tempļa gada kalendāra. Lielāka daļa tempļa festivālu tiek svinēti kā daļa no tempļa dzimšanas dienas vai vadošās dievības dzimšanas dienas, vai arī kāda cita liela pasākuma, kas ir saistīts ar templi. Redzēt Keralas tempļu festivālus ir ļoti interesanti; tajos regulāri notiek izrotātu ziloņu gājieni, spēlē tempļa orķestris un norisinās citas svinības.
mt: In many temples, a festival is held annually: from the end of November to the middle of May, depending on the temple's calendar year. Most temple festivals are celebrated as part of the temple's birthday or the main deity's birthday, or some other major event associated with the temple. Seeing the Kerala temple festivals is very interesting; they regularly have decorated elephant processions, temple orchestras play, and other celebrations take place.
ref: Most of the temples do have an Annual festival starting from November end to Mid of May, which varies according to each temple's annual calendar. Most of the temple festivals is celebrated as part of temple's anniversary or presiding deity's birthday or any other major event associated with the temple. Kerala's temple festivals are very interesting to see, with regular procession of decorated elephants, temple orchestra and other festivities.

src: Nepārprotams veids, kā lidot pirmajā klasē vai biznesa klasē, ir samaksāt biezu naudas žūksni par šo privilēģiju (vai, vēl labāk, panākt, lai jūsu uzņēmums to maksā jūsu vietā). Tomēr tas nav lēti: par biznesa klasi parasti jāmaksā četras reizes vairāk nekā par parasto ekonomiskās klases biļeti, bet pirmajā klasē pat vienpadsmit reizes vairāk! Būtībā nav nozīmes pat meklēt atlaides biznesa vai pirmās klases sēdvietām tiešajos lidojumos no A uz B. Aviolīnijas ļoti labi zina, ka ir noteikta augstākas klases aviopasažieru grupa, kuri vēlas piemaksāt par iespēju nokļūt galamērķī ātrāk un lidot ar komfortu, tādēļ tās prasa attiecīgu cenu.
mt: 1. The cost of flying first or business class is a hefty wad of cash for the privilege (or, better yet, getting your company to pay for it). But it's not cheap: you'll typically pay four times as much for a business-class seat as you would for an economy-class seat, and up to 11 times as much for a first-class seat! It's not worth looking for discounts on business or first-class seats on direct flights from A to B. Airlines know there's a high-end passenger group willing to pay for the privilege of getting to their destination faster and flying in comfort, so they charge accordingly.
ref: The obvious way of flying in first or business class is to fork out a thick wad of money for the privilege (or, better yet, get your company to do it for you). However, this does not come cheap: as rough rules of thumb, you can expect to pay up to four times the normal economy fare for business, and eleven times for first class! Generally speaking, there is no point in even looking for discounts for business or first-class seats on direct flights from A to B. Airlines know well that there is a certain core group of flyers who are willing to pay top dollar for the privilege of getting somewhere fast and in comfort, and charge accordingly.

src: "Vairākas aviokompānijas, piemēram, ""Emirates"", ""Etihad Airways"", ""Qatar Airways"" un ""Turkish Airlines"" ir ievērojami paplašinājušas savus maršrutus uz Āfriku un piedāvā reisus uz daudzām lielākajām Āfrikas pilsētām par daudz izdevīgākām cenām nekā citas Eiropas valstu aviolīnijas. No 2014. gada lidsabiedrība ""Turkish Airlines"" lido uz 39 galamērķiem 30 Āfrikas valstīs. Ja jums ir papildu laiks ceļošanai, salīdziniet savu kopējās cenas piedāvājumu uz Āfriku ar cenu par ceļojumu apkārt pasaulei. Neaizmirstiet pierēķināt papildu izmaksas par papildu vīzām, izlidošanas nodokļiem, sauszemes transportu u.c. visās vietās ārpus Āfrikas."
mt: "Several airlines, such as Emirates, Etihad Airways, Qatar Airways and Turkish Airlines have significantly expanded their routes to Africa and offer flights to many major African cities at much cheaper prices than other European airlines. From 2014, Turkish Airlines flies to 39 destinations in 30 African countries. If you have extra time to travel, compare your total cost to Africa with the cost of traveling around the world. Do not forget to calculate additional costs for additional visas, departure taxes, land transport, etc. in all places outside Africa."
ref: Airlines such as Emirates, Etihad Airways, Qatar Airways & Turkish Airlines have greatly expanded their services to Africa, and offer connections to many major African cities at competitive rates than other European airlines. Turkish Airlines flies to 39 destinations in 30 African countries as of 2014. If you have additional travel time, check to see how your total fare quote to Africa compares with a round-the-world fare. Don't forget to add in the extra costs of additional visas, departure taxes, ground transportation, etc. for all those places outside of Africa.

src: Produktu iegāde lielveikalos parasti ir lētākais veids, kā paēst. Taču bez gatavošanas iespējām izvēle aprobežojas ar gatavo ēdienu. Aizvien vairāk lielveikalu piedāvā plašāku nodaļu ar gatavo pārtiku. Dažos pat ir mikroviļņu krāsns vai cita iespēja ēdienu uzsildīšanai. Dažās valstīs vai veikalu veidos ir vismaz viens restorāns, kas bieži ir neformāls un piedāvā pieejamas cenas.
mt: Buying food in supermarkets is usually the cheapest way to eat. However, without preparation options, the choice is limited to ready-made food. More and more supermarkets offer a wider range of ready-to-eat food. In some places there is a microwave oven or other way to heat food. In some countries or store types there is at least one restaurant, which is often informal and offers affordable prices.
ref: Buying food in supermarkets is usually the cheapest way to get fed. Without cooking opportunities, choices are however limited to ready-made food. Increasingly supermarkets are getting a more varied section of ready-made food. Some even provide a microwave oven or other means to heat food. In some countries or types of stores there is at least one on-site restaurant, often a rather informal one with affordable prices.

src: Beļģijā un Šveicē runātie franču valodas paveidi nedaudz atšķiras no franču valodas, kādā runā Francijā, lai gan tās ir pietiekami līdzīgas, lai būtu savstarpēji saprotamas. Jo īpaši ciparu sistēmai Beļģijas franciski runājošajā daļā un Šveicē ir nelielas īpatnības, kas atšķiras no franču valodas, kas tiek izmantota Francijā, kā arī ir nedaudz citāda dažu vārdu izruna. Tomēr visi franciski runājošie beļģi un šveicieši skolā ir mācījušies standarta franču valodu, tāpēc viņi spēs jūs saprast arī tad, ja izmantosiet standarta franču numerācijas sistēmu.
mt: Belgian and Swiss French are slightly different from French as spoken in France, but they are close enough to be mutually intelligible. Especially in the Belgian French-speaking part and in Switzerland, there are some minor differences from French as used in France, and some words are pronounced differently. However, all French-speaking Belgians and Swiss have learned standard French in school, so they will be able to understand you if you use the standard French number system.
ref: The varieties of French which are spoken in Belgium and Switzerland differ slightly from the French spoken in France, though they are similar enough to be mutually intelligible. In particular, the numbering system in French-speaking Belgium and Switzerland has some slight peculiarities that are different from the French spoken in France, and the pronunciation of some words is slightly different. Nevertheless, all French-speaking Belgians and Swiss would have learned standard French in school, so they would be able to understand you even if you used the standard French numbering system.

src: "Vēl tikai dažas aviolīnijas joprojām piedāvā īpašu braukšanas maksu smaga zaudējuma gadījumā, kas nozīmē nelielu atlaidi pēdējā brīža maksai par lidojumu uz bērēm. Šo pakalpojumu piedāvā tādas aviokompānijas kā ""Air Canada"", ""Delta Air Lines"" un ""Lufthansa"" lidojumiem no ASV vai Kanādas, kā arī aviokompānija ""WestJet"". Visos gadījumos rezervācija ir jāveic pa tālruni, zvanot tieši aviolīnijai."
mt: "Only a few airlines still offer a special fare for a last-minute cancellation, which means a small discount on the last-minute fare for a flight to a funeral. This service is offered by airlines such as "Air Canada", "Delta Air Lines" and "Lufthansa" for flights from the United States or Canada, as well as the airline "WestJet". In all cases, the reservation must be made by phone, calling directly to the airline."
ref: Only a few airlines still offer bereavement fares, which slightly discount the cost of last-minute funeral travel. Airlines that offer these include Air Canada, Delta Air Lines, Lufthansa for flights originating from the U.S. or Canada, and WestJet. In all cases, you must book by phone directly with the airline.

src: GPS navigācijas lietotņu izmantošana viedtālrunī var būt vienkāršākais un ērtākais veids, kā orientēties, atrodoties ārpus savas dzimtenes. Tas var ietaupīt naudu, iegādājoties kartes GPS vai atsevišķai GPS ierīcei vai izīrējot to no autoīres uzņēmuma. Ja jūsu tālrunim nav datu savienojuma vai ja tas neatrodas uztveršanas zonā, tālruņa veiktspēja var būt ierobežota vai tas var nebūt pieejams.
mt: Using GPS navigation apps on your phone is the easiest and most convenient way to orient yourself when you're out of your home country. It can save you money by not buying a GPS map or a separate GPS device or renting it from an auto rental company. If your phone doesn't have data connectivity or if it's out of range, your phone's functionality may be limited or unavailable.
ref: Using GPS navigation apps on your smartphone can be the easiest and most convenient way to navigate when out of your home country. It can save money over buying new maps for a GPS, or a standalone GPS device or renting one from a car rental company. If you don't have a data connection for your phone, or when it is out of range, their performance can be limited or unavailable.

src: GPS navigācijas lietotņu izmantošana viedtālrunī var būt vienkāršākais un ērtākais veids, kā orientēties, atrodoties ārpus savas dzimtenes. Tas var ietaupīt naudu, iegādājoties kartes GPS vai atsevišķai GPS ierīcei vai izīrējot to no autoīres uzņēmuma. Ja jūsu tālrunim nav datu savienojuma vai ja tas neatrodas uztveršanas zonā, tālruņa veiktspēja var būt ierobežota vai tas var nebūt pieejams.
mt: Using GPS navigation apps on your phone is the easiest and most convenient way to orient yourself when you're out of your home country. It can save you money by not buying a GPS map or a separate GPS device or renting it from an auto rental company. If your phone doesn't have data connectivity or if it's out of range, your phone's functionality may be limited or unavailable.
ref: Using GPS navigation apps on your smartphone can be the easiest and most convenient way to navigate when out of your home country. It can save money over buying new maps for a GPS, or a standalone GPS device or renting one from a car rental company. If you don't have a data connection for your phone, or when it is out of range, their performance can be limited or unavailable.

src: Galapagu salu teritorijas un savvaļas dzīvnieku apskati vislabāk veikt ar laivu — tieši tāpat, kā to 1835. gadā darīja Čārlzs Darvins. Galapagu salu ūdeņos regulāri ierodas vairāk nekā 60 kruīza kuģi, kuru lielums ir no 8 līdz 100 pasažieriem. Lielākā daļa cilvēku rezervē savu vietu ļoti laicīgi (jo laivas labākajā gadalaikā parasti ir pilnas). Pārliecinieties, ka aģents, pie kura rezervējat braucienu, labi pārzina Galapagu salas un dažāda veida kuģīšus. Tas nodrošinās, ka jūsu īpašās intereses un/vai ierobežojumi tiek saskaņoti ar tām vispiemērotāko kuģi.
mt: The best way to visit the Galapagos Islands and its wildlife is by boat, just as Charles Darwin did in 1835. There are more than 60 cruise ships that visit the Galapagos Islands waters, ranging from 8 to 100 passengers. Most people book their trip very early (as the best boats are usually fully booked). Make sure that the agent you book with is well versed in the Galapagos Islands and different types of boats. This will ensure that your specific interests and/or restrictions are matched with the most suitable boat.
ref: Seeing the sites and wildlife of the Galapagos is best done by boat, just as Charles Darwin did it in 1835. Over 60 cruise ships ply the Galapagos waters - ranging in size from 8 to 100 passengers. Most people book their place well in advance (as the boats are usually full during the high season). Be sure the agent through whom you book is a Galapagos specialist with a good knowledge of a wide variety of ships. This will ensure that your particular interests and/or constraints are matched with the ship most suitable to them.

src: Kazino parasti dara visu iespējamo, lai pēc iespējas ilgāk noturētu savus apmeklētājus un lai viņi tērētu vairāk naudas. Parasti kazino telpās nav logu un pulksteņu, kā arī dažkārt ir grūti atrast izeju. Viņiem parasti ir īpaši ēdieni, dzērieni un izklaides piedāvājumi, lai uzturētu viesus labā noskaņojumā un noturētu telpās. Dažviet uz iestādes rēķina tiek piedāvāti alkoholiskie dzērieni. Taču alkohola lietošana vājina spriedumu izdarīšanu, un ikviens labs spēlmanis zina, cik svarīgi ir saglabāt skaidru prātu.
mt: Casinos usually do everything they can to keep their customers as long as possible and to get them to spend as much money as possible. Usually there are no windows or clocks in the casino, and sometimes it is difficult to find the exit. They usually have special food, drinks and entertainment offerings to keep customers in a good mood and to keep them in the casino. Sometimes alcohol is offered on the house. However, alcohol impairs judgment, and any good gambler knows how important it is to keep a clear head.
ref: Casinos typically make many efforts to maximize time and money spent by guests. Windows and clocks are usually absent, and exits can be hard to find. They usually have special food, drink and entertainment offers, to keep guests in a good mood, and keep them at the premise. Some venues offer alcoholic beverages on the house. However, drunkenness impairs judgement, and all good gamblers know the importance of staying sober.

src: "Visi lietvārdi, kā arī vārds Sie, kas nozīmē ""Jūs"", vienmēr rakstāmi ar lielo sākuma burtu, pat teikuma vidū. Tas ir svarīgs veids, kā atšķirt dažus darbības vārdus un objektus. Tas arī atvieglo lasīšanu, lai gan rakstīšanu apgrūtina vajadzība noskaidrot, vai izmantotais darbības vārds vai īpašības vārds tiek izmantots substantīva formā."
mt: "All pronouns, including the pronoun Sie, meaning "You," are always capitalized, even in the middle of a sentence. This is an important way to distinguish some action verbs and objects. It also makes reading easier, although it complicates writing, since you have to decide whether to use an action verb or a possessive pronoun in the substantive form."
ref: All nouns, alongside the word Sie for you, always begin with a capital letter, even in the middle of a sentence. This is an important way to distinguish between some verbs and objects. It also arguably makes reading easier, though writing is somewhat complicated by the need to find out whether a verb or adjective is used in a substantivized form.

Tas arī atvieglo lasīšanu, lai gan rakstīšanu apgrūtina vajadzība noskaidrot, vai izmantotais darbības vārds vai īpašības vārds tiek izmantots substantīva formā."
mt: "All pronouns, including the pronoun Sie, meaning "You," are always capitalized, even in the middle of a sentence. This is an important way to distinguish some action verbs and objects. It also makes reading easier, although it complicates writing, since you have to decide whether to use an action verb or a possessive pronoun in the substantive form."
ref: All nouns, alongside the word Sie for you, always begin with a capital letter, even in the middle of a sentence. This is an important way to distinguish between some verbs and objects. It also arguably makes reading easier, though writing is somewhat complicated by the need to find out whether a verb or adjective is used in a substantivized form.

src: "Daudzās pasaules valstīs māšana ir draudzīgs žests, kas nozīmē ""sveicienu."" Tomēr Malaizijā, vismaz lauku apvidos dzīvojošu malaju vidū tas nozīmē ""nāc šurp"", kas ir līdzīgs žestam, kad rādītājpirksts ir saliekts ķermeņa virzienā; šo žestu izmanto noteiktās rietumu valstīs, un tas ir jāizvēlas tikai šādam nolūkam. Tāpat britu ceļotāji Spānijā var atvadu mājienu, kur plauksta ir pavērsta pret mājēju (nevis personu, kurai māj), sajaukt ar žestu, kas aicina atgriezties."
mt: In many countries, a wave is a friendly gesture meaning "hello." However, in rural Malaysia, it means "come here," which is similar to the gesture of pointing a finger at someone (not a person to whom you are greeting), used in some Western countries, and is to be used only for this purpose. Similarly, British travelers in Spain may wave goodbye to a house, where the flag is facing away from the house (not the person to whom you are greeting), confused with the gesture that invites you to return.
ref: "In many parts of the world, waving is a friendly gesture, indicating ""hello."" However, in Malaysia, at least among the Malays in rural areas, it means ""come over,"" similar to the index finger bent toward the body, a gesture which is used in certain Western countries, and should be used only for that purpose. Similarly, a British traveller in Spain may mistake a wave goodbye involving the palm facing the waver (rather than the person being waved at) as a gesture to come back."

src: "Šļūdoņi nav stabili, bet plūst lejup no kalna. Tas radīs nelielas vai dziļas plaisas, kuras var aizsegt ""sniega tilti"". Ledus alu sienas un jumti var sabrukt, un plaisas var aizvērties. Ledāju malās atlūst milzīgi ledus gabali, kuri krīt lejā un, iespējams, atsitas vai aizripo tālāk no malas."
mt: "The avalanches are not stable, but they are sliding down the mountain. This will create small or deep crevasses that can be bridged by "snow bridges". The ice walls and roofs of the ice caves can collapse, and the crevasses can close. The ice cliffs on the icebergs are shedding huge ice blocks that fall down and, possibly, bounce or roll further away from the shore."
ref: The glaciers are not stable, but flow down the mountain. This will cause cracks, crevasses, which may be obscured by snow bridges. The walls and roofs of ice caves can collapse and cracks can get closed. At the edge of glaciers huge blocks break loose, fall down and perhaps jump or roll farther from the edge.

src: Goma ir tūristu iecienīta Kongo Demokrātiskās Republikas pilsēta, kas atrodas pie pašas austrumu robežas ar Ruandu. 2002. gadā Gomu iznīcināja lava no Njiragongo vulkāna, kas apraka vairumu pilsētas ielu, jo īpaši tās centrā. Lai gan Goma ir pietiekami droša, būtu jāpārskata visi apmeklējumi ārpus Gomas, lai izprastu esošo kauju stāvokli Ziemeļkivu provincē. Pilsēta ir arī starta vieta, lai uzkāptu Niragongo vulkānā gar dažām lētākajām kalnu gorillas izsekošanas vietām Āfrikā. Lai pārvietotos pa Gomu, varat izmantot „boda-boda” (motociklu taksometrs). Parastā (vietējā) cena par īsu braucienu ir aptuveni 500 Kongo franki.
mt: Goma is a tourist-friendly city in the Democratic Republic of the Congo, located near the eastern border with Rwanda. In 2002, Goma was devastated by lava from the nearby Nyiragongo volcano, which destroyed much of the city's streets, especially in its center. Although Goma is relatively safe, all visits outside Goma should be carefully considered in light of the ongoing conflict in North Kivu province. The city is also a starting point for climbing Nyiragongo volcano and visiting some of the cheapest gorilla trekking sites in Africa. To get around Goma, you can use a "boda-boda" (motorcycle taxi). The usual (local) price for a short ride is about 500 Congolese francs.
ref: Goma is a tourist city of the Democratic Republic of Congo in the extreme east near Rwanda. In 2002 Goma was destroyed by lava from the Nyiragongo volcano which buried most of the town’s streets, particularly the town centre. While Goma is reasonably safe, any visits outside of Goma should be researched to understand the state of the fighting that persists in the North Kivu province. The city is also the base to climb the Nyiragongo volcano along with some of the cheapest Mountain Gorilla tracking in Africa. You can use boda-boda (motorcycle taxi) to get around Goma. The normal (local) price is ~500 Congolese Francs for the short ride.

src: "Lai nakšņotu teltīs Lielā kanjona pakājē, ir nepieciešama atļauja nakšņošanai savvaļā. Kanjona aizsardzības nolūkos atļauju skaits ir ierobežots; tās ir pieejamas no mēneša 1. datuma, un to izmantošanu var sākt pēc četriem mēnešiem. Tādējādi 1. janvārī kļūst pieejamas atļaujas neapdzīvotām zonām jebkuram sākuma datumam maijā. Jau pirmajā dienā, kad ir iespējams veikt rezervācijas, ar saņemtajiem pieprasījumiem parasti tiek aizpildītas apmešanās vietas populārākajās teritorijās, kā piemēram, kempingā ""Bright Angel"", kas atrodas blakus viesnīcai ""Phantom Ranch"". Ir rezervēts ierobežots atļauju skaits, kas pieejamas pēc principa - kas pirmais atnāca, pirmais rezervēja."
mt: To camp on the rim of the Grand Canyon, you need a backcountry permit. The number of permits is limited, and they are available on a first-come, first-served basis. Permits for the most popular areas, such as Bright Angel Campground, near Phantom Ranch, are usually reserved on the first day they are available. Permits are available for any start date in May.
ref: Any camping below the rim in Grand Canyon requires a backcountry permit. Permits are limited to protect the canyon, and become available on the 1st day of the month, four months prior to the start month. Thus, a backcountry permit for any start date in May becomes available on 1 Jan. Space for the most popular areas, such as the Bright Angel Campground adjacent to Phantom Ranch, generally fill up by the requests received on first date they are opened to reservations. There are a limited number permits reserved for walk-in requests available on a first come, first served basis.

src: Dažās viesnīcās ir saglabājies mantojums no tvaika lokomotīvju un okeāna laineru zelta laikmeta — laika pirms Otrā Pasaules kara, 19. gs. vai 20. gs. sākuma. Šīs viesnīcas bija vietas, kur apmetās tā laika bagātie un slavenie, un tajās bieži bija lieliskas maltītes un naktsdzīve. Vecmodīgi piederumi, jaunāko ērtību trūkums un zināma gracioza novecošanās arī ir to raksturojuma sastāvdaļa. Neskatoties uz to, ka tās mēdz būt privātīpašums, dažkārt tajās tiek izmitināti valstu vadītāji un citas augstas amatpersonas, kas ieradušās vizītē. Ceļotājs, kuram ir daudz naudas, varētu apsvērt iespēju veikt lidojumu apkārt pasaulei ar nakšņošanu daudzās no šīm viesnīcām.
mt: In some hotels, there is a legacy from the steam locomotive and ocean liner golden age — the time before World War II, the late 19th century or the early 20th century. These hotels were places where the wealthy and famous of that time stayed, and they often had excellent dining and nightlife. The old-fashioned items, the lack of modern conveniences, and the well-known grace of decay are also part of its character. Despite the fact that they are often private property, sometimes they are used by state leaders and other high-ranking officials who have come on a visit. A traveler who has a lot of money could consider the possibility of making a trip around the world with overnight stays in many of these hotels.
ref: Some hotels have a heritage from the golden age of steam railways and ocean liners; before the Second World War, in the 19th or early 20th centuries. These hotels were where the rich and the famous of the day would stay, and often had fine dining and nightlife. The old fashioned fittings, the lack of the latest amenities, and a certain graceful agedness are also part of their character. While they are usually privately owned, they sometimes accommodate visiting heads of state and other dignitaries. A traveller with piles of money might consider a round the world flight, broken up with stays in many of these hotels.

src: "Pateicoties zemūdens optisko kabeļu savienojumiem ar Eiropu un platjoslas satelītam, Grenlandē labi sakari ir ar 93% iedzīvotāju, kuriem ir piekļuve internetam. Jūsu viesnīcā vai naktsmītnes saimniekam (ja apmetaties viesu mājā vai privātās mājās), visdrīzāk, būs pieejams WiFi vai dators ar interneta savienojumu, un visās apdzīvotajās vietās ir interneta kafejnīca vai kāda vieta ar publiski pieejamu WiFi. Kā minēts iepriekš, lai arī vārds ""eskimoss"" Amerikas Savienotajās Valstīs joprojām tiek atzīts par pieņemamu, daudzi Arktikas reģiona, jo īpaši Kanādas iedzīvotāji, kas nav ASV valstspiederīgie, uzskata to par nievājošu. Lai arī, iespējams, dzirdēsiet, ka šo vārdu lieto Grenlandes vietējie iedzīvotāji, ārzemniekiem ieteicams to neizmantot. Grenlandes vietējie iedzīvotāji Kanādā sevi dēvē par inuītiem un Grenlandē - par ""Kalaalleq"" (daudzskaitlī Kalaallit) jeb grenlandieti. Noziedzība un naidīgums pret ārzemniekiem kopumā Grendlandē praktiski nepastāv. Pat pilsētās nav ""bīstamu rajonu."" Auksts laiks, iespējams, ir vienīgais reālais apdraudējums, ar ko sastapsies nesagatavoti ceļotāji. Ja apmeklējat Grenlandi aukstajā gadalaikā (ņemot vērā, ka tālāk uz ziemeļiem kļūst aizvien aukstāks), ir ļoti svarīgi paņemt līdzi pietiekami daudz silta apģērba. Ļoti garās vasaras dienas var novest pie problēmām ar pietiekamu izgulēšanos un ar to saistītām veselības problēmām. Vasarā uzmanieties arī no ziemeļos dzīvojošajiem moskītiem. Lai arī tie nepārnēsā slimības, tie var būt ļoti kaitinoši."
mt: Thanks to undersea optical cable connections to Europe and a geostationary satellite, Greenland has good connectivity with 93% of its population having access to the Internet. Your hotel or hostel (if you stay in a guest house or private home) will likely have WiFi or a computer with Internet access, and there are Internet cafes or places with public WiFi in all inhabited areas. As mentioned earlier, while the word "eskimo" is still considered acceptable in the United States, many people in the Arctic region, especially in Canada, which is not a U.S. territory, consider it offensive. While you may hear this word used by Greenlandic locals, foreigners are advised not to use it. Greenlandic locals in Canada call themselves Inuit and in Greenland "Kalaalleq" (plural Kalaallit) or Greenlandic. Crime and hostility against foreigners in general in Greenland is practically non-existent. Even in cities there are no "dangerous areas." Cold weather is the only real danger you may encounter as an unprepared traveler. If you visit Greenland in the winter (taking into account that the further north you go, the colder it gets), it is very important to bring enough warm clothing. Very long summer days can lead to problems with getting enough sleep and related health problems. In the summer, be careful of mosquitoes. While they do not carry disease, they can be very annoying.
ref: "Thanks to undersea fiber optic cable links to Europe and broadband satellite, Greenland is well connected with 93% of the population having internet access. Your hotel or hosts (if staying in a guesthouse or private home) will likely have wifi or an internet connected PC, and all settlements have an internet cafe or some location with public wifi. As mentioned above, though the word ""Eskimo"" remains acceptable in the United States, it is considered pejorative by many non-U.S. Arctic peoples, especially in Canada. While you may hear the word used by Greenlandic Natives, its use should be avoided by foreigners. The native inhabitants of Greenland call themselves Inuit in Canada and Kalaalleq (plural Kalaallit), a Greenlander, in Greenland. Crime, and ill-will toward foreigners in general, is virtually unknown in Greenland. Even in the towns, there are no ""rough areas."" Cold weather is perhaps the only real danger the unprepared will face. If you visit Greenland during cold seasons (considering that the further north you go, the colder it will be), it is essential to bring warm enough clothing. The very long days in the summer can lead to problems getting sufficient sleep and associated health issues. During the summer, also watch out for the Nordic mosquitoes. Although they do not transmit any diseases, they can be irritating."

src: „Jardín de la Unión”. Šī vieta tika veidota kā 17. gadsimta klostera ātrijs, kur vienīgā saglabājusies celtne ir Sandjego templis. Tas tagad darbojas kā centrālais laukums, kur vienmēr daudz kas notiek gan dienu, gan nakti. Dārzu ieskauj vairāki restorāni, pēcpusdienās un vakaros no centrālās lapenes bieži tiek sniegti bezmaksas koncerti. Callejon del Beso (Skūpstu aleja). Divi balkoni, starp kuriem ir tikai 69 centimetru liela atstarpe, ir vieta, kuru apvij sena mīlas leģenda. Apmaiņā pret dažiem penijiem daži bērni pastāstīs to stāstu.
mt: 17th century convent garden. The only surviving building is the San Diego church. It now serves as a central plaza where much is always happening day and night. The gardens are surrounded by several restaurants, and in the evenings and evenings, free concerts are often given from the central lawn. Callejon del Beso (Skūpstu alley). Two balconies, between which is only a 69-centimeter gap, is a place where an old love legend is surrounded. In exchange for a few pennies, some children will tell the story.
ref: Jardín de la Unión. This space was built as the atrium for a 17th-century convent, of which the Templo de San Diego is the sole surviving building. It now functions as the central plaza, and always has a lot of things going on, day and night. There are a number of restaurants surrounding the garden, and in the afternoons and evening there free concerts are often given from the central gazebo. Callejon del Beso (Alley of the Kiss). Two balconies separated by only 69 centimeters is home of an old love legend. For a few pennies some children will tell you the story.

src: Pārgājiens ir āra aktivitāte, kas ietver pastaigu dabiskā vidē, bieži pa pārgājienu takām. Dienas pārgājienos tiek veikti attālumi gan līdz vienai jūdzei, gan arī garākas distances, ko var paveikt vienā dienā. Dienas pārgājienam pa vieglas pakāpes taku tikpat kā nav nepieciešama sagatavošanās, un to var baudīt jebkura viduvēji fiziski sagatavota persona. Ģimenēm ar maziem bērniem var būt nepieciešama lielāka sagatavošanās, taču dienu brīvā dabā var viegli pavadīt pat ar zīdaiņiem vai pirmsskolas bērniem.
mt: A hike is an outdoor activity which consists of walking in natural environments, usually in hilly or mountainous terrain. Day hikes are usually short enough to be completed in a single day, while overnight hikes are longer and may involve an overnight stay in a wilderness shelter or campsite. Day hikes require little preparation, and can be enjoyed by almost anyone in reasonable physical condition. Families with small children can easily enjoy a day in the outdoors, and day hikes can be enjoyed by infants, toddlers, and preschoolers.
ref: Hiking is an outdoor activity which consists of walking in natural environments, often on hiking trails. Day hiking involves distances of less than a mile up to longer distances that can be covered in a single day. For a day hike along an easy trail little preparations are needed, and any moderately fit person can enjoy them. Families with small children may need more preparations, but a day outdoors is easily possible even with babies and pre-school children.

src: "Norvēģijai raksturīgi stāvi fjordi un ielejas, kur pēkšņi paverās augsts, vairāk vai mazāk vienmērīgs plato. Šos plato bieži sauc par ""vidde"", kas nozīmē plašu, atvērtu bezmeža telpu, bezgalīgu plašumu. Roglendā un Agderā tos parasti sauc par ""hei"", kas nozīmē tīreli bez kokiem, ko bieži klāj virši."
mt: "Norway is characterized by steep fjords and valleys, where suddenly appears a high, more or less level plateau. These plateaus are often called "vidde", which means a wide, open, unbounded space. In Rogaland and Agder they are often called "hei", which means a tundra without trees, which is often covered with heather."
ref: "Typical for Norway are steep fjords and valleys that suddenly give way to a high, more or less even plateau. These plateaus are often referred to as ""vidde"" meaning a wide, open treeless space, a boundless expanse. In Rogaland and Agder they are usually called ""hei"" meaning a treeless moorland often covered in heather."

src: Kalnu staciju tūrisma sezona Indijas vasarā parasti sasniedz maksimumu. Tomēr ziemā tiem piemīt citāds skaistums un pievilcība, kad daudzās kalnu stacijās ir daudz sniega un ir iespējamas tādas aktivitātes kā slēpošana un braukšana ar snovbordu.
mt: The hill station tourist season in India usually peaks in the summer. However, in the winter, they have a different beauty and charm, when many hill stations have a lot of snow and there are activities such as skiing and snowboarding.
ref: The tourist season for the hill stations generally peaks during the Indian summer. However, they have a different kind of beauty and charm during winter, with many hill stations receiving healthy amounts of snow and offering activities such as skiing and snowboarding.

src: Esiet droši, ka, tiklīdz sasniegsiet jahtu piestātni, viss taps diezgan skaidrs. Jūs satiksiet citus ceļotājus, kas izmanto jahtas kā ceļošanas transportlīdzekli, un viņi dalīsies ar informāciju. Būtībā jūs izliksiet sludinājumus ar piedāvājumu palīdzēt, staigāsiet pa piestātni, piedāvāsiet cilvēkiem iztīrīt viņu jahtas, mēģināsiet uzsākt sarunas ar burātājiem bārā u.c. Runājiet ar pēc iespējas vairāk cilvēkiem. Pēc neilga laika visi jūs pazīs un dos mājienu, kurai laivai kāds ir nepieciešams.
mt: Be safe, once you reach the yacht, everything will be pretty clear. You will meet other travelers who use yachts as a means of transportation, and they will share information with you. Basically you will post announcements offering to help, walk around the dock, offer people to clean their yachts, try to start conversations with sailors in the bar etc. Talk to as many people as possible. After a short time everyone will know you and give you a tour of the yacht that someone needs.
ref: Be assured that once you hit the marinas everything will be pretty obvious. You will meet other boat hitchhikers and they will share their information with you. Basically you'll be putting up notices offering your help, pacing the docks, approaching people cleaning their yachts, trying to make contact with sailors in the bar, etc. Try to talk to as many people as possible. After a while everyone will know you and will give you hints as to which boat is looking for someone.

src: Honkongas salas vārdā ir nosaukta Honkonga, un tā ir vieta, ko daudzi tūristi uzskata par galveno. Ēku kopaina, kas veido Honkongas panorāmu, ir pielīdzināta mirdzošai joslu diagrammai, ko skaidri parāda Viktorijas ostas ūdeņu klātbūtne. Lai redzētu vislabākos Honkongas skatus, dodieties prom no salas uz Kovlūnas pretējo krastu. Lielākā daļa Honkongas salas pilsētvides attīstības ir blīvi saspiesta uz reģenerētas zemes gar ziemeļu krastu. Šī ir vieta, kuru britu kolonizatori pārņēma kā savu, un tāpēc, ja jūs meklējat pierādījumus par teritorijas koloniālo pagātni, šī ir laba vieta, kur sākt.
mt: Hong Kong is named after Hong Kong Island, and it is a place that many tourists consider the main one. The building complex that forms the Hong Kong skyline is likened to a pulsating diagram, which clearly shows the presence of water in Victoria Harbour. To see the best views of Hong Kong, go out from the island to the opposite side of Kowloon. Most of the development of Hong Kong's urban area is densely packed on regenerated land along the northern coast. This is the place that the British colonizers took over as their own, and so, if you are looking for evidence of the colonial past, this is a good place to start.
ref: Hong Kong Island gives the territory of Hong Kong its name and is the place that many tourists regard as the main focus. The parade of buildings that make the Hong Kong skyline has been likened to a glittering bar chart that is made apparent by the presence of the waters of Victoria Harbour. To get the best views of Hong Kong, leave the island and head for the Kowloon waterfront opposite. The great majority of Hong Kong Island's urban development is densely packed on reclaimed land along the northern shore. This is the place the British colonisers took as their own and so if you are looking for evidence of the territory's colonial past, this is a good place to start.

src: Seglu kāpšļi ir balsti jātnieka kājām, kas karājas katrā seglu pusē. Tie nodrošina lielāku jātnieka stabilitāti, bet var radīt bažas par drošību, jo jātnieka kājas var tajos iestrēgt. Ja jātnieks tiek nomests no zirga, bet viņa kāja ieķeras sedlos, jātnieks var tikt vilkts pa zemi, ja zirgs aizskrien projām. Lai samazinātu šo risku, ir jāveic vairāki piesardzības pasākumi. Pirmkārt, vairums jātnieku valkā jātnieku zābakus ar papēdi un gludu, diezgan šauru zoli. Tālāk, dažiem segliem, īpaši angļu segliem, ir drošības stienīši, kas ļauj kāpšļa ādas stiprinājumiem nokrist no segliem, jātniekam krītot un paraujot tos uz aizmuguri.
mt: The stirrups are straps that go around the rider's legs, which are attached to each stirrup. They provide greater rider stability, but can cause concern for safety, as the rider's legs can get stuck in them. If the rider is thrown from the horse, but their leg gets caught in the stirrups, the rider can be dragged along the ground if the horse bolts. To reduce this risk, several safety precautions are taken. First, most riders wear riding boots with a stirrup leather and buckle, which is a fairly narrow strap. Next, some stirrups, especially English stirrups, have safety stirrup leathers, which allow the stirrup leather's leather straps to slip off the stirrup, if the rider falls and kicks them back.
ref: Stirrups are supports for the rider's feet that hang down on either side of the saddle. They provide greater stability for the rider but can have safety concerns due to the potential for a rider's feet to get stuck in them. If a rider is thrown from a horse but has a foot caught in the stirrup, they could be dragged if the horse runs away. To minimize this risk, a number of safety precautions can be taken. First, most riders wear riding boots with a heel and a smooth, quite narrow, sole. Next, some saddles, particularly English saddles, have safety bars that allow a stirrup leather to fall off the saddle if pulled backwards by a falling rider.

src: Seglu kāpšļi ir balsti jātnieka kājām, kas karājas katrā seglu pusē. Tie nodrošina lielāku jātnieka stabilitāti, bet var radīt bažas par drošību, jo jātnieka kājas var tajos iestrēgt. Ja jātnieks tiek nomests no zirga, bet viņa kāja ieķeras sedlos, jātnieks var tikt vilkts pa zemi, ja zirgs aizskrien projām. Lai samazinātu šo risku, ir jāveic vairāki piesardzības pasākumi. Pirmkārt, vairums jātnieku valkā jātnieku zābakus ar papēdi un gludu, diezgan šauru zoli. Tālāk, dažiem segliem, īpaši angļu segliem, ir drošības stienīši, kas ļauj kāpšļa ādas stiprinājumiem nokrist no segliem, jātniekam krītot un paraujot tos uz aizmuguri.
mt: The stirrups are straps that go around the rider's legs, which are attached to each stirrup. They provide greater rider stability, but can cause concern for safety, as the rider's legs can get stuck in them. If the rider is thrown from the horse, but their leg gets caught in the stirrups, the rider can be dragged along the ground if the horse bolts. To reduce this risk, several safety precautions are taken. First, most riders wear riding boots with a stirrup leather and buckle, which is a fairly narrow strap. Next, some stirrups, especially English stirrups, have safety stirrup leathers, which allow the stirrup leather's leather straps to slip off the stirrup, if the rider falls and kicks them back.
ref: Stirrups are supports for the rider's feet that hang down on either side of the saddle. They provide greater stability for the rider but can have safety concerns due to the potential for a rider's feet to get stuck in them. If a rider is thrown from a horse but has a foot caught in the stirrup, they could be dragged if the horse runs away. To minimize this risk, a number of safety precautions can be taken. First, most riders wear riding boots with a heel and a smooth, quite narrow, sole. Next, some saddles, particularly English saddles, have safety bars that allow a stirrup leather to fall off the saddle if pulled backwards by a falling rider.

src: Viesmīlības apmaiņas tīkls ir organizācija, kas palīdz ceļotājiem atrast vietējos iedzīvotājus pilsētās, kuras viņi grasās apmeklēt. Lai pievienotos šādam tīklam, parasti ir jāaizpilda tiešsaistes veidlapa, kaut gan daži tīkli piedāvā vai pieprasa papildu verifikāciju. Pieejamo saimnieku sarakstu pēc tam nodrošina drukātā veidā un/vai tiešsaistē, dažkārt ietverot citu ceļotāju atsauces un komentārus. Couchsurfing platforma tika izveidota 2004. gada janvārī pēc tam, kad datorprogrammētājs Keisijs Fentons atrada lētu lidojumu uz Islandi, taču viņam nebija, kur apmesties. Viņš nosūtīja e-pasta ziņojumus vietējās universitātes studentiem un saņēma pārsteidzošu skaitu piedāvājumu nakšņošanai par brīvu.
mt: A hospitality exchange network helps travelers find local residents in the cities they wish to visit. To join such a network, usually an online form must be filled out, although some networks offer or require additional verification. Available host lists are then provided in print and/or online, sometimes including other travelers' reviews and comments. The Couchsurfing platform was created in January 2004 after computer programmer Casey Fenton found a cheap flight to Iceland, but had nowhere to stay. He sent out e-mail messages to students at a local university and received a surprising number of offers to stay for free.
ref: A hospitality exchange network is the organization that connects travelers with locals in the cities they are going to visit. Joining such a network usually just requires filling out an online form; although some networks offer or require additional verification. A listing of available hosts is then provided either in print and/or online, sometimes with references and reviews by other travelers. Couchsurfing was founded in January 2004 after computer programmer Casey Fenton found a cheap flight to Iceland but did not have a place to stay. He emailed students at the local university and received an overwhelming number of offers for free accommodation.

src: Hosteļi galvenokārt apkalpo jaunus cilvēkus – tipisks viesis ir jaunāks par trīsdesmit gadiem, – lai gan tur var sastapt arī vecākus ceļotājus. Ģimenes ar bērniem ir ļoti reta parādība, taču daži hosteļi ļauj tiem apmesties privātās istabās.
mt: Hotels primarily cater to young people – the typical guest is younger than thirty, – although you can find older travelers there. Families with children are a rare sight, but some hotels allow them to stay in private rooms.
ref: Hostels cater primarily to young people – a typical guest is in their twenties – but you can often find older travellers there too. Families with children are a rare sight, but some hostels do allow them in private rooms.

src: Bumeranga mešana ir populāra prasme, ko vēlas apgūt daudzi tūristi. Ja vēlaties iemācīties mest bumerangu, kas atgriežas jūsu rokā, pārliecinieties, ka jums ir piemērots bumerangs, kas atgriežas. Lielākā daļa Austrālijā pieejamo bumerangu patiesībā ir vienvirziena. Iesācējiem ieteicams nemēģināt to mest vējainā
mt: Throwing boomerangs is a popular skill that many tourists want to learn. If you want to learn to throw a boomerang that comes back to you, make sure you have a boomerang that comes back. Most of the boomerangs available in Australia are actually one-way. Beginners are advised not to try to throw it in windy conditions
ref: Boomerang throwing is a popular skill that many tourists want to acquire. If you want to learn throwing a boomerang that comes back to your hand, make sure you have a suitable boomerang for returning. Most boomerangs available in Australia are in fact non-returning. It is best for beginners to not try throwing in windy

src: Ar indonēziešu ēdienu tiek apzīmēta visas valsts reģionālo virtuvju plašā daudzveidība, piedāvājot izvēlēties no 17 000 salām. Taču bez plašākiem paskaidrojumiem šis termins parasti nozīmē pārtiku, kuras izcelsme meklējama galvenās Džavas salas centrālajā un austrumu daļā. Javiešu virtuve, kas tagad ir plaši izplatīta visā arhipelāgā, piedāvā plašu vienkāršu, pikantu ēdienu klāstu. Dominējošās garšas, kam javieši dod priekšroku, ir zemesrieksti, čili, cukurs (īpaši javiešu kokosriekstu cukurs) un dažādas aromātiskas garšvielas.
mt: 17,000 islands is a term used to describe the wide variety of regional cuisine in the country, offering a choice of 17,000 dishes. However, without further explanation, this term usually refers to food originating from the central and eastern part of the main island of Java. The Javanese cuisine, which is now widespread throughout the archipelago, offers a wide range of simple, spicy dishes. The dominant flavors, which Javanese prefer, are earthy, chili, sugar (especially Javanese sugar cane) and various aromatic spices.
ref: With 17,000 islands to choose from, Indonesian food is an umbrella term covering a vast variety of regional cuisines found across the nation. But, if used without further qualifiers, the term tends to mean the food originally from the central and eastern parts of the main island Java. Now widely available throughout the archipelago, Javanese cuisine features an array of simply seasoned dishes, the predominant flavorings the Javanese favor being peanuts, chillies, sugar (especially Javanese coconut sugar) and various aromatic spices.

src: Tiem, kas nezina medicīniskos terminus, vārdi 'infekciozs' un 'lipīgs' ir atšķirīgas nozīmes. Infekciju slimība ir saslimšana, ko izraisa patogēns, piemēram, vīruss, baktērija, sēnīte vai citi parazīti. Lipīga slimība ir slimība, ar ko viegli saslimt, atrodoties inficētas personas tuvumā. Daudzas valdības ir noteikušas, ka iebraucējiem vai iedzīvotājiem, kuri izbrauc no valsts, ir jābūt vakcinētiem pret noteiktām slimībām. Šīs prasības bieži var būt atkarīgas no tā, kuras valstis ceļotājs ir apmeklējis vai plāno apmeklēt.
mt: To those who are not familiar with medical terms, the words "infectious" and "contagious" have different meanings. An infectious disease is an illness caused by a pathogen, such as a virus, bacteria, fungus or other parasite. A contagious disease is an illness that is easily contracted, by being in close proximity to infected persons. Many governments have enacted laws that require travelers or residents leaving the country to be vaccinated against certain diseases. These requirements often depend on which countries the traveler has visited or plans to visit.
ref: For those unfamiliar with medical jargon, the words infectious and contagious have distinct meanings. An infectious disease is one that is caused by a pathogen, such as a virus, bacterium, fungus or other parasites. A contagious disease is a disease which is easily transmitted by being in the vicinity of an infected person. Many governments require visitors entering, or residents leaving, their countries to be vaccinated for a range of diseases. These requirements may often depend on what countries a traveller has visited or intends to visit.
